loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 58, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, sell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Liza hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to have her own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero y está domiciliada en Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Esperanza se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos. Adicionalmente elabora soya para la venta.

Esperanza desea comprar más animales para engorde y comprar insumos para la elaboración de soya.  Esto le permitirá atender a más clientes en ambos negocios.  Ante ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 48, is single and lives in Lambayeque, an area with a decent amount of commercial activity. It's part of the province of the same name and is located twenty minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. Esperanza raises and sells livestock. She raises chickens and ducks and other small animals in her backyard and when they've grown to a big enough size she sells them to the buyers who come through her area frequently. This provides her with a stable source of income, though she also grows and sells soy beans. 

Esperanza hopes to buy more animals to raise and buy materials for growing soy. This will allow her to serve more customers in both lines of business. She believes a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa [Kiva field partner] is a good way to help her achieve her objectives.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and buy materials for growing soy.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en: Ediltrudes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shells crafting business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business. NWTF is presenting Ediltrudes's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shells craft business.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es:
María, necesita invertir más en la compra y venta de leche, cuajada, pan francés y la elaboración de atoles y tamales, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, azúcar, elotes, leña, pan francés, yuca, etc. Esto le ayudara a tener una mejor estabilidad en su negocio.
Ella manifiesta que gracias al préstamo anterior incremento el porcentaje de ganancia y tuvo una mejor tranquilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, ella sigue igual con su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria needs to invest more in the purchasing and selling of milk, curd, French bread, and the making of hot maize drinks and tamales. This is why she is asking for a new loan for the purchase of cornflour, sugar, corncobs, firewood, French bread, yuca, etc. This will help her have more stability with her business. 

She says that thanks to the last loan, she increased her percentage of gains and had greater ease in making her loan payments. Things are the same with her regarding her business and her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, sugar, corncobs, firewood, French bread, yuca.

loans.name: Doruntinë

texts.en:
Doruntinë is a twenty-four-year-old single woman. She lives with her entire family in a small village. Currently, she works for a private printing company earning a very low salary. She is very ambitious and hardworking. Recently she started her own business harvesting apples to sell. As her family owned a large parcel of land already, she is able to use this area to grow and plant fruit. 

This business will be very “fruitful”, however in the beginning it requires more commitment of time and effort before it can just be maintained while still making lot of income. Doruntinë is in need of a loan to prepare the land for the harvest. This loan will help her to start the business. In the future she hopes over three years to be able to sell 3,000 kg of apples. 

She is very grateful for the loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To prepare the land for the harvest

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Jean has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from general store.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Khalida is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide her family a better living. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of rice and flour, sugar, and pulses from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour, sugar, and pulses (lentils) from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Jinefer

texts.en:
Jinefer is 43 years old and has two children. Jinefer is married and both of her children are in school.

Jinefer is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more piglets and feed.

Jinefer has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jinefer would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 27 year old, hardworking, man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been operating a video library and with the profits earned he has been able to pay the school fees for his young brothers and, also, invest in secretarial services as an additional income source. His major clients are schools and party organizers.

Jacob’s dream is to construct his own house to live in, since he is currently living in a rented house. Jacob is requesting for the loan facility to buy building materials, such as cement and bricks, to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct his house.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

NWTF is relisting Mauricia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita is a 52 year old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children: aged twenty-five, twenty-two and fifteen years old. She has been in the hog raising business for three years. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional piglets and feeds like hog mash and hog grower pellets. In the future, Pedrita would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, necesita comprar un aparato soldador para su taller, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar el aparato, ya que es fundamental para realizar mejor su trabajo y brindarles mejor trabajo a sus clientes.

Jose, mantiene en su taller lo necesario y con el préstamo anterior adquirió para su taller un compresor el cual utiliza diariamente para hacer su trabajo y gracias a ello ha mejorado la clientela y su situación económica para su familia.
texts.en:
José needs to buy soldering equipment for his shop. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can complete this purchase. This equipment is essential for helping him do better work and provide better service to his customers.

José maintains his shop with whatever he needs. With his previous loan, he acquired a compressor that he uses each day for the work he performs in his shop. Thanks to this purchase, he was able to improve his clientele and his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.es: Abilio, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Union Lempira. hace 11 años que Abilio se dedica a su propio negocio donde presta el servicio de reparacion de llantas para vehiculos, motocicleta, bicicletas,microbus y camiones. el tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que desde muy joven aprendio a reparar llantas en un taller. Abilio esta solicitando ya un segundo prestamo el cual es por 27,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de una maquina desarmadora de llantas de vehiculo y compra de repuestos para dicha reparacion. tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio, brindar un mejor servicio con la adquisision d ela maquina y mejorar su calidad de vida y darle una buena educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Abilio is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the town of La Union, Lempira. For the past 11 years, Abilio has managed his own business in which he provides tire repair services for vehicles such as motorcycles, bicycles, minibuses, and cargo trucks. He has plenty of experience in this line of work since he learned how to repair tires at an auto shop when he was a young man.

Abilio is requesting his second loan in the amount of 27,000 HNL so that he can invest in a tire mounting machine and parts to use in making repairs. His goal is to grow his business and provide better service by acquiring equipment. This will enable him to improve his quality of life and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a tire mounting machine and spare parts.

loans.name: Kene Maria

texts.es: Kene  de 29 años de edad, vive con su madre su hermano y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad, al sur de la ciudad en un barrio tradicional al sur de la ciudad; allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías, como sabanas, prendas de oro, acero y plata, además de toallas y cubrelechos; con esta  actividad que inició hace menos de 2 años, ha logrado generar ingresos,  para sostener su  pequeña hijo de 4 años, con el cual sueña ver convertido en un hombre exitoso y por eso se esmera trabajando incesantemente. Cuando inició el negocio, su esposo recién separado de su hogar, le dio $1.000.000 COP, dinero con el que inició su emprendimiento, así fue como invirtió en mercancías, y vendiéndolas en un nicho de mercado, muy doméstico, que hoy se ha extendido porque le ha ido muy bien, por eso está entusiasmada en hacer crecer su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual aplica aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, prendas de oro, de plata y de acero, así como ropa para habitaciones y calzado; estos artículos han sido encargados por su clientela , cuando tomó su pedido en la preventa que Kene acostumbra a hacer mensualmente y que venderá a crédito a su clientela, que ha escogido muy cuidadosamente para cuidar cada vez mas su capital de trabajo y también poder responderles oportunamente cuando estos lo soliciten.
texts.en:
Kene, age 29, lives with her mother, brother, and her baby 4-year-old boy in the south end of the city in an established neighborhood. There, she sells a variety of merchandise like sheets, towels, bedspreads, as well as gold, silver, and metal jewelry. Through this trade, which she started less than 2 years ago, she has managed to earn an income to sustain her little 4-year-old, who she hopes to see grow up to be a successful man and for whose account she makes certain to keep herself working all the time.  

When she started the business, her recently separated husband gave her 1,000,000 pesos [COP] to start her enterprise. That's how she was able to invest in merchandise and sell it in her market niche, the domestic arena, which has expanded and gone very well. That's why she's enthusiastic about making her business grow more. This is why she's applying for a loan, her first from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Kiva field partner], which she will use to buy gold, silver, and metal jewelry, as well as casual clothing and footwear. These are the items that her customers order when she makes her monthly rounds and that she sells to them on credit. She is very cautious in selecting her clientele in order to keep up her capital stock and at the same time be able to meet their needs when they place an order.

loans.use: to buy gold, silver, and metal jewelry, as well as casual clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more raw materials, like fabric, thread and other materials. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell for a profit

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 51-year-old married woman who has two family members. She is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 500 to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy new furniture and some households items. She wants to buy a new home and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Nelsy

texts.es:
Nelsy de 24 años convive con Fredy, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Nelsy es una joven trabajadora. Ella se califica como una persona entusiasta y responsable en sus actividades. Se dedica a varias labores, una de ellas la agricultura; pero la que más satisfacciones le brinda es la atención de su negocio de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, refrescos, cervezas y helados de crema. Para ello instaló un ambiente con mesas y sillas, con la intención de atender a sus clientes. “En mi local los clientes se sienten cómodos, porque les pongo la música que quieren y porque el lugar es acogedor”, menciona.
La ventaja que Nelsy tiene es el clima caluroso de su zona, por eso no le faltan consumidores.
Ella requiere de su apoyo, una vez más, para ampliar su local, ya que muchas veces tiene mayor afluencia de clientes e improvisa lugares para atenderlos. Éste es su préstamo número 3 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y se siente contenta de tener socios participativos. Destinará los 2000 soles en la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Nelsy, 24 years old, lives with Fredy, with whom she has 2 children, ages 3 and 1. They reside in their own house located in a native community in the central jungle. Nelsy is a young worker. She would qualify as an enthusiastic and responsible person in her activities. Nelsy is involved in various jobs, one of which is farming. But the one that gives her most satisfaction is running a business selling iced drinks, including sodas, soft drinks, beer, and ice cream. To do that, she created an ambience with tables and chairs, in order to attend to her customers. “In my shop,” she remarks, “the customers feel comfortable, because there is music they like and because the place is agreeable.”

The advantage Nelsy has is the zone's warm climate; for that reason, she never lacks consumers. She needs your help, once again, to expand her shop, since often, she has more customers coming in and she has to improvise to find places to serve them. 

This is her 3rd loan with MFP. Nelsy promises to make her payments punctually. She belongs to the “New Dawn of the Village” communal bank, and feels content to have such participative fellow members. This 2,000 new sols will be used to purchase tables and chairs to expand her shop.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for her soda shop.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy, 37, resident of Batasan, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a businesswoman, and a father to his children. Together with his wife, he manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remy operates a market stall. He sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. He buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells by the kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Remy dreams of having his own house and a good future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits that he will sell in the market.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 68 years old and widowed. She lives in Lobogon, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Salud sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years.  She is also an Avon dealer. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase piglets and feed.

Salud has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Salud hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feed

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 28 años, está casado, tiene 1 hijo recién nacido. Se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir de todo tipo, el tiempo que lleva en la actividad es de 8 años aproximadamente, realiza sus costuras de propia producción y también servicios de costura para empresas privadas que le provee de todos los insumos para la confección de las prendas. Tiene clientela formada en zonas de la capital según los pedidos que realizan sus clientes, gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su esposa están saliendo adelante.
Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de tela, para poder trabajar y seguir con lo que hace. Esta muy contento por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is 28 years old, married, and has a newborn child. He produces all types of clothing and has been in business for approximately eight years. Juan makes these garments himself, but he also provides sewing services to private companies that supply him with all the implements that he needs to produce clothes. Juan has established customers from the various districts of the capital and he performs his work according to their orders. Thanks to his efforts, he and his wife have been able to move forward.

Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy pieces of cut fabric so that he can continue his work. He is very pleased with the assistance he has received since this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy pieces of cut fabric.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma.Luz is 34 years old and married, with three children, who are in school.  Ma.Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Luz runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma.Luz has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Ma.Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema de 40 años convive con Nikeas con quien tiene 5 hijos de, 17, 15, 14, 10 y 7 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Ema es una mujer hacendosa y alegre. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 17 años. Al lado de su pareja trabajan la tierra con ahínco.
En terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó y en otras que compraron, Ema produce maíz, yuca, plátano, papaya, y otras frutas.
“Cada vez que cosecho llevó mis productos hasta el mercado mayorista, pero hay ocasiones en que los mismos compradores vienen hasta mis parcelas”, comenta orgullosa.
Este mes necesita realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos, además de esparcir abono y fertilizantes. Menciona que en el mes de diciembre, sus productos aumentarán su precio, por eso requiere de su apoyo, para continuar con sus planes. Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” y se siente contenta de tener socios responsables.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánicos para sus cultivos de plátanos, maíz y otras frutas.
texts.en:
Ema, age 40, lives along with Nikeas, with whom she has five children, ages 17, 15, 14, 10, and 7. They live in their own modest but tidy home, located in an indigenous community in the central jungle. Ema is a hard-working and happy woman who has been working in agriculture for 17 years. Together with her partner, they work their fields with determination. Ema grows corn, yuca, plantains, and other fruits on lands that were granted to her by the community and on some that she bought herself. "Every time I have a harvest, I take my produce to the wholesale market, but every so often those same buyers will come out to my fields themselves," she tells us with pride.     

This month she needs to tidy up her crops and spread manure and fertilizer. She mentions that in December her produce goes up in price, and that's why she needs support to keep going with her plans. This will be her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner] and she promises to make her monthly payments on time. She belongs to the 'Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea" community bank and feels satisfied to be in the company of other responsable members. She will invest 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] in buying sacks of natural fertilizers for her plantain, corn, and other fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Minonkpo Group

texts.fr: MINONKPO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Alexandrine (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un menuisier nommé Gabriel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Alexandrine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari dans une ville du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Alexandrine vend depuis sept ans déjà, des vêtements et des sous-vêtements dans un marché du Bénin de façon ambulante. Alexandrine s’approvisionne au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Alexandrine désire obtenir un autre financement. C'est pour cette raison que Alexandrine sollicite un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MINONKPO
texts.en:
The group MINONKPO consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Alexandrine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Alexandrine, age 35, is married to a carpenter named Gabriel and they have three children who go to school. Alexandrine lives with her husband and their children in a city of Benin, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Alexandrine has been selling clothing and undergarments for seven years. She conducts her sales at a market in Benin and door-to-door. She buys her merchandise in Benin. She has been collaborating with ALIDé for a long time and has repaid past loans without incident. 

To strengthen her activity and meet customer demand, Alexandrine needs additional funding. To that end, she is seeking a new loan together with the other members of the group MINONKPO.

loans.use: to buy clothing and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong was born in 1971. She has three children. Her little child is learning in kindergarten. Her oldest child is studying at college. Her husband sells beer for a living. Luong sells cosmetic and grocery goods for a living. She gains 3,000,000 VND a month from her business. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more cosmetics for her store. Her dream is to enable her children to go to school up through higher education and to upgrade her cosmetic store.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jodema

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jodema works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Jodema is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Jodema has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 61-year-old man. He is a father to four sons and two daughters; their ages are between 17 and 33 years old.

Mohammad is a taxi driver. He takes internal requests and has a good reputation among customers. His business has been profitable, but as it is the only source of income to the family, more support is needed to cover the costs and the family's needs.

Mohammad has completed construction of his house, and now he wants to finish it by installing tiles and windows. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD from Faten for this purpose.

Taking this loan will offer Mohammad and his family suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house. Mohammad is photographed in the location of his new house.

loans.use: To finish his house with tiles and windows

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Victoria is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria Victoria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca  tiene 62 años tiene 2 hijos ya todos independientes, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos de dormitorio como juego de sabanas, edredones  y almohadas, ella  entrega a distintos  puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que le hacen pedidos ella entrega sus productos a crédito, la Sra. Blanca vive en su domicilio que  se encuentra en la zona de primero de Mayo,  este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Blanca va a usar este préstamo para la remodelación de su departamento ya que hay muchas cosas que se están  deteriorando y necesita este cambio por comodidad para ella,  Sra. Blanca enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de productos, la Sra. Blanca se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca, age 62, has two grown children and works as a general vendor, selling various household items like sheets, comforters, and pillows. She goes to different markets and door-to-door to take orders and makes sales on credit. Ms. Blanca lives in her home in the May 1st district. This loan will be the first she has taken with Emprender [Kiva field partner]. She will use it to make some repairs to her apartment, as there are a lot of things in disrepair that she needs to fix up for her own comfort. Ms. Blanca does encounter some obstacles in her business due to the demand for new products and she will use some of this loan to better meet the needs of her customers by buying a wider variety of products. Ms. Blanco feels happy and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided by granting her this loan.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her apartment.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emilia has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish to souse and dry for resale.

Emilia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Emilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to souse and dry for resale.

loans.name: Amis De Jesus Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMIS DE JESUS est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jeanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 42 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Mesmin. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne vend des produits cosmétiques et des produits de toilette depuis près de huit ans. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jeanne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMIS DE JESUS, ce troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group “Amis de Jésus” (friends of Jesus) is composed of three persons residing in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, named Jeanne, is raising her hand in the photo. Jeanne is 42 years old; she left school at the primary level. Jeanne is married to a mechanic named Mesmin. The couple has four dependent children, who all go to school. Three of the children are their own.  Jeanne lives together with her children and husband. The couple supports the household together.

To pay for her various expenses, Jeanne has been selling beauty and personal care products for almost eight years. Jeanne gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and to better satisfy her clients, Jeanne wants to increase her stock. To do so, she is requesting this third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of group “Amis de Jésus.”

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal care products.

loans.name: Marush

texts.en:
Marush lives in Nor Dvin village, Ararat region, with her husband and two sons. Marush and her husband run a farm, where they raise pigs, cultivate watermelon and grow fruit trees. 

Marush needs some investment to continue development of their farm and cattle breeding efforts. With the requested amount she wants to purchase forage for the pigs. In addition, Marush will purchase fertilizer for cultivating the land and to cover the land watering costs. Implemenation of all these goals will allow Marush to have stable income from agriculture and cover her household costs.

loans.use: to pay for watering the land, fertilizer and forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush lives in Artashat town, Ararat region, with her husband, mother-in-law and 2 little daughters. Although Siranush's husband is a musician, the main source of income for the family is agriculture. The couple raises chickens, grows tomatoes, peppers, fruit trees and keeps a grape orchard. Siranush would like to expand her farm by purchasing more land, where she will be able to cultivate more vegetables and grow more fruit trees. Siranush also needs some means to purchase stakes for the grape orchard. Expansion of the farm means an increase in agricultural income, which is vital for Siranush to cover the costs of raising her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and stakes for the grape orchard

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Esterlita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Esterlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Haifa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Haifa is a 37-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who has two family members.

She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and to do other home maintenance. She hopes in the future to buy a new home and a car.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Lolita, a resident of the Intramuros district in Manila City, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, and a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Lolita believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lolita operates an internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for to complete school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the internet and any social network. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Merly has been in this business for two years. Merly earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six. According to Shahida, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses for the family alone, so Shahida took the initiative to start her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She excels in her work of stitching and counts a good client list. Shahida stitches gloves and clothes on customers' demand at home. She makes enough to lead a decent life.

At this time, she is very much satisfied and had requested a repeat loan of PKR 10,000. This will help her to purchase bundles of wool and reels of threads in various colors with packs of buttons and zips. She hopes to increase her income through her large sales during the winter season. She intends to use the earned profit on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wool and reels of threads in various colors with packs of buttons and zips.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, necesita más capital de trabajo para el negocio de venta de tamales, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, frijol, leña y demás cosas necesarias para la elaboración de los tamales y así poder seguir con venta, manteniendo a la mano los materiales necesarios.
Maria, gracias al préstamo anterior  fortaleció su negocio y con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia, ella sigue con su venta todos los días y manteniendo a su familia de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María sells tamales and she is in need of an increase in her working capital for her activity. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, firewood and other items she needs to have in stock to prepare her tamales in order to continue carrying out her activity.
Thanks to the previous loan María has succeeded in strengthening her activity, and she has been able to help her family with the money she has earned. She keeps on selling her products on a daily basis, providing for her family with her income.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and firewood.

loans.name: Asifiwe Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est présidente d’un groupe de crédit Asifiwe Yesu, âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un chauffeur. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima vers les années 2005. Actuellement, elle est au 25e cycle de crédit. Elle a tiré plus d’avantages dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima, dit-elle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 fus d’huile de palme. Dans les jours à venir, elle ambitionne acheter un véhicule pour son mari. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en:
This client, Kavira, is the president of loan group Asifiwe Yesu. She is 38 years old. She is married and a mother of seven young children. Her husband is a driver.

This client retails palm oil. She launched her business with a loan from IMF Hekima around the year 2005. She is currently on her 25th loan cycle. She reports having been more successful with Hekima’s micro-lending program.  This new loan will allow her to procure a barrel of palm oil.

Her ambition is to purchase a vehicle for her husband in coming days. She thanks Hekima for its help and for empowering women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy one barrel of palm oil.

loans.name: Rostiko

texts.en:
Rostiko is a 49-year-old married man with eight children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. After realising that he could not meet his everyday expenses through farming alone, he decided to trade in produce. He has been in the produce business for the last 15 years. 

He obtained capital from farming and contracts to collect market dues. Although inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders his business, his dream is to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Rostiko intends to use this loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 22-year-old single man who attends university to study accounting. There are six siblings in the family, so his parents have a lot of financial responsibilities. Therefore, Odai started working at a fast food restaurant to be able to support himself and help the family. 

Odai has now applied for another loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees. After graduation he hopes to work in the accounting field and register to get an MA degree as well.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Los Jardines Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel Susana tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que aun están bajo su cuidado. Ella se dedica desde hace casi 8 años a la prepración y venta de ceviche de pota, todos los días se ubica frente a la puerta de un colegio, donde sus principales consumidores son los alumnos. le ha ido bien, pero le agradaría más adelante tener un restaurante cevichería en un local que esté ubicado en una zona comercial.
Isabel Susana, forma parte del grupo "Los Jardines" que está integrado por 6 socios, es un grupo que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
Isabel Susana invertirá el préstamo recibido en la compra de utensilio e insumos para la preparación del ceviche.
texts.en:
Isabel Susana is 36 years old, married and has five children who are still under her care. She has been making a living in preparing and selling squid ceviche. She is in front of the school entrance every day and her main customers are the students. It has been going well, but she would like to open a ceviche restaurant located in a commercial area someday.

Isabel Susana is part of the "Los Jardines" group, which consists of six members. It is a group that has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in their payments.

Isabel Susana will invest the loan she receives in the purchase of dishes and supplies for the preparation of ceviche.

loans.use: to purchase dishes and supplies for the preparation of ceviche.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new electric sewing machine and repair others.

loans.name: Norhoda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Norhoda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Norhoda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. Norhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is widowed. She is 50 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She has a general store and engages in snack vending to earn a living. 

Annabelle has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Annabelle would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 32, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Roel, a porter, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household with her husband while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jocelyn earns her income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn dreams of improving her way of living and hopes to give a good quality education to her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits for a fruit selling business

loans.name: Ann Baba Sairam Self Help Group

texts.en:
Ann Baba Sairam Self Help Group is located in the village of Balipatna of Odisha, India, and has 13 members. All members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. Premalta is the President of the group and is standing holding a register and wearing a blue saree.

Premalta, 30, lives with her husband and their two school-aged children in a humble home. Premalta’s husband works as a farmer in the village. To help supplement income for their family, Premalta has engaged herself in the activity of agriculture: she grows paddy in her field and sells it with the help of her husband. She has requested a loan for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.name: Remy

texts.es:
Remy tiene 29 años, convive con Alfredo con quien tiene 3 hijos 11, 9 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en un hogar propio, que construyeron en una comunidad nativa en la selva central. Remy es una madre cariñosa. A la vez es una mujer trabajadora. Desde los 18 años se dedica a la agricultura, con el cultivo de frutas como: papayas, carambolas y plátanos.
“Me conviene producir estos productos, porque el trabajo no es tan cansado, y así puedo atender a mis hijos”, menciona. Alfredo también trabaja en el campo. Ambos recorren los cultivos y con las herramientas, limpian las plantas que interrumpen el crecimiento de sus frutos.
Sus ventas son buenas, cuando ofrece sus productos frescos. Por eso cada vez que cosecha, traslada sus productos hasta ele mercado mayorista. De lo contrario, sus frutos podrían malograrse.
Esta vez, ella requiere de su ayuda, para comprar bolsas de fertilizantes, para sus cultivos. Éste es su préstamo número 6 con MFP. Como en ocasiones anteriores de compromete en ser puntual con los pagos. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y se siente feliz de tener compañeros participativos.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir 10 bolsas de guano de corral, para sus cultivos de frutas como papayas, carambolas y plátanos.
texts.en:
Remy, 29, lives with Alfredo with whom she has three children, ages 11, 9, and 7. The family lives in its own home, which they built in a native community in the central forest. Remy is both a loving mother and a hard worker. She has been growing fruits such as papaya, star fruit, and plantains since she was 18. "I like growing these products because the work is not so tiring and I can take care of my children," she says. Alfredo also works in the fields. Both work the crops and use various tools to clear plants that stifle the fruits' growth.

Sales are good because they offer fresh products. To do this, they must transport the products to the wholesale market each time they harvest. Otherwise, the fruits could spoil. Now Remy needs help to buy bags of fertilizer for her crops. This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP, and, as with prior loan cycles, she promises to make her payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea,” and she is happy to have active partners. She will use the loan to buy 10 bags of poultry guano for her papaya, star fruit, and plantain plants.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of poultry guano to use as organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Solita works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming coconut and producing dried coconut meat. Solita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell for her dry goods business.

Solita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1987. She has two children who are little. Her husband and she have been carpenters for seven years. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy tools and equipment for doing carpentry. She always wants to raise her children well and open a carpentry workshop with modern tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for doing carpentry.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Masindi, Uganda.He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his six grandchildren. For 35 years, he has been growing crops and rearing livestock. With the money earned he was able to pay school fees for his children and build a house where he is currently residing. His business is located in a rural area and his major clients are schools. Fred began farming in order to prepare for himself for his retirement in future.

Challenges of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital not withstanding, he dreams of setting up sustainable projects as he is nearing retirement. Fred is requesting a loan to buy seedlings to plant for this season.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant for this season.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is married with three children. Analie is 34 years old and lives in Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City.

Analie sells soft drinks and other inventory goods to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to buy soft drinks and other inventory goods.

Analie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Analie hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks & other inventory goods

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong was born in 1979. She has two children who are studying at primary school. Her husband is a utility repairman. 

Hong cooks food for vegetarians and makes 3,000,000 dong (VND) per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

Hong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more ingredients to cook vegetarian dishes in the market. Her dream is to let her children go to school up to higher education and to upgrade her food stall.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook vegetarian dishes in the market.

loans.name: Rosa Marilyn

texts.es: Sra.  Rosa  tiene 25 años, ella se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Tembladerani y también los vende de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosa va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Rosa va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 and sells cosmetics by catalog. She sells her products from a stall in Tembladerani. She also visits homes and public and private offices in La Paz to offer her products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. 

Rosa will use the loan to buy wholesale cosmetics and jewelry at a discount so that she can offer her customers more variety and increase her profits. She is requesting the loan to grow her business and will use the profits to add a variety of beauty products. Rosa is hardworking and thankful for the opportunity she is being offered.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Ata

texts.en: Ata is a 25-year-old single guy. He has two older siblings. Ata owns a barber shop that he wants to improve. He wants to buy more tools for the shop and for that reason he has applied for this loan. In the future, he is planning on opening another branch in a different area so he can expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more tools for a barber shop

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan started to work as a teacher in the daytime and kept working with his talent and painting in the afternoon. He used the previous loan and got a new set of brushes and other painting tools. But now he is thinking of improving the business further and doing more paintings, so he would launch his own art gallery; for that reason,  he has applied for this loan to get more paints and again, more tools.

loans.use: to get more paints and again, more tools

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda.She has been operating a retail shop for three years where she sells general merchandise such as salt and sugar among others. With income that she earns, she has been able to buy land for farming and provide the basics to her children. She is charged with the responsibility of raising three children and her dream is to see them attain degrees as minimum qualification. Inadequate capital to purchase enough stock hinders her business. Her dream is to  expand her business into new markets. Jane is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat was born in 1983. She has two children who are learning at primary school. Her husband and she sew canvas bags to earn a living. They have done this work for 8 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy materials to sew more canvas bags. She always wants to let her children go to school till they achieve higher education.

loans.use: to buy material to sew more canvas bags.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline is aged 50. She is a mother of two children. She has spent 18 years in the business. She would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to get a machine for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy glue and other materials for box-making and -selling business

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est conseillère du groupement d’affaire Asifiwe, jeune entrepreneur, célibataire, âgée de 21 ans. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle fait également la coupe couture. De lors qu’elle a raté son parcours scolaire, elle a fait la formation de petits métiers. Elle s’entraide avec sa maman dans ces petites activités. Elle est sociétaire d’un atelier de couture. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sac de haricots, 1 sac d’arachides, huiles, etc., et une autre somme de crédit sera affectée dans son atelier de couture. Le grand défi qu’elle connait dans son activité est la multiplicité de taxe. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en: Furaha is the leader of the Asifiwe group. She is a 21-year old single entrepreneur. She sells staple foods. She also works as a seamstress. Since dropping out of school, she has been learning various trades. She has learned from her mother. She is a member of a sewing shop. She launched her business with her own funds. Later on, she requested support from IMF Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up by buying two bags of beans, one bag of peanuts, vegetable oil, etc.; one part of the loan will also be used for her sewing shop. Her main challenge in her business are various taxes and fees. She thanks Hekima for its support and for helping women who are small business owners become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy two bags of beans, one bag of peanuts, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: Saludos Cordiales!!! Les presento a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Orquideas” la cual está conformada por 08 mujeres  trabajadoras, dicho grupo pasan a su 3er ciclo. En esta oportunidad conocerán mas sobre nuestra socia Nilda  de 21 años de edad, conviviente y por el momento  no tiene hijos. En el transcurso de su vida Nilda se ha dedicado a distintas actividades comerciales como a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, actualmente inicio su nuevo negocio de  ventas de ropas, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Gracias a su arduo trabajo Nilda ha logrado cumplir algunas de sus metas, comprar su propio terreno. Su último crédito lo destinara para la compra de prendas de vestir. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo “Las Orquideas” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por hacer posible su progreso. Nilda es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color plomo.
texts.en:
Hello from the eight hardworking members of the communal bank “Las Orquideas,” which is in its third loan cycle. One of the members is 21-year-old Nilda, who lives with her partner and has no children yet.  She has done a variety of commercial activities over the years, such as selling basic household items, and now she has a new business selling clothing by order.

With hard work, Nilda has achieved some of her goals, including buying land. She used her last loan to purchase clothing. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house. The communal bank “Las Orquideas” thanks the Kiva lenders for making its progress possible. Nilda is the first woman on the right and is wearing a grey blouse.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique de 46 años, está casado con María con quien tiene 6 hijos. Todos ello viven en una casa rústica que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.

Enrique es un hombre muy responsable. Desde los 16 años trabajaba la tierra y por eso ahora es un gran agricultor. 
En sus parcelas de terrenos que su comunidad le otorgó, produce frutas como carambolas, plátanos, naranjas y limones. 
“Estos frutos son rentables, porque se cosechan varias veces en el año, especialmente los plátanos, ya que cada quince días se cosechan”, menciona.
Él se siente contento con su trabajo, porque le grandes satisfacciones, una de ellas fue ampliar su producción, comprándose otros terrenos.
Una de sus dificultades es la falta de capital. Ahora le urge limpiar y mantener sus cultivos, por eso solicita de su ayuda. Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Agradece todo el apoyo brindado en ocasiones anteriores. Por su parte, se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y es el presidente.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de frutas.
texts.en:
Enrique is 46 years old and is married to Maria with whom he has 6 children. They all live together in a house they built in an indigenous community in the central jungle. 

Enrique is a responsible man. He has been working the land since he was 16 years old and so now he is an excellent farmer. He grows fruit such as, star fruit, bananas, oranges and lemons in the plots of land given to him by the community. He says, "These fruits are profitable because they can be harvested many times a year, especially bananas as they can be harvested every 15 days." 

Enrique likes his job because it gives him great satisfaction. One of the best moments was when he increased production by buying more land. One of the difficulties that Enrique faces is lack of money. Now he needs to sustain and clear his crops and in order to do so he is requesting a loan. 

This will be his seventh loan through MFP. He is grateful for all the help provided on previous occasions. For his part, he promises to pay the monthly installments on time. He belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea" [New Sunrise of the Village] where he is the president. With the money he will be able to buy bags of fertilizer for his fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz de 42 años de edad, es una mujer que conforma su familia con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2 a 24 años.   Con su esposos se ideó ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de maquinas para lavar ropa, con el fin de genera ingresos suficientes con los cuales sostener su hogar. Su negocio consiste en rentar estas máquinas por horas a toda la comunidad del barrio, que la requiere diariamente de acuerdo a su programación doméstica. El esposo de Luz es quien en una motocicleta, transporta las lavadoras a los domicilios de quienes las alquilan y regresa por ellas de acuerdo a lo convenido. Su clientela está muy acreditada y pertenece a varios sectores circunvecinos; Luz también genera ingresos mediante el oficio de pastelería y patillaje; ella elabora las mas deliciosas tortas, ponqués, pudines y realiza todo tipo de figuras comestibles en azúcar, porque conoce perfectamente  la técnica del patillaje y esto hace que todo el año, le soliciten productos de este tipo, para la celebración de fiestas familiares como primeras comuniones, matrimonios, bautizos etc. Luz es una mujer brillante y le gusta perfeccionar su arte, por eso se preocupa por perfeccionar su arte a través de procesos formativos y a través de revistas, con el fin de conocer las últimas técnicas de decoración y pastelería. En la actualidad está preparándose para recibir el fin de año y los pedidos de postres, pudines y ponqués son mayores, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva con el cual comprará insumos como azúcar, harinas, margarinas colorantes etc. y también aplicará otra parte del dinero,  en el mantenimiento y la reparación de algunas de sus máquinas, para que continúen funcionando como cuando eran nuevas.
texts.en: Luz is 42 years old. She is a woman whose family consists of her husband and their 4 children, ages 2 to 24. With her husband, she had the idea to offer a rental service for washing machines, with the goal of generating sufficient income to support their household. Her business consists of renting these machines by the hour to everyone in the neighborhood, and it requires her daily attention, according to her household schedule. Luz's husband is the one who transports the machines by motorcycle to the houses of those who rent them and returns with them according to the agreement. Her customers are very trustworthy and are from various neighboring areas. Luz also generates income through the craft of making pastry and decorating cakes. She makes the most delicious tortes, cakes, and puddings, and creates every type of edible figure in sugar, because she knows cake decorating technique perfectly, and she does this all year long. Customers order products of this type for family celebrations such as first communions, weddings, baptisms, etc. Luz is a vibrant person, and she likes to perfect her art, and so she takes care to perfect her art through training and through magazines, with the goal of knowing the latest techniques of decoration and pastry-making. Now she is getting ready for the end of the year, and the orders for desserts, puddings, and cakes are greater. For this reason, she has turned to a Kiva loan, with which she will buy ingredients such as sugar, flours, coloring for margarine, etc., and she will also apply part of the money to maintain and repair some of her machines, so that they continue functioning as when they were new.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, and coloring for margarine

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos menores de edad cursan educación básica, el negocio de Ana lo tiene desde hace dos años, comercializa las prendas de vestir con sus vecinos y en otras zonas de forma ambulante, su horario es por las mañanas y las tardes, este negocio siempre le ha gustado realizarlo y lo aprendió junto con una amiga.

Ana está solicitando un préstamo para poderlo invertir en la compra de blusas y ropa interior, para poder aumentar la capacidad del negocio y la variedad. Este crédito será un gran aporte para que ella pueda montar mejor estilos en su mercadería y así ayudar a su hogar con ello mejorar ingresos.

El sueño de ella es poder instalar un negocio en un local fijo o en su vivienda, enseñarle a sus hijos a trabajar honradamente y además poder mejorar su condición de vida inculcandoles la educación para que se superen a futuro.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothes. She lives with her family and has two underage children that attend school. Ana started her business two years ago. She sells her goods to neighbors and also visits other areas, where she sells on the street. Her work schedule covers the morning and the afternoon. She has always liked her activity, which she learned from a friend. 
Ana is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of blouses and underwear in order to increase her business capacity and variety. The loan will help her to include more styles and hence to increase her household income. Ana's dream is to have her business completely established, either at a shop or at her home; to teach her kids to make an honest living and to improve their quality of live, educating them so they can move forward in the future.

loans.use: to purchase blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Sra. Justina tiene 31 años es casada tiene dos  hijos que tienen la edad de uno y cuatro años, ella se dedica a la confección de chalecos, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Justina  utilizara este préstamo para compra de una maquina Over y  telas por rollo para la confección de sus chalecos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Justina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir, la Sra. Justina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Justina is 31, married, and has two children, ages one and four. She makes vests, a business she has had for several years. Her workshop is in Pampahasi, and this is her first loan cycle with the institution. Justina will use the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and rolls of fabric to make vests. She is applying for the loan because she lacks working capital.

Justina faces challenges, such as improving the quality of her merchandise, and will use her profits to increase her working capital. She wants to grow her business and increase the selection of vests she makes. She is happy and grateful for the support the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili de 29 años convive con Nestor, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 12 y 6 años, y un bebé de 8 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en una rústica que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Lili es una madre dulce y trabajadora. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, con la producción de frutos cítricos como naranjas, mandarinas, tanyelos (injertos), además cultiva plátanos, carambolas y cacao.
Sus parcelas de cultivos están dispersas en otras comunidades. Es un trabajo cansado para ella, atender todos sus cultivos, pero lo hace con esmero, porque sabe que al final las recompensas serán buenas.
Con la ayuda de su esposo puede realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos, especialmente del cacao, que requiere mayor atención.
Este mes está cosechando naranjas y carambolas, y espera que en 3 meses consiga buenos frutos de cacao. Para ello solicita de su ayuda para adquirir bolsas abono orgánico. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea”, y manifiesta que sus socios son cumplidos y pagadores. 
Con los 2000 soles podrá comprar 20 bolsas de abono orgánico entre guano de corral y guano de isla, para sus cultivos de cacao y plátanos.
texts.en:
Lili is 29 years old and lives with Nestor, with whom she has three children aged twelve and six, as well as a 8-month-old baby. They live in a rustic house that they built in a native community of the Central Jungle. 

Lili is a sweet and hard-working mother. She has been working in agriculture for ten years, producing citrus fruits such as oranges, mandarines and tangelo (grafts), as well as bananas, starfruit and cocoa.

Her cultivation plots are scattered in other communities. Taking care of all the crops is a tiring job for her, but she does it with care because she knows that the rewards will be good.

With the help of her husband she can clean the crops, especially cocoa, which requires more attention.

This month she is harvesting oranges and starfruit, and she hopes that in three months she will have good fruits from the cocoa plantation. For this, she is requesting your help to buy bags of fertilizer. 

This is her third loan with MFP, so she is committing to paying her monthly payments on time. She belongs to the community group "Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” and she states that her partners are reliable and will pay. 

With the 2000 soles she can buy 2000 bags of compost such as farm animal and island bird fertilizers, for her banana and cocoa plantations.

loans.use: to purchase twenty bags of compost.

loans.name: Lorgia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorgia, originaria de León, casada, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante. Sus comienzos en el comercio fueron por medio de un negocio de tortillería conforme fue pasando el tiempo fue diversificando y puso una pulpería,  venta ropa por encargo y  cosméticos, motivo por el cual solicito su primer financiamiento que le ayudo a comprar más mercadería para vender, el negocio de tortillería lo quito por problemas de salud. Hoy se dedica a tiempo completo a su pulpería. La cual requiere un crédito para surtirla de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, pan, huevos, frutas, productos para el aseo personal, cosméticos, pampers, papel higiénico, jugos, gaseosas. Pues desea convertir en la medida de lo posible su pulpería en una abarrotería donde su clientela pueda encontrar lo necesario para su hogar.
texts.en: Lorgia is a native of León, is married, is the mother of three children, and is a business woman.  She began in her business through a tortilla making enterprise, and with time she began diversifying and started a general store.  She sells clothing by order, as well as makeup, and that is why she is asking for a loan, which will help her to buy merchandise to sell.  She stopped the tortilla making business because of health problems.  Today she works full-time in her general store.  She is asking for a loan in order to supply the store with basic grains, cleaning products, bread, eggs, fruit, personal care products, cosmetics, diapers, toilet paper, juices, and soft-drinks.  She would like to convert her general store, to the greatest extent possible, into an all-purposes shop where her clients can find everything necessary for their homes.

loans.use: to supply her store with basic grains, cleaning products, bread, eggs, fruit, personal care products, cosmetics, diapers, toilet paper, juices, and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married to a farmer with six children. All of them go to school. He has been a maize farmer for 12 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying more places for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is 69 years old. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 40 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor for cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 34 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past seven years.
