Marilyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Lorgina

texts.en: Lorgina is 33 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings. Lorgina has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia Norela, tiene 43 años de edad, es soletar, tiene 2 hijos una de 27 y el otro de 16 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de menú, el cual prepara en su domicilio en una pequeña cocina y luego traslada su comida hacia una construcción donde vende su menú a los trabajdores con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Inició éste negocio con un pequeño préstamo que recibió pococ a poco fué aumentando su clientela. 
Sonia Norela pertenece al grupo "Los Girasoles" formado por 7 socios, ellos se han caracterizado por su responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de su crédito. En ésta oportunidad ella invertirá el préstamo recibido en la compra de una cocina industrial ya que es muy necesario para su negocio para poder preparar mas platos de comida y asi aumentar su número de clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia Norela is 43, single, and has two children, ages 27 and 16. With her daughter's help, she prepares food that she makes in her home's small kitchen and then delivers it to a construction site, where it is sold to the workers. She began the business with a small loan, and she has been slowly building her clientele. 

Sonia Norela belongs to the communal bank "Los Girasoles," which has seven responsible members who make their loan payments on time. She will use this loan to buy items for a commercial kitchen because her business must be able to prepare more dishes to increase its customer base.

loans.use: to invest in a commercial kitchen.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store. Jocelyn has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 37 year old married woman who has ten children, eight of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past four years she has had a charcoal selling business in the Philippines. Alma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 42 years old. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, seasoning, pork rinds and cheese

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Ms. Rasheedan is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She offers various goods for daily use. Rasheedan opened a small grocery store in her home to contribute in the family income. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

Rasheedan is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stocks of rice, pulses, sugar, flour, and other items from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Rasheedan wishes to provide a better living for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, pulses, sugar, flour, and other items from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 71 years old. He is married to a farmer, with seven children. All of them go to school. He has been a maize farmer for 35 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. With the profits from the business, he wishes to reinvest in the same business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah prefers that her photo not appear on the internet for cultural reasons; thus it is her son who appears in picture above. Kefah is a 45 year old married woman from Madaba, Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to buy foodstuffs for her grocery store. She would like to increase her inventory. In the future she hopes to expand her business and open another store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for her grocery store

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is from Gndevaz village, Vayots Dzor region. Together with her husband, Murad, she runs a farm where the couple raises cows and chickens, keeps beehives and grows fruit trees. Tereza would like to develop cattle breeding, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the help of this loan, she will purchase a calf, thirty chickens and forage to feed the cattle. This is important in order for Tereza to have more income from the sale of agricultural products and to invest in further agricultural development.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, thirty chickens and forage.

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Nelson Isael

texts.es:
Nelson, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad, la vivienda en la que reside es propia, Nelson tiene 10 años de estar trabajando en una ladrillera fabricando ladrillos y tejas, además es empleado y tiene un sueldo fijo.

Nelson, necesita realizar una inversión en el vehículo que es utilizado para transportar los ladrillos y las tejas, se comprará un juego de llantas, para las cuales no tiene por el momento la disposición económica, es por ello que espera a través del préstamo poder realizar este gasto.

Su objetivo es a futuro crecer mayor con la elaboración de ladrillos y aumentar su clientela, también está dentro de sus planes poder invertir en un nuevo vehículo que les sirva para poner otro puesto de distribución.
texts.en:
Nelson lives with his family, made up of his wife and two children, ages 18 and 14. They own their house. Nelson has been working on a factory, making bricks and tiles for ten years. He is also an employee and has a regular wage. 
He needs to make an investment in the vehicle that is used to transport the bricks and tiles. The vehicle needs a new set of tires and since he cannot afford it, he is asking for this loan. 
His goal is to grow in the brick making industry and to have more customers. He also plans to purchase a new vehicle to help them open another distribution center.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Ms. Uzma is 35 years old and a mother of five children. She has been in business doing hand-embroidery and tailoring for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and her clientele is good. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, make her worrisome. Her husband is employed as a carpenter, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Uzma’s embroidery patterns and custom-made designs are very popular in her territory. She is the best earning resource in her household. She is responsible for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Uzma has gradually improved her business and now she requested a loan of 15,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in bulk to meet the increasing demand. Uzma is hopeful to increase her net income and she wishes to spend part of her income on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in bulk to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 37 years old. She is married and has four children. She has been a maize farmer for ten years. She wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle to provide milk for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto tiene 42  años de edad, es soltero y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia, la cual está ubicada en Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que desarrolla Walberto es la crianza y comercialización de animales, el negocio está situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y la comercialización de arroz.

Walberto ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa 3500 nuevos soles para invertir en el arriendo de 1ha de terreno de cultivo para la siembra de arroz, adicionalmente su cónyuge dese comprar pavos medianos para su engorde y posterior venta en Diciembre por la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Walberto is 42 years old, unmarried and has four children of school age.  He has his own house which is located in Lambayeque, an area that has a moderate commercial activity.  It belongs to the province of the same name and is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

The activity that Walberto carries out is the breeding and selling of animals.  The business is located in the back part of his house.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the merchants who frequently visit the area.  This activity provides a stable source of income for him with which he can help his young family get ahead.  In addition, he works in agriculture and he sells rice. 

Walberto has requested 3,500 “nuevo soles” (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in renting one hectare of farm land to plant rice.  Additionally his partner wishes to buy medium-sized turkeys for fattening and then selling in December for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to rent land for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Nelly Yamileth

texts.es: Nelly tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara. Nelly lleva 7 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios como arroz, maíz, frijoles, pastas, pan, huevos, refrescos, churros, sal, azúcar, manteca, condimentos etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ella quiere ver su negocio más surtido y para eso ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, pastas, condimentos y otros que necesita para surtir e incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio para seguir pagando el estudio a sus hijos hasta que se graduen.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 37, is married and has four children.  She lives in the Quimistan municipality in Santa Bárbara.  Nelly established her own business of selling food products seven years ago.  She sells products like rice, corn, beans, pasta, bread, eggs, soft drinks, churros, salt, sugar, shortening, and condiments, etc.  This business is her source of income for her family.

She wants to see her business stocked more.  In order to do so, she has requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, sausages, meat, pasta, condiments, and others that she needs to stock up and increase her sales and her income.  Her dream is to continue growing in the business and to continue paying for her children’s education until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, sausages, meat, pasta, condiments, and others to stock her business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is 51 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school. Feliciana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Feliciana has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Feliciana has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and in the past she has borrowed nine times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Feliciana would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is a 59-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has four children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for eight years. Yen would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as washing powder packs, toothbrushes and traveling shampoo packs to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that this loan will allow her business to generate a higher income, help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as washing powder packs, toothbrushes and traveling shampoo packs.

loans.name: Paula Veronica

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 28 años, que aprobó la educación secundaria, vive con su pareja Mario de 33 años, tiene 3 hijos y viven en La Concordia es un cantón de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas que anteriormente pertenecía a la Provincia de Esmeraldas. Es considerado un cantón muy fuerte en la agroindustria y exportación de varios productos como palma africana, macadamia y palmito por lo cual un aproximado de más de 300 millones de dólares se mueven solo en este cantón. También el turismo es una fuente de economía, pues hay lugares que son visitados y los habitantes del pueblo aprovechan este movimiento para comercializar todo tipo de productos con negocios establecidos en cada rincón como restaurantes, tiendas, farmacias, almacenes de ropa, tours, etc.
Paula y su esposo trabajan atendiendo una lubricadora y lavadora de autos, le dedican desde 8 hasta 10 horas cada día a esta actividad. Aprendieron por iniciativa propia y los conocimientos los adquirieron con la experiencia. Ni Paula ni su esposo Mario tuvieron la oportunidad de cursar estudios universitarios por lo que su mayor sueño es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, por lo cual Paula necesita mejorar los ingresos atrayendo más clientes a su negocio y es por eso que como una estrategia mejorará las instalaciones de su local para brindar un mejor servicio y con esto incrementar su negocio, para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa quienes le apoyan con rapidez y confianza y además le brindan asesoría para llevar adelante su negocio. Paula está dispuesta a esforzarse por ver su sueño cumplido en sus hijos, por lo cual no permitirá que ningún obstáculo la deje rendirse.
texts.en:
Paula is a 28-year-old woman who completed secondary school. She lives with her partner, Mario, who is 33 years old. They have 3 children and live in La Concordia, a town in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was previously part of the province of Esmeraldas. 

La Concordia has a strong, 300-million-dollar agro-industry, exporting many products such as African palm, macadamia and heart-of-palm. Tourism is another source of income for the town as there many places to visit in the area. The townspeople take advantage of the influx of people to offer all kinds of products and services, such as restuarants, shops, pharmacies, clothes stores and tours, among others. 

Paula and her husband run a shop that offers a car cleaning and oil-change service, and they work 8 to 10 hours every day. They are self-taught and learnt the business over time, through experience. Neither Paula nor her husband had the opporutnity to go to university and their biggest dream is to see their sons become professionals. In order to achieve this, Paula needs to increase income by attracting more customers. Her strategy is to improve the shop's facilties to offer better service and grow the business. 

She has requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa who support her by offering a quick and trusting service and by providing assistance to expand her business. Paula is ready to make every effort to see her dream for her sons come true and she will not let any obstacle get in her way.

loans.use: to improve the shop's facilities/premises

loans.name: Jesutogbe 3 Group

texts.fr: JESUTOGBE 3 est un groupe de huit personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante du groupe, Zansi Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Zansi Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Zansi Christine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a très longtemps que Zansi Christine prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, haricot) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Zansi Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la quatrième fois que Zansi Christine et les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Jesutogbe 3 Group is made up of eight people, all of whom live in the same neighbourhood and run complementary businesses.  The representative of the group, Zansi Christine (pictured with her hand raised), is 46 years old and married to a man named Emmanuel.  The couple has five children, all of whom are in school and dependents. 

Zansi Christine lives together with her husband and children. The couple works together to provide for the different needs of the household.  Zansi Christine never attended school.  Zansi Christine has been preparing food for a very long time (corn, rice, and bean pastries), which she sells from her home.  Zansi Christine buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This is the fourth time that Zansi Christine and the other members of the Jesutogbe 3 Group have asked for financial support through ALIDé with a view to reinforcing their capital and businesses, as well as being able to better respond to the demands of their clientele.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn, rice, beans, and condiments.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un autre prêt. La représentante du groupe, Rachelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans. Rachelle est mariée à Alfred, un cultivateur et est mère de trois enfants, tous à leur charge. Rachelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Rachelle n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Rachelle a commencé depuis dix ans la vente de chaussures, de tissus et assiettes à son domicile. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité, tout en la diversifiant, Rachelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
FIFA is a group of five people, all of whom reside in the same village and belong to the same tontine group.  In order to raise the level of their businesses and better respond to the demands of their clientele, the group approached ALIDé hoping to receive another loan.  

The representative of the group, Rachelle (with her hand raised in the photo), is 35 years old. She is married to a man named Alfred, a farmer, and is the mother of three children, all of whom are in their care.  Rachelle lives together with her husband and children.  The couple works together to provide for the different needs of the household.  Rachelle has never attended school.  

In order to help make ends meet, Rachelle began selling shoes, fabrics, and flatware ten years ago out of her home.  With the goal of increasing the level and diversification of her business, Rachelle is asking for a sixth loan via ALIDé along with the other members of the FIFA group.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, fabrics, and flatware.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan, a 53-year-old divorced woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children, a son and a daughter. She has been a clothes-maker for one year. She requests a loan to purchase more sewing materials such as cloth, needles, and thread. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials such as cloth, needles, and thread

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 44 years old. He is married to a farmer, with three children. They are all enrolled in school. He has been a maize farmer for eight years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children and provide food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen was born in 1979. She has four children. There are three children who are learning in the 7th grade, the 4th grade and the 2nd grade. Her youngest child was just born. She and her husband blow plastic things to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 dong (VND) per month. 

Sen has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy metal scraps to recycle. She wants to use the profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy metal scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia is married with three children. Leoncia is 68 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows  coconuts to earn a living. Leoncia has encountered problems lately that caused her to pawn part of her land to get money to pay for an emergency. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to redeem the coconut land. Leoncia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Leoncia hopes to own more savings.

loans.use: to redeem her pawned coconut land

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in Monterico, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Elizabeth has a store that sells a variety of products: soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies and many others. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 10,000 pesos to buy additional inventory for sale.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 27-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan, who has six family members. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to buy perfumes and cosmetic products to resell to her friends and neighbors from the area. She would like to increase her products. She hopes to open a shop in the future and to buy a new home. Also, she wants to continue her children's education. 

Since Rasha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Minonkpo 1 Group

texts.fr: MINONKPO 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont le représentant (celui qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommé Gbassou Félix. Les membres du groupe sont des amis et exercent les activités similaires. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgé de 37 ans, Gbassou Félix est marié à Christine. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge, en dehors de leurs enfants. Gbassou Félix assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges de la maison. Gbassou Félix vend depuis trois ans, du sable lagunaire dans sa région, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Gbassou Félix s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Gbassou Félix et aux autres membres du groupe MINONKPO 1, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: MINONKPO 1 is a group made up of three people and whose representative (who has his hand raised in the photo) is named Gbassou Félix. The members of the group are friends and work in similar businesses. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is asking for the first time, for a loan from Alidé. 37 years old, Gbassou Félix is married to Christine. The couple has seven children, some of whom are in school and all of whom are in their care. The couple has two other children in their care outside of their children. Gbassou Félix provides together with his wife for the different household expenses. Gbassou Félix has sold lagoon sand for three years in his area, which allows him to provide for his family's needs. Gbassou Félix stocks up in a region of Benin. This first loan will allow Gbassou Félix and the other members of the group MINONKPO 1 to raise the level of their business and increase their customer base and their profits.

loans.use: to buy lagoon sand.

loans.name: Jesukpego 10 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO 10 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont le représentant (dont la main est levée sur la photo) se nomme Lucien. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Ce groupe sollicite un troisième crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgé de 50 ans, Lucien n'a pas fréquenté l'école et est marié à une marchande du nom de Christine. Le couple a huit enfants, tous scolarisés et dont un à leur charge. Lucien vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs vingt ans que Lucien exerce le métier de charpentier dans sa région. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins familiaux. Lucien s’approvisionne au Bénin. Lucien et les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 10 sollicitent un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en: JESUKPEGO 10 is a group made up of three people whose representative (the one with his hand raised in the photo) is named Lucien. The group members belong to the same tontine group. The group is asking for a third loan with an eye to increasing the level of their business and raising their turnover. 50 years old, Lucien did not attend school and is married to a merchant named Christine. The couple has 8 children, all in school and one of whom is in their care. Lucien lives together with his children and wife. The couple provides together for the various household expenses. Lucien has worked as a carpenter in his area for around 20 years. This allows him to take care of his family's needs without great difficulty. Lucien stocks up in Benin. Lucien and the other members of the JESUKPEGO 10 group are asking for a loan from Alidé in order to grow their businesses and increase their turnover and profits.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Mahussi Group

texts.fr: MAHUSSI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un autre prêt. La représentante du groupe, Pascaline Céline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Pascaline Céline ne vit plus avec son mari et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Pascaline Céline n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Pascaline Céline a commencé depuis dix ans la vente de riz et divers articles (tissus, etc.). Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité, tout en la diversifiant, Pascaline Céline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUSSI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: MAHUSSI is a group of three people, the members of whom belong to the same tontine group. In order to increase the level of their business and to cope with their customers' demands, the group approached Alidé, with an eye to obtaining another loan. The group's representative, Pascaline Céline (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 42 years old. Pascaline Céline doesn't live with her husband anymore and is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Pascaline Céline did not attend school. To cope with her various needs, ten years ago Pascaline Céline started selling rice and various items (fabric, etc.). With the goal of increasing the level of her business, while diversifying it, Pascaline Céline is asking together with the other members of the MAHUSSI group for a fourth loan from Alidé. Their three previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy rice, fabric, and various items.

loans.name: Mahugbedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGBEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Chantal Mireille, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Chantal Mireille est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un certain Raoul. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Chantal Mireille a peu fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales, Chantal Mireille mène comme activité depuis quinze ans environs, la vente de tissus dans un marché du Bénin. Chantal Mireille achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Chantal Mireille désire obtenir un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGBEDJI. Ce crédit leur permettra à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à faire face à la demande croissante de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The MAHUGBEDJI group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Chantal Mireille, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that the group is soliciting financial support from Alidé with an eye to raising the level of their businesses. Chantal Mireille is 49 years old and married to a man named Raoul. The couple has two children in school and in their care. Chantal Mireille attended little school. With the goal of providing for her needs and those of her family, Chantal Mireille has run a business selling fabric in a market in Benin for around 15 years. Chantal Mireille buys her products in a city in Benin. With the goal of increasing her product stock and better responding to her customers' needs, Chantal Mireille wants to obtain a first loan with the other members of the MAHUGBEDJI group. This loan will allow them to raise the level of their businesses and to cope with the growing demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Madame Aminatou est une jeune dame qui vit dans un quartier de la place. Elle détient une boutique dans un marché de la ville depuis 09 ans, où elle vend des chaussures et des babouches. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter ( quatre ballots de babouches). Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt, lui permettront d'augmenter son capital ,agrandir sa boutique et enfin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame Aminatou is a young woman who lives in a local neighborhood. She has had a store in a market in the city for nine years, where she sells shoes and Turkish slippers. Thanks to her dynamism and competence in this area, she has created a growing customer base for herself that she would like to continue to satisfy. For this, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy four bundles of Turkish slippers. The profits drawn from this loan will allow her to continue to increase her capital, make her store larger, and finally provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy four bundles of Turkish slippers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Edward has been a teacher for the last 12 years and he runs a catering business to supplement his salary. Since he started his business, Edward has managed to build a permanent house and bought a plot and a motorcycle. Edward’s dream is to educate his children, diversify his business and hire employees to help expand the business. Price fluctuation, inadequate capital and high fuel transportation costs are his great challenges. 

Edward is requesting a loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Remedio Jr.

texts.en: Remedio Jr. is a 48 year old married man. He is from Albur, Bohol. He has two children aged seventeen and fourteen years old. He has been in the retail business for five years. He sells frozen chicken, various goods and beverages. He plans to use the loan to buy additional processed frozen goods, like chicken and pork, various goods like canned goods, detergents, cooking oil, salt, and soft drinks like Coke and Pepsi, and beverages like coffee, milk and, tea. He earns PHP 5,000 a month by the working his retail business. Remedio Jr. would like to expand his business to support his family and at the same time send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy processed foods, various goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen lives in Arpy village, Vayots Dzor region, with his wife, son and daughter. Armen is involved in agriculture: he keeps chickens, beehives and grows fruit trees. Armen would like to develop beekeeping, for which he needs sufficient funds. With the requested loan Armen will purchase 12 colonies of bees. This will allow Armen to increase the sales of honey and gather more income. Armen is the only breadwinner for his family, and stable income from agriculture is important for him to ensure prosperous lives for his family members.

loans.use: to pay for 12 colonies of bees.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 27 years old. She is a mother of three children. She has spent 15 years as a maize farmer. She has decided to request a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to expand and invest in the same business for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: The previous loan has helped Basma to add new types of plants in the store and added a more colorful view too. She has applied for this loan to open a new section specializing in wedding flowers and decoration.

loans.use: to open a new section specializing in wedding flowers.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 49 is married, has two children and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. For eight years, she and her husband have operated a cafe in front of her house.

Hong would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Hong also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1976. She has three children who are in the 10th grade, 5th grade and kindergarten. She and her husband sell cooked food in the market. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy ingredients to cook food in her food stall. She wants to raise her children well and also wants to buy some more furniture for her little food stall.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook food in her food stall.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 34, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her children and  husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thanh has been in business for 10 years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca* weaving.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

*Abaca, a plant closely related to the banana, has unique fibrous leaf stalks originally used in making rope.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Makfirete

texts.en:
Makfirete is 44, married and has three children between the ages of  6 and 15. All three of them currently go to school. Her husband works in a warehouse and his job is the family's main source of income. 
Makfirete's house needs some renovation before the winter time but based on the economic situation, her family could not save the money for the renovation on their own. 
Makfirete is asking for a loan in order to buy new doors and windows. The loan will help improve the living conditions of her family and she hopes to offer her children a better life and education. 
Makfirete wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new doors and windows.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen, 49, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. 
She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a driver for rent. Huyen supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business 12 years ago. She sells snack foods, shampoo, tobacco and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions. She also wants to set aside some money for facing difficulties in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva, 34, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Dionvic, a driver and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Eva maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eva hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Sinh

texts.en: Sinh is a 41-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a textile business for 16 years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing textile materials such as silk thread. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing textile materials such as silk thread

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is aged 43. He is married to a farmer and they have seven children. Six of them go to school. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He wants a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and cover labor costs. He plans to use the profits from the business for reinvesting in the business he has been doing to date.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit lives in Gndevaz village, Vayots Dzor region, with her husband and 2 sons. Anahit is a teacher at Gndevaz middle school. She also helps her husband, Gerasim, to run a farm, where they raise cows, sheep, chickens, keep beehives and grow fruit trees. In order to increase income from cattle breeding, Anahit would like to purchase more cattle. She has applied for this loan to purchase 2 calves and 16 pigs. This will significantly increase Anahit's profit from the sales of meat and milk and allow her to continue expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for 2 calves and 16 pigs

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a conservative woman so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. They have 8 children to support. Her husband gets a retirement salary and is working another job to be able to pay for household bills. On the other hand, Iman is helping her husband with her livestock business. She makes cheese and yogurt for sell. Now she has applied for a loan to increase the number of goats in preparation for the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For three years she and her husband have operated a cafe in front of her house.

Mai would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Mai also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh, 33, is a married woman. She lives with her three daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Linh supports her family by running a sewing business. She started this business twelve years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials such as cloth and threads. She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as cloth and threads

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling ice candies in the Philippines.

Narcisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her ice candies.

She has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her ice candies.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works at a local company. For the last ten years, she has operated a internet shop in front of her house.

Lien would like a loan to purchase a computer and for the maintenance and upgrade of her computers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and set aside some money for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and for the upgrade and maintenance of the computers in her internet shop

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Faton is 29 years old, married and has two young children. He lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. Based on family tradition, he works in the agricultural business. For quite some time, Faton had been able to own and maintain a cow, but he had to sell it for money for his family about a year ago. 

Now Faton is requesting a loan to buy a cow. With this new cow, he will be able to save the money that he would normally need to spend on milk and milk products for his family. 

In the future, he hopes to expand this into a farm and to buy a calf as well to sell dairy products. His goal is to secure a future for his children and provide them with a better education. 

Faton wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Ovorkhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband works in a mining company as a mechanic. 

She has been working at a tailoring company since 2002, tailoring national clothes by customers' order. She is planning to operate her own tailoring business and is going to produce work gloves by contract with the company where her husband works. She is an open-minded and diligent woman. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase raw materials to produce gloves and supply the mining company where her husband works.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to produce gloves.

loans.name: Camela

texts.en:
Camela is 65 years old and widowed with seven children.

Camela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Camela has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Camela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Norbelita

texts.en: Norbelita is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She hails from Loon, Bohol. The oldest child is 31 years old. She has been in the retail business for two years. She sells personal collection items like detergent, fabric conditioner and deodorant. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos to purchase additional detergent, fabric conditioner and deodorant. In the future, Norbelita would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more detergent, fabric conditioner and deodorant.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 36, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Ronald and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer sells bedsheets and pillowcases. She has a stall in the market, which gives her an advantage since a lot of people go there rather than the mall to find cheaper stuff. And indeed, her products are cheaper than those sold in the malls. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of bedsheets and pillowcases for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jennifer hopes to increase production and dreams to be able to give all her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bedsheets and pillowcases that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani lives in Jermuk, a town in the province of Vayots Dzor, with her grandparents and sister. Ani is a hairdresser and has been running a little salon for two years. In addition to this, she helps her family run a farm where they grow fruit trees and keep chickens and turkeys. The barn in which the livestock is kept is too old and needs to be renovated. Ani has applied for this loan to pay for the barn renovation. Renovating the barn is important because it will help protect the turkeys and chickens during the cold winter and will help keep the development of agriculture stable.

loans.use: to pay for a barn renovation

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.ru: Если бы вы видели, в каком доме живет Хидоят, то вам бы сразу хотелось помочь ей отремонтировать дом. Ей 56 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Все ее дети совершеннолетние. Хидоят более 35 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, а также скотоводством. Она должна отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого.  Хидоят  запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони  для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома.  Хидоят  и ее дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en:
If you could see Hidoyat's home, you would immediately want to help her renovate it. She is a 56-year-old married woman with four adult children at home. 

For more than 35 years, Hidoyat has worked in crop farming and animal husbandry. Now she needs to renovate her house, but she does not have the resources to do so. She is requesting an 8000 somoni loan to purchase building materials for her home renovation. Hidoyat and her children are waiting for kind lenders to help them solve their living situation problem!

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is 28 years old and single. She is the oldest child in her family and has three younger brothers. She has just registered in college and is a new student in Managerial Information Systems. She hopes to find a job in the field after graduation and has applied for this loan to help pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Reycel

texts.en:
Reycel works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Reycel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Reycel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Jumanah

texts.en: Jumanah is a 23-year-old married woman from Baqa'a Jordan who has 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the home and to expand her home. In the future she hopes to open another project in her home to increase her income. Since Jumanah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sariya

texts.en:
Sariya, a 53-year-old conservative woman, has asked her daughter Azhar to appear in the photo instead.

Sariya is a mother of three daughters and a son. One of them is Azhar, which means flowers in Arabic. She is a 26-year-old university student. Sariya has applied for this loan to support her daughter in her studies and pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to support her daughter and pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Jorge Elias

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 34 años de edad, soltero, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Jorge se ha dedicado  a las actividades agrícolas y hace un año comenzó un negocio de venta de pescado fresco de toda clase. El compra y lo revende a sus clientes que tiene en su misma comunidad. El está solicitando un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de más producto de pescado, para mantener las ventas y aumentar su clientela. El trabaja muy duro junto con su familia y quiere hacer crecer su negocio y superarse más.
texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old, single, and lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. He engages in farming activities, but he also began selling all types of fish a year ago. Jorge buys the fish and then sells them to the customers in his community.

He is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL so that he can restock his business with more fish. This will enable him to maintain his sales and increase his clientele. Jorge works very hard with his family, so he wants to grow his business and become more successful.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupitas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario GUADALUPITAS está  compuesto por tres integrantes dos  mujeres y un varón,   La coordinadora del  grupo  es la Sra. Maria la primera  en la descripcion,  tiene 33 años,  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa en especial variedad de poleras ya que es epoca de calor y hay mucha demnda de estos productos,  ella tiene un puesto fijo en la comunidad de Colomi camino a Chapare,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su cuarta  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  poleras por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de calor y las poleras tienen mucha demanda, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Guadalupitas” consists of three members, two women and one man. The group coordinator is Sra. Maria. She is 33 years old and sells a variety of clothing, especially different types of T-shirts since the season for warmer weather has arrived and there is great demand for these products. Maria has an established vending post in the community of Colomi along the road to Chapare. The loan she is receiving is the fourth time she has participated in a cycle with Emprender. Sra. Maria will use the funds to buy a variety of T-shirts in bulk that she can offer to her customers and thereby increase her earnings. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business. The warmer season is approaching, so T-shirts will be in great demand. She will utilize the benefits of this loan to continue buying a variety of clothing.

Sra. Maria is a hardworking person who is pleased with the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Pay Peoples Money Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Pay Peoples Money” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 300,000.00 Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Sento is the leader of this group. Sento is 40-year-old, married with 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in college. Sento sells market food – salt, onions, pepper, tomatoes, etc.  and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy market food – salt, onions, pepper, tomatoes, etc.in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 26 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 26 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Adéhounlé Olivier, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Adéhounlé Olivier est âgé de 39 ans et est marié à une couturière du nom de Madeleine. Le couple a trois enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Adéhounlé Olivier n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales, Adéhounlé Olivier mène comme activité depuis dix sept ans environs, la coiffure. Adéhounlé Olivier achète ses produits de coiffure au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Adéhounlé Olivier désire obtenir un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 26. Ce crédit leur permettra à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à faire face à la demande croissante de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO 26 is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings group.  The group's representative, named Adéhounlé Olivier, is the one raising his hand in the photo.

It is the third time that the members of this group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activity.   

Adéhounlé Olivier is 39 years old and married to a seamstress named Madeleine.  They have three children, all in school and their dependents.

Adéhounlé Olivier did not attend school.  In order to meet his needs and to support his family, he has been working as a hairdresser for about seventeen years.  He buys his hairdressing supplies in Benin and Nigeria.  In order to increase his stock of products and to better meet his customers' demand, he would like to obtain a third loan, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO 26 group.

Thanks to this loan, the members of the group will be able to boost the level of their activity and to meet the increasing demand from their customers.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers and other hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 11 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 11 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Zountegni. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales, Julienne mène comme activité depuis vingt ans environs, la vente de vêtements et de pommades de façon ambulante. Julienne achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne désire obtenir un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 11. Ce crédit leur permettra à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à faire face à la demande croissante de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Gbenonkpo 11" group is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. The group's leader, Julienne, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. This is the 2nd time that the group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their level of business.

Julienne is 41 years old and is married to Zountegni. The couple are responsible for 5 children, 4 of whom are their own. All the children go to school. Julienne did not go to school. She has been selling clothing and creams on the street for about 20 years in order to provide for her own needs and cover the family expenses. Julienne gets her products in a town in Benin.

In order to increase her inventory of products and better respond to her customer demand, Julienne wishes to obtain a second loan, together with the other members of the "Gbenonkpo 11" group. This loan will enable them to increase their business levels and deal with the growing demand of their clientèle.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: MAHUCLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Sidonie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme, un revendeur. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Sidonie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Il y a quinze années que Sidonie mène comme activité la vente des ignames frits et des beignets à son domicile. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Sidonie mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sidonie sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUCLO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHUCLO is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Sidonie (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 32 years old and married to a retailer named Jérôme. The couple has six children, all of whom live in their care and have received schooling. Sidonie lives with her children and her husband. Both she and her husband cover the family's various expenses.

Sidonie has been selling fried yams and doughnuts from her home for the past 15 years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. She has been running this business in order to support her family.

Striving to satisfy her customers, Eugénie, along with the other members of the MAHUCLO group, is seeking a first loan. The loan will improve their capacity to meet the demand of their customers and help them to boost their profits.

loans.use: to buy yams, beans, and condiments.

loans.name: Lavictoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bachinanyi est  secrétaire du le groupement d’affaire LaVictoire,  elle est mariée et mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un commissionnaire dans un comptoir de pierres précieuses (minerais). La cliente est vendeuse de boissons Primus. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit Nganda (bistro), organisée à son domicile. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est au 2eme cycle de crédit.  Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 4 casiers de Primus et 4 casiers d’Amstel, 2 Fanta, etc. Ainsi, elle a du grand respect  à l’initiative Hekima dédiée à  autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes, car autant de ménages de ses coéquipiers en dépendent.
texts.en:
Our client, Bachinanyi, is the secretary of the business group "La Victoire".  She is married and the mother of three young children.  Her husband works as a commission agent in the precious stones (minerals) business.

Bachinanyi sells Primus beer.  She co-manages a small Nganda (pub) located in her house.  She started this business using her own funds.  Later on, she turned to the microfinance Hekima for financial support.  This is her second loan cycle.

Bachinanyi will use her loan to buy four crates of Primus, four crates of Amstel, two crates of Fanta etc.

She praises the initiative taken by Hekima and dedicated to the empowerment of small female entrepreneurs, because so many of her co-borrowers' households depend on it.

loans.use: to buy four crates of Primus, four crates of Amstel, two crates of Fanta etc...

loans.name: Roger

texts.fr: Roger est un homme âgé de 52 ans. il mène une activité de vente de maïs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 05 ans déjà. il offre également sur le même site des services de meunerie à clientèle. Donc concrètement lorsqu'un client achète le maïs chez lui, il a la possibilité de le transformer sur place en farine. ce qui lui offre un avantage concurrentiel énorme. il dispose de ce fait de 03 moulins à écraser. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 05 sacs de maïs dans le but d'augmenter son stock de marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Roger is a 52 year-old man. He has already been in business for five years, selling corn in one of the city neighborhoods. At the same location, he also offers milling services to his client. In practice, this means that a client purchasing corn from him can get it ground into flour on the premises. This gives him a huge competitive advantage. He has three grinding mills at his disposal.

With this loan, he would like to purchase five bags of corn to increase his merchandise store and better meet consumer demand. Resulting revenues will allow him to guarantee a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Adjomin Alete Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJOMIN ALETE est formé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Denise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Denise est âgée de 28 ans. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Denise est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Zinsou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Denise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de quatorze ans que Denise mène comme activité, la vente de bananes dans une ville du Bénin ; afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille. Denise s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Denise désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ADJOMIN ALETE.
texts.en:
The "Adjomin Alete" group is made up of 4 friends who live in the same area. The group's leader, Denise, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Denise is 28 years old. This is the first time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their level of business.

Denise is married to a mechanic called Zinsou. The couple have 3 children they are raising and who all go to school. Denise lives together with her children and husband. The couple both take care of the various family expenses. Denise has been selling bananas in a town in Benin for nearly 14 years, so that she is able to contribute to the family's different needs. She gets her supplies in her region.

Denise wishes to obtain a loan, together with the other members of the "Adjomin Alete" group, in order to increase her inventory of products and better respond to her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy some bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Jesougnon Group

texts.fr: JESOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Marie mène comme activité la vente de savons qu'elle fabrique elle même. Marie utilise de soude et de l'huile de palme pour la fabrication du savon. Marie vend son produit de façon ambulante. Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESOUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
JESOUGNON is a group which consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings' group.  

The group's representative, Marie, is 32 years old and raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a man named Christophe.  Marie and Christophe have six children, some of whom go to school.  All six children are their dependents.

Marie and her husband live with their children and jointly take care of the household expenses.  

Marie sells home-made soap.  She uses washing soda and palm oil to make soap.  She sells her production as an itinerant seller.  She has a passion for her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, Marie is requesting her first loan, together with the other members of the JESOUGNON group.  This loan will be used to better meet the demand from their customers and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy three bags of washing soda and buckets of palm oil.

loans.name: Nonvignon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin.  C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Denagni Pierrette est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Denagni Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Rémi. Denagni Pierrette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Denagni Pierrette et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de quinze ans, Denagni Pierrette vend de l'igname frit à son domicile. Denagni Pierrette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Denagni Pierrette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 1, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The "Nonvignon 1" group is made up of 3 people who are friends and who all live in the same area in Benin. This is the first time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of business.

The group's representative, Denagni Pierrette, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Denagni Pierrette is 38 years old and married to a driver called Rémi. Denagni Pierrette did not go to school. The couple are raising 4 children who all go to school. Denagni Pierrette and her husband both take care of the various family expenses. Denagni Pierrette has been selling fried yams at her home for nearly 15 years. She gets her supplies in her area.

Denagni Pierrette is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of the "Nonvignon 1" group, in order to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy yams and and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles nucléaires, les six femmes du groupe Benkan ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Bagadadji dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles font l’achat et la vente du bois de chauffe, d’encens, des parfums et du Bazin. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Salimata (première debout en écharpe rougeâtre) est une grande vendeuse d’encens. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1kg de « magnonkissèni », 2 bouteilles de parfums de  qualités  et d’eau de Cologne. Pour préparer l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau pure et de Cologne pendant une semaine au moins puis on l’assaisonne avec du parfum; L’encens ainsi obtenu est reparti entre les bouteilles pour être vendu. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, à domicile, en ambulant  et au marché de Bagadadji. Avec ce prêt,  Salimata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in nuclear families, the 6 women of the Benkan group average 35 years old and have 2 children. They all live in the area of Bagadadji in the town of Segou and know each other from neighborhood, family, and business ties.
