They engage in the buying and selling of firewood, incense, perfume, and Bazin [a type of woven fabric]. In an effort to increase their business, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their first loan together.

Salimata (seated in the yellow shawl) is an incense vender. She plans to use her loan to buy 1kg of magnonkisseni [seeds of a wild plant], 2 bottles of quality perfume, and eau de Cologne. To prepare incense, one soaks magnonkisseni in pure water and eau de Cologne for at least a week and then seasons it with perfume. The resulting incense is then divided into bottles to be sold.

She sells the incense on a retail basis, for cash or credit, from her home and in the Bagadadji market. Her customers are mostly women. 

With this loan Salimata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in the business and to take care of certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for making incense

loans.name: Minonkpo 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINONKPO 2 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anne Marie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  Anne Marie est âgée de 37 ans. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité.  Anne Marie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de André. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, et tous à leur charge.  Anne Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de sept ans que  Anne Marie mène comme activité, la vente de divers articles (maïs, riz, haricot, etc.) à son domicile afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille.  Anne Marie s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle,  Anne Marie désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MINONKPO 2.
texts.en:
The "Minonkpo 2" group is made up of 3 people who belong to the same mutual funds group. The group's representative, Anne Marie, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 37 years old. This is the first time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their business levels.

Anne Marie is married to a driver called André. The couple have 5 children, all of whom go to school and are in their charge. Anne Marie lives together with her children and husband, and the couple both take care of the various family expenses.

In order to be able to contribute to her family's various needs, Anne Marie has been selling various items (like corn, rice and beans) at her home for nearly 7 years. She gets her supplies in her area.

Anne Marie would like to get a loan, together with the other members of the "Minonkpo 2" group, so that she can increase her inventory of products and better satisfy the needs of her clientèle.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Sévèho Rémi

texts.fr: Sévèho Rémi est âgé de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Sévèho Rémi a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Sévèho Rémi est marié à Béatrice, une marchande. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Sévèho Rémi vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sévèho Rémi mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la couture dans son atelier. Sévèho Rémi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître ses instruments de travail et son revenu, Sévèho Rémi sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sévèho Rémi is 36 years old and lives in Benin. He attended school up until primary level. He is married to Béatrice, who is a merchant. The couple has three children to support, all of whom attend school. Two of the children are their own. Sévèho Rémi lives with his wife and children and covers the various household costs together with his wife. In order to cover their expenses, Sévèho Rémi has been carrying out a sewing business in his workshop for the past 20 years. He gets his supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and to build up his sewing equipment as well as his income, he is requesting a third loan from Alidé. This will undoubtedly enable him to increase his business volume and make more money. The previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Amemak Group

texts.fr: AMEMAK est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont le représentant (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) se nomme Dénagnon Simon. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Ce groupe sollicite un quatrième crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgé de 40 ans, Dénagnon Simon est marié à une marchande du nom de Céline. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Dénagnon Simon vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs dix sept ans que Dénagnon Simon exerce la mécanique ; Ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins familiaux. Dénagnon Simon s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dénagnon Simon et les autres membres du groupe AMEMAK sollicitent un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: Amemak is a group of three people, whose representative (raising his hand in the photo) is called Dénagnon Simon. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood. This group is requesting a fourth loan so that they can increase their business volume and turnover. Dénagnon Simon, who is 40 years old, is married to a merchant called Céline. The couple has four children, who all attend school and are supported by them. Apart from their own children, the couple supports another child. Dénagnon Simon lives with his children and his wife and the couple covers the various family expenses between them. Dénagnon Simon has been a mechanic for the past 17 years or so, and this activity enables him to provide for his family's needs without too much difficulty. He gets his supplies in a town in Benin. Together with the other members of the Amemak group, Dénagnon Simon is requesting a loan from Alidé in order to expand his business and increase his turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Shahinaz

texts.en:
Shahinaz, who is a 42-year-old conservative woman, has asked her son, Qais, to take her place in this photo.

Shahinaz’s husband is a taxi driver. She and her husband want to support their son in reaching his educational goals. So she has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is a young Palestinian man. He is married and has two daughters. He is employed in the private sector but he earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past two years, Nihad has owned a photography studio. He takes photos of customers and sells cameras, photo frames and albums. This has been a profitable second source of income for the family.

Nihad is requesting a loan from Faten to help him cover the costs of purchasing the necessary equipment, including cameras, photo frames and albums.

Taking this loan will increase Nihad's sales and improve his income. This will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary equipment for the photography studio he owns.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya is a 19-year-old, single lady who has just finished high school and registered at a local university. She is the youngest sister of three siblings. Aya has applied for this loan to pay for her registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her registration fees.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 61 years old and married with three children.

Bernardita is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Bernardita has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernardita has been raising pigs for eight years now. She has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kiki

texts.fr: Kiki est âgé de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Kiki n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Kiki est marié à Bernadette, une marchande. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Kiki vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Kiki mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, la vente des céréales (maïs, mil et farine de manioc) dans un marché du Bénin. Kiki s’approvisionne dans certaines villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kiki sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Kiki is 47 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. He is married to Bernadette, who is a merchant. The couple has four children, who all attend school. Kiki lives with his wife and children, and covers the household expenses together with his wife. In order to cover these expenses, Kiki has been selling cereals (corn, millet, and cassava flour) in a Benin market for the past 30 years or so. He gets his supplies from various towns in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase his turnover and income, Kiki is requesting a first loan from Alidé. This loan will undoubtedly enable him to increase his business volume and make more money.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, millet and cassava).

loans.name: Bon Pasteur Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BON PASTEUR est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Gimadé Marguerite est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Gimadé Marguerite est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Emmanuel. Gimadé Marguerite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Gimadé Marguerite et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de sept ans, Gimadé Marguerite vend divers articles (charbon de bois, savons, œufs) de façon ambulante. Gimadé Marguerite s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Gimadé Marguerite sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BON PASTEUR, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The "Bon Pasteur" group is made up of 3 friends who belong to the same mutual funds group. This is the fifth time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their business levels.

The group's representative, Gimadé Marguerite, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 39 years old and married to a driver called Emmanuel. Gimadé Marguerite did not go to school. The couple have 2 children, both of whom attend school. Gimadé Marguerite and her husband provide for the various family expenses together. Gimadé Marguerite has been selling various items (like charcoal, soap and eggs) on the street for nearly 7 years. She gets her supplies in her area.

Gimadé Marguerite is requesting another loan, together with the other members of the "Bon Pasteur" group, so that she can satisfy her clientèle and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy various items like soap and eggs.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 54-year-old married woman who has six family members from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. She wants to increase her product inventory. In the future, Najah hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is a 49-year-old married woman, and her husband works in the land-sale business. They are supporting two sons and one daughter. Noura works from home to help to pay the household bills. She sells blankets and various bed covers. She wants to expand her business to include the selling of housewares, and therefore, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy housewares to sell.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is a 32-year-old married man and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.
Fadel owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2000, and he now has an employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.
He is requesting a $2800 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and to renovate the shop window. He is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop and to renovate the shop window.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Manar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Manar is a 32-year-old married woman from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance on the home and to repaint her home. In the future she wants to expand her home and to decorate her home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Mary Joyce

texts.en:
This is Mary Joyce, 27, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mary Joyce has a stall that sells curtains. She gets curtains from a tailoring company and then sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Joyce hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for curtains that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man. People in the area where he lives are characterized by simplicity, and they still rent chairs to use at their occasions.
For the past two years, Mohammad has rented chairs to people for their occasions, which has been profitable and the only source of income for him, but the profit is not enough to cover the costs of the increasing demand from customers.
Mohammad is requesting a youth loan from Faten to help purchase a large number of chairs to cover the increasing demand from customers with whom Mohammad has a good reputation.
Receiving this loan will lead to an increase in Mohammad's income and ensure better living conditions for him.
Mohammad is photographed next to the chairs that he has for rent.

loans.use: to purchase additional chairs to rent.

loans.name: Eldayag

texts.en:
Eldayag is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. Eldayag lives in the Baku region with his wife and children. He is an IDP iInternally displaced person) from the city of Fuzuli. 

He needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy seeds for planting to improve his business. Eldayag has been in the farming business for the last two years. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy thread and other raw material for the carpet weaving business

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Ms Group

texts.en:
In the district of Khurda in Odisha, India, Jay Hanuman Ms’s 10 women members are requesting a loan to improve their businesses. The president of the group, Sakuntala, is the one holding the register and wearing a pink salwar suit.

Sakuntala is a 39-year-old woman working in floriculture. She has one child that she is caring for. Although she only has one year of experience in her business, she enjoys her work in growing flowers and selling them to temple worshippers. She hopes to get a loan to purchase seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticide to grow more beautiful flowers.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticide to grow flowers for temple worship.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband is a bulldozer driver.

She has a few goats whose milk she uses for making dairy products to sell so they can support their family of eight members. 

Sabha has applied for this loan to get more goats that will allow her to increase her productivity of milk products and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to get more goats.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi, 40, lives with her husband and children in their own house that is thatched. She sells fish and dumplings at the market and door-to-door.

Mishi is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She’s always on the lookout for alternatives that will lead to a more profitable future, which is why she strives daily to the maximum degree to reach her objective.

Mishi is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil, and to buy more fish for sale.

She has faith that she will provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil, and to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Reina Monica

texts.es: El Sra. Reina  tiene 20 años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene a la  venta variedad de relojes,   su puesto se encuentra en la zona de la Ceja de el Alto, este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Reina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como relojes y calculadoras y así de esta  manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería para surtir su puesto, la Sra. Reina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de producto y sueña con ampliar su casa y su negocio, la Sra. Reina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Señora Reina is 20 years old and makes a living in retail sales; she sells a variety of watches.  Her stand is in the area of Ceja de el Alto.  This loan is the first she has had with the institution.  Señora Reina is going to use this loan to buy merchandise like watches and calculators and in this way increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to buy merchandise to stock up her stand.  Señora Reina faces challenges in her business like the demand there is for new products and so she is going to use the profits to focus on the purchase of a variety of products.  She dreams of enlarging her house and her business.  Señora Reina is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered in granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like watches and calculators.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 45-year-old married woman who has three family members from Hay Nazal, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to do maintenance and repainting of her home. She would like in the future to expand her home to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 41-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children. 

Samira is helping her husband to improve their living conditions by selling baby pampers (diapers) at home. She brings those pampers from the wholesale market and packs them in smaller quantities to resell. 

She has applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of baby pampers to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of baby diapers to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 20 years old and single. He has three siblings. 

Ahmad is in his third year studying to be a teacher. He has applied for this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two. 

She started a business of shoemaking last year at her home. Her husband is employed in a private company but his income is not sufficient to meet the expenses of the family alone. This compelled her to contribute to the family income and to share the burden of expenses with her husband. 

She very well knows the techniques of making beautiful shoes and sells them to the local market and her community. However, she is facing the problem of low cash in hand and is unable to purchase raw materials. 

She requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase a large quantity of soles, leather and embellishment material. She expects a boost in her sales and net income. 

Dilshad intends to spend the part of her increased revenues on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of soles, leather and embellishment material for them.

loans.name: Darlin Miguel

texts.es: Darlin, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio del negrito, Yoro junto con sus padres y hermanos. Darlin es una persona trabajadora el realizaba trabajos de jornal y de albañilería, ahora tiene un año de haber establecido el negocio de venta de jugos naturales como jugo de caña, naranjas, tamarindo, nance y de otras frutas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y también venta ambulante. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar materia prima como ser caña, frutas, cocos, bolsas y otros para elaborar los jugos y venderlos en bolsa. Con esta inversión mantendrá los insumos necesarios para tener siempre el nivel de ventas y obtener ingresos. Su meta es crear una franquicia de jugos naturales con marca legalizada para obtener dinero para hacer su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Darlin is 21 years old and has a child.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the Negrito municipality in Yoro.  He works as a day worker and bricklayer.
His business has now been established for one year.  He sells natural juices like sugarcane, orange, tamarind, ‘nance’ [a small, sweet, yellow fruit], and other fruits.  He has this business at his house, and he also sells in an itinerant manner.

He is requesting a loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy raw material like sugarcane, fruit, bags, and others to make the juices and sell them in bags.  With this investment he will keep the needed supplies on hand in order to always have a level of sales and to get income.

His goal is to create a natural juice franchise with a legalized brand in order to get money to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sugarcane, coconuts, bags, and other supplies for his business of selling juices.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 22 years old and single. He has eight siblings.  

Being in a big family brings more pressure on the financial side of the family, but that did not affect Mohammad’s desire to get a bachelor's degree, and for that he registered in a university. 

Now he has applied for this educational loan to help him in paying the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Mincia Sarahi

texts.es: Mincia, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro.  Ella vende ropa nueva al detalle para hombres, mujer y niños. Antes se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero hace 10 años se dedico a la venta de mercadería como ropa. El negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado local, también vende en su casa y de manera ambulante. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en comprar un lote nuevo de ropa para surtir el negocio y cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene de sus clientes. Con las ganancias tiene pensado cultivar su propia finca de café y poder darles un buen fututo a sus hijos
texts.en:
Mincia, age 41, is married and has three children.  She lives in the Yoro municipality.  She sells new clothes retail for men, women, and children..  She used to work in agriculture, but ten years ago she started selling merchandise like clothes.  She has the business at the local market, and she also sells at her house and in an itinerant manner.

The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras.  She will buy a batch of new clothes to stock her business and fill the customer orders that she already has.  With the income she is thinking of cultivating her own coffee farm and being able to give her children a good future.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Good People” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/ Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Jebbie. Jebbie is 32. She was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school and secondary schools. For many years now, Jebbie has been selling cassava.  With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of cassava to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cassava to add to her current stock

loans.name: Felicita Celaura

texts.es:
Felicita de 62 años, habita en las afueras de León, casada, madre de tres hijos. Su humildad y sencillez la caracteriza entre los vecinos de su zona aledaña a pesar que tuvo tres hijos, solo vive con su esposo y un nieto el cual está criando, con los poco recursos que tiene. Desde muy joven de se dedicó a trabajar en el campo y continuo al casarse y trabajar al lado de su esposo. Actualmente se dedica a la crianza de cerdos mientras su esposo siembra. Los ingresos por las ventas de estos animales le permiten a ella ser independiente y ayudar a su esposo. 
Está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar un cerdo reproductor el cual le ayudara a multiplicar sus animales y poder vender más. Pues su sueñe es conseguir una vehículo donde puede transportar sus animales y salir a vender fuera de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Felicita is 62 years old. She lives on the outskirts of León. She is married and has three children. Her neighbors know her as a humble, unpretentious person. She lives with her husband and is raising a grandson with the few resources they have. She has been working the land since she was very young; even after marrying she continued to work alongside her husband. She is currently raising pigs while her husband cultivates crops. The income she brings in from selling her animals allows her to be independent and help her husband.
She needs a loan to buy a stud pig so she can raise more animals and increase her sales. Her dream is to acquire a vehicle to use to transport her animals and be able to sell them in other communities.

loans.use: to buy a stud pig.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine for her husband's photocopy services.

loans.name: La Colonia Maye Group

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en una comunidad rural del municipio de Jesús de Otoro, Intibucá junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.
Juana tiene 5 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad de negocio, ella tiene cría de gallinas y cerdos para engorde y vender. Juana aprovecha la temporada de navidad para vender gallinas y cerdos entre sus vecinos de la misma comunidad. Anteriormente trabajo en ventas en una tienda y supermercado, pero miro que era mejor tener su propio negocio. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo en grupo, que está formado por tres miembros en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Ana, en medio Susana y a la derecha Juana, el grupo se llama La Colonia Maye, las tres viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a actividades agrícolas, cría y venta de animales. 
El préstamo grupal suma 16,200 Lempiras y lo utilizaran para pago de derecho a instalación de energía eléctrica. Para Juana contar con energía eléctrica en su casa va ser de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca. Ya que necesita calentadores para la cría de pollos y gallinas y así podrá aumentar la producción y sus ingresos. Al igual para un crecimiento comunitario. 
Su meta es tecnificar el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, age 27, lives with her husband and their four children in a rural community in Jesús de Otoro, Intibucá.  Juana has had her own business activity for five years.  She raises chickens and pigs to fatten and sell.  Juana takes advantage of the Christmas season to sell chickens and pigs among her neighbors in her community.

Juana used to work in sales at a store and a supermarket, but she saw that it was better to have her own business.

She is requesting a loan in her group, which is comprised of three members.  In the photo Ana is on the left, Susana is in the middle, and Juana is on the right.  The group is called La Colonia Maye.  The three of them live in the same community, and they devote themselves to farming and raising and selling animals.

The group loan is for 16,200 lempiras.  They will use it to pay for the right to install electricity.  For Juana, having electricity in her house is going to be a big help for her business to grow.  She needs the heat in order to raise the chickens.  This way she will be able to increase production and her income. This will also show growth in the community.

Her goal is to modernize her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the right to install electricity and to be able to maintain heat in order to raise chickens.

loans.name: Daton Michel

texts.fr: Daton Michel est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Daton Michel n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Daton Michel est marié à Marguérite, une coiffeuse. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Daton Michel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Daton Michel mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la mécanique dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Daton Michel vend des pièces détachées. Daton Michel s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Daton Michel sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Daton Michel is 41 years old and lives in Benin. He did not go to school. He is married to a hairdresser named Marguérite. The couple has six children, one of whom still lives in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Daton Michel lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife both cover the various household expenses.

In order to support his family, Daton Michel has been working as a mechanic in his region for about fifteen years now. He also sells spare parts on the side. He stocks up in a few different regions in Benin.

Striving to satisfy his customers and grow his sales and revenue, Daton Michel is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. The loan will allow him to increase the level of his business and earn more profit. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 42 years old and has six children. One of them is Abdullah, a 19-year-old university student. Asma is requesting an educational loan to help her son pay his semester fees and continue his studies. Abdullah wants to earn his bachelor's degree soon so he can start working.

loans.use: to pay her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old single guy. He has eight siblings living in the same house. Ali is a university student majoring in chemistry who wants to work in the field after graduation. For now, he applied for this educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Amir owns a small restaurant. He established his business in 2009 after a long experience in this field. He worked for 10 years in a restaurant where he learned everything about the fast food industry. He has now three employees and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to redecorate the restaurant. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to redecorate the restaurant.

loans.name: Joomo Group

texts.en:
Five trading women came together in 2011 to form the Joomo group so that they can access loans from Initiative Development Ghana, Kiva's partner in Ghana. They sell the following items: soft drinks, wigs, provisions and fruits. This is their first loan with the MFI (microfinance institution). The group has gone through series of business and social training supervised by the MFI. The group is displacing some of the items that they sell.

Ernestina is a 52-year-old fruit seller, married to a 57-year-old teacher. Their children are all grown up. She has been doing this job for 10 years, from morning to evening and also from Monday to Friday.

She needs 300 Ghana cedis to be able to buy more fruits from the market to sell.

The group needs a total of 1500 Ghana cedis to maintain their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Abed Ali

texts.en:
Abed Ali is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Abed Ali owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He differentiated his business by adding meat and vegetables. He established his business in 2006, and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2,500 loan to buy a generator, install shelves and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator, install shelves and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old, is married and supports a family of five. She has operated a cereals shop for the last 11 years, making a monthly income of KES 19,000. 

She has applied for a business loan of KES 30,000, and she plans to restock her cereals shop for sales in the coming high season.  The anticipated profits will buy more cereals and grains for sale. 

Her future dream is to educate her children

loans.use: to purchase additional cereals for her shop.

loans.name: Nejmeh

texts.en: Nejmeh is 59 years old and married. She is from Marka Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan for 600 JOD, which she will use to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the area. Nejmeh wants to open a shop to show her products. She also hopes to buy a new car.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is a single mother with 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also cares for her father.  

Janet runs a retail shop, which she started 3 years ago.  She works 7 days a week.  Janet has applied for a loan of Shs. 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy beans, peas, ground nuts, salt, sugar, maize flour, rice, books, pens, pencils, and cooking oil for the shop. 

The main business challenges for her business are transport and defaulters.  

Janet’s goals and aspirations include building a house on her plot, and owning a wholesale shop.  She says she decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of trust.  She is renting the house she lives in; the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  The greatest monthly expenses for Janet include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, pencils, pens and books to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to bring more food products to the store.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa, who appears in the picture, is a 30-year-old young man; he is married with no children yet.

Alaa is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover his costs.

Alaa is newly married and the place where he lives is distinguished for being calm and clean. Alaa wants to complete purchasing some missing items for his house, and it's necessary to have a refrigerator in his house to preserve food and drinks.

Alaa is requesting a loan from Faten to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new home refrigerator. Taking this loan will create for Alaa and his wife suitable and healthy living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for home use.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 20 years old; he is the oldest brother for four siblings. He is a second-year university student majoring in accounting. Odai applied for this educational loan so he could pay for his semester fees to be able to continue and take the semester exams.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a bus driver.   Her oldest child, Bashar (pictured here), is a third-year university student majoring in accounting and economics.  Asmaa is requesting an education loan, which she will use to help her son pay for his semester fees so he can graduate from the university.

loans.use: to help her son pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is 45 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are employed.  He is from Iraq.  Hamid owns a car repair shop. He specializes in repairing car bodies. He established his business in 2004. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Harrid is requesting a loan for $3,000, which he will use to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El señor Arnaldo tiene 41 años, el es un señor muy trabajador, está acompañado con la señora Trifina hace 15 años, vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo desde hace 10 años. El señor Arnaldo  tiene una despensa y carnicería en su barrio. Cuenta que empezó con unas poquitas mercaderías y luego se fue aumentando con los préstamos que hizo de la Fundación Paraguaya y con sus ganancias. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque solo él y su señora trabajan en la familia. Su sueño es hacer un tinglado y formar un supermercado en su barrio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de yerba, fideos, panificados, arroz y demás insumos, que son los principales y que más salida tienen.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 41 years old and is a very hardworking man.  He and Trifina have been living in the city of Coronel Oviedo for the past 10 years.  Arnaldo has a grocery store and butcher shop in his neighborhood.  He started with a few items and began to increase with the help of the loans he got through Fundación Paraguaya and through his own savings.  He says that his work requires a lot of sacrifice because only he and his wife work out of the whole family.  His dream is to set up a supermarket in his neighborhood.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy herbs, noodles, breads, rice, and other supplies that make up his greatest sales.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami a 22-year-old single man, majoring in Archaeology at the university. He is one of nine siblings in the family; they live together in the same house. Coming from such a big family adds more financial responsibilities, and sometimes sacrifices are made so that everyone get the same chances. 

Rami is one of those guys who wants to experience college life and get a BA degree, so he decided to study at his own expense, and registered at the university to study Archaeology. Now he has almost graduated, but he faced a few financial troubles, so he applied for this loan in hopes that he can finish and graduate.  He hopes to start working in the archaeology field, or even get more free time to fill it with more side jobs that will help the family.

loans.use: To pay for university fees.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married and has six children who attend school.  She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  Sophia sells charcoal, which she has been doing for five years.  She has no other source of income.  She sells the charcoal seven days a week on both a retail and wholesale basis from her home.  

Sophia is requesting a loan of  300,000 UGX, which she will use to buy sacks of charcoal for sale.  She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of the group lending methodology used.  

The challenges of Sophia’s business include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals are to build rooms to rent at her home and to sell on a wholesale basis only.  She owns her house and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is a 39 year old married woman from Cortes, Bohol.  She has three children ages 18, 11 and six years old.  She has been in the hog raising business for three years.  She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed, like hog grower pellets.

In the future, Herminigilda would like to expand her business and to invest in other ventures to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Maa Birajai Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Birajai Self Help Group is located in the village of Hatabradihi in Odisha, India, and has 12 members.  All members are women.  As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. Pitei is the President of the group and is standing in the front wearing a purple saree.

Pitei, 48, lives with her husband and their two school-aged children in a humble home. Pitei’s husband works as a fisherman in Chilika Lake.  To help supplement income for their family, Pitei prepares and dries the fish to sell in the village market.  A loan from Kiva lenders will help her purchase fishing net and a storage box to sell more fish and increase her profit.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fishing net and a storage box.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 26-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 2, 8 and 9. She works hard as a rice farmer together with her husband so they can provide for their children. 

Angelita needs additional capital so she can buy fertilizer and pay her hired help for their labor . She hopes that this will help so she can further improve her crop and yield. In the future, she dreams of having a bigger farm for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is an 18 year old guy who just registered in the university to study tourism. Shadi wants to be a good role model for his five younger siblings, so he decided to depend on himself to pay his educational expenses.

Now, he has applied for this loan in hopes that he can find help to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay  his semester fees.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. He is the only provider for the family.

Houssein owns a shop for sewing sunshades and tents. He established his business in 1995. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with six children.  Two of the children are in school.  She also takes care of her father and mother who are aged.  She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for three years.  She works seven days a week.    

Zalika has applied for a loan of Shs. 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to enable her to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, salt, soap, maize flour and millet flour for the shop.  The challenges for her business are thieves and bad debtors.  Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business by starting another shop for women's clothes.  She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because the terms of lending are fair.  

Zalika owns the house she lives in and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  The greatest monthly expenses for Zalika include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, salt and soap

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Ms. Najma is 40 years old and a married woman. She has been efficiently running a shop making steel boxes with her husband for three years.The man shown in the photo is Najma's husband. They offer boxes in every size and also fabricate them on the demand of customers. They are famous for providing good quality products in their community and in a local market.

Najma is a mother of seven and is accountable to provide them with good quality food and education. She requires improving her business so she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy sheets of steel and packs of nails to meet increasing demand. She dreams of expanding her business and wishes to utilize part of income on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy sheets of steel and packs of nails to meet with increasing demand.

loans.name: Akabi

texts.en:
Akabi lives in Yerevan town with her daughter, Mariam who studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University. She is in the fourth course in Faculty of Culture. 

Akabi works at a clothing booth in one of the city markets. Her salary allows her to cover her household costs, but is not enough to save for Mariam’s education.  Akabi is requesting a loan for 175,000 AMD, which she will use to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a 34 year old from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. For four years now, he has been fishing for an income so that he can help his family. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net that he can use to be more productive in his fishing activities. This will definitely help him to catch more fish, and that will benefit him financially.

 In the future, he would like to have another business that will bring in more profit for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami, photographed here in his grocery store, is a 22-year-old single young man. 
For the past two years, Rami has sold different types of groceries in his store. It has been a profitable project and his only source of income, but not enough to cover the costs.
Rami is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him purchase a needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request and buy such as rice, sugar, dairy products and canned food. The loan also would help him make improvements in the store's condition such as installing additional shelves. Taking this loan will increase sales and increase Rami's income, which will ensure him better living conditions.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries and to make improvements in the store's condition.

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en: Emilya, 25, is single and has no children. Emilya needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy a new computer for improving her work in the consulting business she has run for one year.  Emilya tries all the time to improve her business. She lives in the Baku region with her family. Emilya is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli.

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Alphunsina

texts.en: Alphunsina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all in school. She has no additional family members she looks after.  She has owned a business selling clothes for seven years now.  She sells the clothes on a retail basis. She works six days a week and has no other source of income. Alphunsina has applied to MCDT SACCO for a loan of Shs. 300,000/= to enable her buy clothes to sell. The challenges she has in business include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for the business include expanding the business by opening branches and recruiting people to help her with sales. She decided to work with MCDT  SACCO because the interest charges are affordable. The house she is staying in is her own. The family has access to electricity and to piped water. The greatest monthly expense for Alphunsina is rent.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is  37 years old and has seven children, one of whom, Ibrahim (pictured here) is a university student majoring in accounting. Mervat is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 60 years old, married, and three adult children. He has been farming rice for 10 years. He is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol.  

Edilberto is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer and seedlings and to pay for men who will be helping in the land preparation.  With this loan, he would like to expand his business to improve his yield.  In the future, he would like to have a bigger farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramon vive en la ciudad de Concepción hace mas de 15 años, tiene dos hijas una que tiene 17 años y la otra aun chiquita, el señor esta casado con la señora Sunilda quien es de la ciudad de Belén.
El señor tiene un negocio de ventas de repuestos para motos en la ciudad de Belén hace mas de 8 años, según nos cuenta había empezado con un negocio pequeño en y luego con la ayuda de su señora quien es enfermera fue creciendo un poco mas hasta ahora. Ramon cuenta que viene de una familia muy trabajadora y sacrificada, es una persona que desea salir adelante y es por eso que lucha.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motos, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y seguir ganando también clientela nueva.
texts.en:
Ramon has lived in the city of Concepción for more than 15 years. He has two daughters, one 17 years old and the other still very young. His wife, Sunilda, is from the city of Belén.
Ramon has had a business in Belén selling motorcycle parts for more than 8 years. He tell us he started with a small shop, but with the help of his wife, who is a nurse, he kept gradually expanding the business. Ramon says he comes from a hardworking family that is willing to make sacrifices to improve their lives. He is making every effort to be successful.
He has requested this loan to buy motorcycle parts so he can continue offering his customers good service and expand his customer base.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Maguie

texts.en: Maguie is a 49-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and has two working children. She helps support her husband, who has owned an aluminum shop since 1987, through her own business as a tailor. She has her own shop located in a very strategic place in her hometown. She’s stylish, fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. This is why she’s looking today for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a wide variety of textiles and tailoring tools in order to improve her business and therefore increase her productivity. Maguie has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and augment her earnings. She’s planning to expand her business outside the country as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of textiles and tailoring tools.

loans.name: Maye 1 Group

texts.es:
Celio, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en una aldea rural del municipio de Jesús de Otoro, Intibucá. Celio desde pequeño  ha trabajado en la agricultura con su padre, donde vive tiene terrenos donde cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, además genera otros ingresos por trabajos de jornal a otros agricultores. La producción la vende en el mercado local. 
El pertenece a un grupo solidario quien tiene como nombre Maye 1 y está formado por tres miembros que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Francisco, en medio Vicente y a la derecha esta Celio, todos se dedican  a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. Han decidido solicitar un préstamo grupal por 16,800 Lempiras, para pago de derecho a instalación de energía eléctrica. 
Celio y sus miembros de grupo dicen que contar con energía eléctrica ya podrán tecnificar su producción mediante la compra e instalación de bombas para agua y sistemas de riego y sacar así buenas cosechas. Además mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Celio is 26 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings in a rural village in the Jesús de Otoros municipality in Intibucá.  Ever since he was little Celio has been working in agriculture with his father.  He has land where he lives where he cultivates basic crops like corn and beans.

He also generates other income by working as a day worker for other farmers.  He sells the production at the local market.

He belongs to the Maye 1 communal bank, which is comprised of three members.  In the photo Francisco is to the left, Vicente is in the middle, and Celio is on the right.  All of them devote themselves to farming and live in the same community.

They have decided to request a group loan for 16,800 lempiras to pay for the right to install electricity.

Celio and the members of the group say that by having electricity they will modernize their production through the purchase and installation of water pumps and watering systems.  This way they will get good harvests.  It will also improve their families’ quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the right to install electricity in order to install watering pumps.

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 55-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and three children. Two of them are working and the other is still attending school.  With the cooperation of her husband, she is able to satisfy her family needs and offer them a fair way of living.  She owns a mini market where she sells all kinds of daily items, soft drinks and many other products. As for her husband, he started working in the agriculture field 14 years ago. Nawale is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the necessary food provisions for her mini market. In that way she will be able to diversify her items, increase her revenues and improve her family’s way of living. One of her greatest dreams is to educate her youngest child and see the others achieve great positions.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary food provisions for her mini market.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 43 years old, married, and has two children.  He is from Lebanon.  In 2000, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own  farm cultivating vegetables. He takes good care of his land and always seeks to diversify his harvest to be able to satisfy his customers' needs.  He also  works as a fisherman upon customers' requests. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Ameen s.a.l, which he will use to purchase small tents to protect his plantings, required agricultural tools and other supplies, seeds, and fertilizers. He states that the loan will help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage, which will result in higher profits. In the future, he plans to request more Kiva loans and expand his harvest by cultivating a wider variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase small tents, agricultural tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, necesita mejorar el cultivo de maíz y de frijol, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que le ayudara a la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla de maíz y frijol para tener una mejor siembra y garantizarles el producto a sus clientes.
El tuvo una experincia con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo en la compra de consumos agrícolas para el cultivo del maíz y frijol y con la cosecha genero más ganancias para ayudar a su familia con la alimentación.
texts.en:
Daniel needs to improve his corn and bean crops. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan which will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and corn and bean seeds. This will allow him to have a better crop and to guarantee produce to his clients.
He gained experience from his earlier loan. It helped him to buy agricultural supplies for his corn and bean crops. With his harvest, he generated more income to help feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dental supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, oil, and seasonings.

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru:
Мусо проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женатый молодой человек. Ему 29 лет. У него трое детей. Образование у Мусо среднее. Он на протяжении четырех лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи, а также Мусо сажает фруктовые деревья. 
Мусо просит кредит для закупа семян и удобрений.
texts.en: Muso resides in the Jilikul region. He is a married young man. He is 29 years and has three children. Muso has a secondary level of education. During the course of the last four years, he has undertaken the sowing of crops. By his house, he has a small piece of land where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. Muso is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Don Tomas es un hombre de 40 años de edad esta en unión simple con su esposa y vive en Sololá. Tiene 5 hijos de ellos 4 varones de los cuales 2  estudian en la escuela y apoyan trabajando con el,  también  1 mujer que estudia y apoya en los oficios de la casa.
Es un hombre amable y sobre todo trabajador, el se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que se utilizan la mujer indígenas de su región.
Junto a sus hijos y esposa se apoyan para realizar esta actividad usando como principal herramienta llamado  (telar) donde coloca el hilo para luego realizar estas prendas. El inicio este trabajo hace 7 años atrás, después de trabajar con personas ajenas fabricando este producto. El vio que mantienen precios buenos en el mercado  de esa manera obtener buenas ganancias y mejorar la economía de su familia.
Por la temporada del año ha visto que esta prenda tiene mejor demanda, de esta manera desea invertir más capital en su materia prima. Solicita un préstamo de  Q 5,000.00 para comprar hilo tipo lana y tipo sedalina para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Tener mas herramientas de madera como los (telares)  es su mayor meta para que el pueda en un futuro entregar mayor cantidad de prendas a sus acreedores mejorando los ingresos familiares
texts.en:
Don Tomás is a 40-year-old man, is in a relationship with his wife, and lives in Sololá.  He has five children: four boys, two of which study in school and help out by working with him; and also one girl who studies and helps with the household chores.  He is a friendly man and above all, is hard-working.  He makes a living by manufacturing traditional clothing that the indigenous women of his region wear.  Together with his wife and children they help each other carry out this work, mainly using a tool called a loom where he places the thread in order to then make the garments.  He began this work seven years ago after working with other people who were making this product.  He saw that they maintained good prices in the markets and in this way made good profits and improved the financial situation of their family.

At this time of year he has seen that this clothing has greater demand, so in this way he wishes to invest more capital in his raw material.  He asks for a loan of 5,000 quetzales to buy wool and pearlized cotton thread in order to manufacture a larger quantity of garments and have better profits.  To have more wooden tools like looms is his greatest goal so that in the future he can deliver larger quantities of garments to his creditors, thus improving his family's income.

loans.use: to buy wool and pearlized cotton thread to make traditional garments.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар  женщина с добрым  характером .   Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.  Она повар и продает на  рынке свои блюда национальный плов и разные супы.  Муж  и старший сын  работают в Российской федерации.   Каждый месяц они по возможности отправляют  ей денежные средства. Гавхар хочет женить своего второго сына но на такие крупные расходы у нее нет средств.  То что сын и муж отправляют ей все уходит на проживание, поэтому она запрашивает кредит. На полученный кредит Гавхар хочет купить сыну и будущей невестке подарки на преданное.  Она очень рада, что с помощью таких организаций как Арванд и Кива люди имеющие трудности в финансовых ситуациях, могут решить свои проблемы.
texts.en: Gavhar is a woman with a kind character.  She's married and has four kids. Gavhar is a cook, she prepares and sells various traditional dishes - national pilaf and soups.  He husband and elder son work in Russia.  If they can they send Gavhar money every month.  Gavhar wants to pay for her son's wedding, but she does not have enough finances.  The money she receives from son and husband only cover her living costs, this is why she's requesting a loan. From loan proceeds Gavhar wants to purchase wedding gifts for his son and daughter in law. Gavhar is very happy that with help of Arvand and Kiva people with financial difficulties can solve their problems.

loans.use: to buy wedding gifts for her daughter-in-law and son

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 3 Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras 3,  se llama el excelente grupo de la ciudad de Itá, son 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Una de estas mujeres es Graciela, quien vende comidas de todo tipo y que gracias a esto ya tiene muy buena clientela y está saliendo adelante.
Cuenta que sus comidas son muy ricas y que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y puede darles lo básico para que no pasen por necesidades.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de carnes, condimentos, huevo, aderezos y demás insumos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que les ayudará mucho.
texts.en:
This group, from Itá is called “Las Emprendedoras 3” (The Women Entrepreneurs 3).  It’s made up of 15 very hardworking women making an effort to get ahead and help their families.  Graciela is one of the women, and she sells all types of food.  She’s getting ahead because she has a great clientele.

She says that her dishes are delicious and thanks to her work she is able to help her family and is able to provide them with the basics for their daily needs.

She is asking for this loan to buy meats, condiments, eggs, seasonings, and other ingredients.  She appreciates this opportunity, as it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy household furniture and electric appliances.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 28-year-old Lebanese man who lives by himself. He is very independent and works really hard at building his own future. After gaining four years of experience in his present occupation, he was able to open his own barber shop. He has acquired a good reputation and is building a good career with a fair number of loyal customers. He plans to use this youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a new chair after renovating his salon. In that way, he will satisfy his customer’s demands and serve them as well as possible. He goal is to expand his business and earn enough money to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Gabriela Daniela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres y sus 4 pequeños hermanos en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado, y asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y ala ganadería. Gabriela es una joven muy luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella trabaja como vendedora en un pequeño negocio de venta de celulares y por las noches estudia en la universidad la carrera de administración, cuando Gabriela termino la escuela empezó a trabajar para poder pagar sus estudios ya que sus padres son de condición humilde y con mucho esfuerzo pueden solventar los gastos de su hogar, por ello Gabriela trabaja muy duro para salir adelante y ser el orgulloso de sus padres y poder apoyar a sus hermanos menores.

Gabriela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una pequeña refrigeradora, con la cual podrá guardar de mejor manera sus alimentos y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un gran negocio y sacar adelante a su familia”.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 21 years old and lives with her parents and four younger siblings in the city of Imperial, which is known for its varied climate, agriculture, and raising livestock.  Gabriela is a young person used to struggling and she wants to get ahead in life.  She works as a saleswoman at a small store that sells cell phones.  At night, she studies management at the university.  When she finished school, she started working to be able to pay for her studies since her parents are not well off and meet their financial obligations with a lot of effort.  Gabriela works very hard to get ahead so that her parents will be proud of her and she can help support her younger siblings.

Gabriela is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase a small refrigerator, so that her family can store their food in a better way.  This will improve their quality of life.  She will continue fighting to make her dream of having a large store and improving her family's life a reality.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa is a 39-year-old conservative woman who asked her son Saleem to appear in this photo in her place. She is a government employee who works in Ministry of Education. Her husband sells merchandise for a living and they have six sons and daughters. Saleem is a university student who is learning about X-ray sciences. Asmaa is requesting this education loan to support her son and pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees.

loans.name: Maria Marixel

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, tiene 14 años de haber establecido un negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Es un negocio que lo tiene en su casa con muy  buena clientela. Ha trabajado con tres ciclos de préstamos con ODEF, el actual es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en el abastecimiento de materia prima como harina de maíz y leña para la elaboración de tortillas. Con los préstamos a mejorado su negocio ahora cuenta con una maquina manual para hacer tortillas. Ella espera seguir trabajando duro para seguir creciendo con el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María, 41, is married and has two children; she lives in the municipality of Puerto Cortes.  She has always been a merchant.  She’s been making and selling corn tortillas for 14 years. She has the business at home and she has a very good clientele.  

She’s worked with ODEF loans for three cycles and this current loan is for 20,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to stock up on raw materials like corn flour and firewood to make tortillas.  She’s improved her business with the loans and now she owns a manual tortilla-making machine.  She hopes to continue working hard to continue to expand the business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make corn tortillas.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Estas mujeres emprendieron este camino, por la gran  oportunidad que se les ofrece en la Fundación Paraguaya de otorgarles un crédito siendo ellas amas de casa y sobre todo capacitarlas para que sepan utilizar esos recursos.
Edith es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es peluquera, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo está teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a sus familiares, ella cuenta que al principio fue duro, pero fue abriéndose camino y hoy en día ya cuenta como una clientela bien definida, a quien atiende y da un buen servicio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, productos químicos y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
These ladies took this path because of the great opportunities offered to them by Fundación Paraguaya, who granted them a loan even though they are housewives, and above all provided them training so that they would know how to use these resources well.

Edith is the president of this group.  She’s a hairdresser and says that she has the means to help her family, thanks to her work.  She tells us that it was difficult at first, but the path opened up over time and now she has a good customer base to which she provides good service.

She is asking for this loan to buy shampoo, rinses, tints, chemical products, and other supplies so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Liliam Guisselly

texts.es:
Guisselly es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por la alegría de sus pobladores, su gastronomía variada y sobre todo por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano. Guisselly ella vive al lado de sus padres a quienes les esta muy agradecida ya que a pesar de los pocos recursos económicos que tienen la han apoyado en todo y sobre todo le han inculcado valores y sobre todo le han brindado mucho amor. Guisselly es una joven muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por ello con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en una fabrica de textiles de su ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres y también con mucho esfuerzo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios superiores, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque quiere ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Guisselly esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá adquirir materiales de estudio como folletos, separatas, libros, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener los materiales necesarios para poder estudiar y sobre todo seguir luchando cada día para poder seguir adelante y cumplir su mas grande sueño:”Terminar su carrera y tener un gran negocio y apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Guisselly is 19 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for the happiness of its people, the variety of food, and for being the birthplace of great glories of Peruvian sports.  Guisselly lives with her parents, to whom she is very grateful since despite their few resources they have supported her in everything, instilled her with values, and given her a lot of love.  

Guisselly is a hardworking young person who has a desire to get ahead, so she has been working hard in a textile factory in her city.  With the fruit of her work she is supporting her parents and also, with a lot of effort, she can meet the costs of her university studies.  She believes that her work is going well because she is responsible and more than anything she wants to be the pride of her parents.

Guisselly is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to purchase school supplies such as notebooks, supplements, books, and other items so that she has the necessary materials to study.  She wants to continue fighting each day to be able to get ahead and achieve her dream of finishing her studies, having a large business, and supporting her parents.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, supplements, and more.

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en: Watfa is a 51-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and lives with her husband and two working children. She’s friendly and very hardworking, and earns a living as a tailor. She is very talented at her job and has a lot of experience in this field. She’s well known in her town and works from her home so that she can meet customer demand in a short period of time. Her husband, who owns a factory, is their main breadwinner, but Watfa brings added earnings to the family. With this loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l., she will buy supplies such as textiles, needles, thread and many other items. Her goal is to open her own tailoring factory as soon as possible, so that she can enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Hakika

texts.en: Hakika is a 30-year-old married man with one 4-year-old son. For the last two years, he has been involved in carpentry. Hakika makes different types of furniture like beds, tables, etc. There has been a demand over the past few months, and he wants to meet these demands. He is requesting this loan to buy more timbers to make more furniture.

loans.use: to buy timbers to make furniture

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives in Lernagog village with her husband and son. Anush works at the local school library. She and her husband Haykaram are also involved in breeding cattle. In order to feed the cows during winter, Anush needs to purchase alfalfa for them. This is important to maintain a high quality of milk, which provides significant income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for alfalfa to feed the cattle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. Ibrahim manages the family’s household expenses while operating his business. He is the owner of a shop that sells glass and mirrors; he has owned this shop since 2009. He sells different mirror styles and glass, in addition to many related home accessories. His shop is located in his town where many customers from his community visit him to benefit from his beautiful items at fair prices. Ibrahim works very hard to maintain his family’s finances at a good level. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his inventory of mirrors, glass, and many other items. He earns a small income and confirms that the loan will help him boost sales--and therefore income--by 15%.

loans.use: to expand his inventory of mirrors and glass

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 22 years old, has 8 siblings. All of them are living with their mother, following their father’s death. 

After successfully passing the high school exams, he was enrolled in the university and chose to study Computer Information Systems. He wants to finish his studies so he can work properly, and get a salary to help support the rest of the family. They are saving as much as they can to help him pay for school. 

Mohammad has applied for this loan to pay his upcoming semester fees, to help decrease the financial pressure on the family.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his parents and three siblings. He wants to have his own family and children, and this is why he’s working nonstop to improve his life financially.
