Mohammad is his family's main breadwinner and earns a living by installing curtains on a freelace basis. He visits his customers at their home or workplaces and is committed to offer them high-quality work. He is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy an electrical generator for his business and some metallic rails and screws. This loan will allow him to work more efficiently and increase his productivity. In the future, he plans to open his own curtain factory.

loans.use: to buy an electrical generator for his business along with metallic rails and screws

loans.name: Valon

texts.en:
Valon wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which help him to increase his profit. 
With the previous loan he had bought spare parts for motorcycle and was able to increase his business profit. 
Valon used these profits to help his family and he managed to improve the conditions for his family life. Valon is very satisfied with his business and he plans to continue in the future.   

Valon is now requesting a second loan for this business to buy  motorcycles /scooters.
He hopes to increase, expand and generate income from his business even more and provide a secure life for his family.

He would like to thank again Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To buy motorcycles /scooters

loans.name: Razan

texts.en: Razan is a 19-year-old single lady living with her three siblings and her parents. Her father works in the customs department, while her mother is a housewife. Razan is a second-year university student majoring in business administration. She has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
La  Señora Gladys  tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, reside en compañía de dos de sus hijos y dos nietos en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa, Departamento de Cortés.
Doña Gladys  se dedicaba a empleo privado pero hace 2 años fue cesanteada de su empleo y decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Ella vende cremas, lociones, acondicionadores para cabello y productos de belleza para damas y caballeros. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargo.
Con el propósito de ampliar la oferta de productos, Doña Gladys ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras.
Considera que con el apoyo financiero obtenido logrará crecer en su negocio para lograr una mejoría en su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Gladys, 50, is the mother of five children.  She lives with two of her children and two grandchildren in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa, Cortés Department.

Gladys used to be a private employee but two years ago she lost her job and decided to start selling cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells creams, lotions, hair conditioner and beauty products for women and men.  She sells from place to place and to order.

Aiming at widening her stock of merchandise, Gladys has requested a 6,000 Lempira loan.  She believes that with financial help she’ll attain business growth that will lead to an improvement in the quality of her family life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children, one of whom is working. Since 2010, she has worked as a private teacher. She adores her profession because she feels that she is helping learners to get a needed education. She receives her students at home, in a small room that is arranged for teaching. Her husband has worked as a painter on a free-lance basis for more than 20 years. They both cooperate together to seek a new and better way of living. Today, Amale is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip the teaching room with the needed chairs, table, board, stationery, and other items. She also wants to renovate the room to be able to receive more students. This will be a good beginning for her, especially if she continues to offer the best she has to better educate her students. This will definitely increase her earnings, thus her way of living.

loans.use: to equip the teaching room with chairs, table, board, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Assogba

texts.fr: Assogba est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Assogba est marié à une marchande du nom de Léa. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Assogba vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Assogba mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la coiffure dans sa région. Assogba s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Assogba sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Assogba is 38 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Léa. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school. Together, Assogba and Léa care for their children and pay for all of the household expenses. Assogba has been running his hairdressing business in his region for fifteen years. Assogba purchases his supplies from merchants in his region as well. His hairdressing business is what allows Assogba to be able to pay for his share of the various family expenses.

Assogba is currently seeking his third loan from Alidé, his first two loans having been repaid in full. He plans to use this loan to purchase hair-cutting supplies. This will allow him to increase the level of customer satisfaction for his clientele. The loan will certainly help Assgoba to gain more business as a hairdresser, and thus earn more income.

loans.use: to buy scissors and clippers for his hairdressing business.

loans.name: Al-Sagwr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sagwr, and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They work hard to offer a good life for their family. all members of this group applied a loan of 140000 YER from AMB.

Krama is the leader of this group. She is 46 years old, a married woman with nine children. She is a housewife who wishes her children to grow up well and get a better education. She owns a small house. Krama has applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy construction materials to build a room and a bathroom for her house. She hopes to buy electrical material, so she can live comfortable with her children. 

She hopes to open a furniture store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room and a bathroom for her house.

loans.name: Al-Waeel Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Waeel, which consists of three men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 260,000 YER.

Ismael is a 50-year-old, married man who has five children. He works hard to help his family in making a living and providing them with most of their needs. He owns a house and he intends to buy supplies for it. He applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to buy kitchenware for his house.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware for his house.

loans.name: Ramón Enrique

texts.es:
El Señor Ramón tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de sus padres e hijos en  el municipio de Yoro, Departamento de Yoro.
Ramón anteriormente  trabajaba como empleado asalariado, hace aproximadamente 2 años  que se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería. Él vende granos básicos (arroz, maíz y frijoles), embutidos, refrescos, golosinas y productos de aseo y limpieza.
Debido a la necesidad de generar más ganancias para el sustento familiar, decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de carne de cerdo, de pollo, abarrotería.
 Ramón espera aumentar más las ventas ya que está surtiendo su negocio con productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramón, 34, is single and has two children.  He lives with his parents and children in the municipality of Yoro, Yoro Department.

Ramón used to work as a salaried employee but for about the last two years he’s been selling groceries in a grocery store.  He sells basic grains (rice, corn and beans), canned goods, soft-drinks, snacks and cleaning supplies.

Needing to generate more profits to support his family he decided to request a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy pork, chicken and groceries.  Ramón hopes to increase sales more since he’s stocking the store with products being requested by his customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Geovani

texts.en:
Geovani hails from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  He is 27 years old, and a married man. For a living, he farms rice, drives a motorcycle (a habal-habal, which has an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) and raises hogs.  

He is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy fertilizer, feed and rice. He works hard so he can provide his wife with the basic needs. 

In the future, he hopes to save so he can apply and process his application to work abroad.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and rice

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La  Señora Virginia  tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera, reside en compañía de sus padres en el municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Doña Virginia  se dedica a oficios domésticos  y además con fin de apoyar económicamente a sus padres hace 5 años que ella se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la producción de maíz para la venta.
Para la siembra y producción de maíz ella utiliza un terreno que es  propiedad de sus padres.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos y preparación del suelo para la siembra de 2 manzanas de maíz.
Doña Virginia Espera obtener una mayor producción en la cosecha para aumentar sus ingresos y contribuir con el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Virginia, 42, is single living with her parents in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro Department.  She works doing domestic chores but in addition to this aiming at helping her parents economically she’s been working in agriculture, specifically growing corn to sell, for the last five years.  She uses land that belongs to her parents to plant and grow the corn.

She’s asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan at present that she plans to use to buy supplies and to prepare the soil to plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of corn.  Virginia hopes to obtain a greater crop yield to increase income and contribute to family support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Aons Group

texts.en:
This group is called Aons and consists of five women and one man ; all of them are friends from Aden, Yemen. The group took a loan of 180,000 YER.

Safia is the leader of a group. She is 40 years old, married with two children, and lives in Taiz, Yemen.

Her main business is livestock. She buys and sells sheep and goats. She has been in business for many years. She started her business with a small amount of capital. She is taking a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business. She will purchase sheep and goats to increase her savings. 

Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. She hopes to have a farm.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Siznak village, Syunik region. Anahit works at the local village hall. In addition, she is involved in cattle breeding together with her husband: they raise cows, lambs, and chickens. 

The barn where Anahit keeps the livestock is too old and does not permit her to create necessary conditions for livestock during the autumn rainy season and cold winter. Thus, Anahit plans to construct a new barn for the livestock, for which she has applied for this loan. In addition, Anahit will purchase 20 lambs. 

Agricultural income is vital for Anahit to sustain her household, and its development will allow her to earn more income and improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and pay for construction of a new barn.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 59-year-old Lebanese man. He got married to Wafaa and has two children. One is studying and the youngest is working.  Rashed is the one responsible for managing his family’s household expenses while operating his business and paying his child’s study fees as well. 

He has been the owner of a home products shop since 2009. He sells different types of plates, plastic items, cups, and many other products at reasonable prices. Rashed keeps on working very hard in order to maintain his family’s financial status at a good level. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his product inventory. In that way, he will be able to boost his sales, thus his income by at least 15%. He badly wishes to amplify his income to offer his family a respectable life far from problems and complications.

loans.use: to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
La  Señora María  tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Departamento de Cortés.
Doña María  se ha dedicado desde siempre a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería, tiene 17 años de poseer su negocio. Ella vende arroz, manteca, sopas instantáneas, cereales, medicamentos de uso común, sardinas, refrescos y golosinas.
Actualmente ha solicitado su tercer préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en compra de carnes, lácteos, frijoles, arroz, productos de aseo y refrescos.
Doña María está convencida de que al surtir su negocio, sus ventas e ingresos crecen, lo que le permite mejorar constantemente su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, is single and lives in the municipality of Choloma in the department of Cortes.

Maria has always worked selling food in her grocery store.  She's had this business for 17 years.  She sells rice, butter, instant soups, cereals, commonly used medications, sardines, beverages and snacks.  

She is now requesting her 3rd loan, in the amount of 21,000 Honduran lempiras.  She plans to use the loan to buy meat, dairy products, beans, rice, cleaning products and beverages.

Maria is convinced that if she stocks up her store her sales and income will grow, allowing her to continuously improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, beans, rice, cleaning products and beverages

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es un grupo de 14 mujeres que se esfuerzan por ayudar a sus familias, y gracias a ese esfuerzo ya están en su ciclo numero 4. Son madres, que luchan por sus hijos, ya que desean poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Norma es la presidenta, y cuenta que sus amigas están muy contentas por formar el comité, ya que les ha ayudado mucho, las capacitaciones que reciben les ayuda a poder administrar bien los créditos que reciben en cada ciclo. Ella dice que tiene una despensa en su casa, y que por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia, y solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser yerba, carne, fideos, aceite, arroz, carbón y demás, ya que son los que mas vende.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is a group of fourteen women, striving to help their families, which is why they are now in their fourth cycle. They are hard-working mothers that want to give their children what they could not have themselves.

Norma is the group’s president and she says that her friends are very happy to be part of the committee, and that the training sessions have helped them to learn how to manage in a good way the loans they receive in each cycle.

She says that she has a grocery store at her house, which helps her support her family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy supplies for her store, like yerba [mate], meat, noodles, oil, rice, and coal, among other highly demanded supplies.

loans.use: to buy yerba [mate], meat, noodles, oil, rice, and coal, among other supplies.

loans.name: Abdulathim

texts.en:
Abdulathim is 26 years old. He is the father of one baby. He strives and works hard so that he can provide him a decent life. He resides in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is a very hardworking man. He operates a bookshop. He believes things are going well for him at work because he is very kind to the customers and, above all, he has also a taxi who works in evening. he is a very responsible man. He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his taxi. He dreams to have a big stationary store and buy a car to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Ameena Group

texts.en:
The Ameena group consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Ameena, 26 years old, is married and has one child. She is the woman whose face is showing in the photo. Not long ago, Ameena bought a small house. She needs to make several improvements, but mainly she wants to buy a fridge. Ameena doesn't have the necessary money to make the improvements, so she's requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy the fridge. Ameena hopes to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Haddah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haddah and consists of four men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 560,000 YER from AMB.

Ahmed is 48 years old. He is married and has six children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employer who works hard to help out his family which has social needs. In some ways he is the breadwinner for his family and they resort to him to sort out all their problems. Although his income is not that consistent, he does what he can to help them. He took out a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a bookstore for two years. He opened this business with a small amount. 

Nabil is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB Bank, which he will use to buy bookstore supplies for his business to meet the demands of his clients. In the future, he hopes to be a successful merchant and to have retail stores.

loans.use: to buy bookstore supplies for his business.

loans.name: Al-Zhor Al-Baitha Group

texts.en:
The Al-Zhor Al-Baitha group consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work hard as much they can to offer a good life for their families. The group has taken out a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.
Suria, the leader of this group, is the woman holding a handbag in the photo. She is 25 years old, married and has one child. Suria is a housewife who wants her child to grow up well and have a better education. She intends to buy supplies for her house so she has applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER to buy a fridge for her house. Suria hopes to buy home appliances to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 42 años de edad, es  casado, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su esposa  e hijos en  el municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Don José anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como jornal, con la ayuda de algunos ahorros logro establecer su taller  de ebanistería, dicho oficio lo ejerce hace 9 años.
En su negocio fabrica muebles de cocina, roperos, chifonier, gabeteros, puertas, ventanas y contramarcos.
Actualmente Don José ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 14,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de madera de color como: caoba, cedro y laurel.
 Él piensa que al realizar esta compra de madera, ahorrara tiempo al momento de necesitar dicha materia prima.
Don José tiene dentro de sus metas, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y asegurar una buena alimentación para su familia.
texts.en:
José, 42, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro Department.  He used to work as a day laborer but with help from some savings he succeeded in setting up his cabinet-making workshop; he’s been in this occupation for nine years.  He manufactures kitchen cabinets, armoires, chiffonniers, file cabinets, doors, windows and counter frames.

José has decided to request a 14,000 Lempira loan to buy colored wood like mahogany, cedar and laurel.  He believes that by purchasing the wood he will save time when the moment of need arises.  Among José’s goals is to provide good education for his children and to insure that his family has adequate food supply.

loans.use: to buy mahogany, cedar and laurel.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Lebanese married man. He’s 42 years old, married, and has three children. He’s really attached to his wife and children. 

Together, Mohammad and his wife were capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business as a car mechanic, and he had to work really hard to prove he can support his family. He has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. His wife works as a teacher at a local school. 

He is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanic tools for his business, so he can respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. 

He believes that acting properly is really essential to attracting additional customers. He seeks to develop his work in the near future, and to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems.

loans.name: Tojimurod

texts.ru:
Точимурод житель района Дж. Руми. Он женат. Ему 43 года. У него трое детей. Жена Точимурода портниха. Сам Точимурод занимается растениеводством, он работает в дехканском хозяйстве. В этой области он уже несколько лет. 
Точимурод берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки для своей жены. Он хочет чтобы она начала свою деятельность. Его жена не любит фотографироваться, поэтому Точимурод один на фотографии.
texts.en:
Tojimurod is a resident of J. Rumi district. He is 43 years old and married. He has three children. Tojimurod's wife is seamstress. Tojimurod raises crops, working on a small, family-owned farm. He has been in this field for several years already.

Tojimurod is taking out a loan to purchase a sewing machine for his wife. He wants her to start her own business. His wife dislikes being photographed, which is why Tojimurod is the only one in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine so that his significant other can practice her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 24 years old, engaged man  who lives in Sana`a,Yemen.

Ali started his business selling different products in street. He continues bringing in more products until he noticed he had converted his business to a grocery store. He has been operating this business for three years. He always relies on his strength and plans to expand his business.
 
Ali is taking out the youth loan of 200000 to buy oil, beans, sugar, bread, coffee, milk and soft drinks. He hopes very much that would support him in his business.  Ali's goal is to give a good future to his children and make his grocery store productive and profitable and to own a supermarket.

loans.use: buy stocks for his grocery business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, John has been working hard to manage his restaurant, which sells cooked food.

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chairs, one new fridge, and plates and cups for the restaurant. It will help John to generate greater profits and improve on his income benefits. John hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, one new fridge, and plates and cups for the restaurant,

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Hanifah has been working hard to manage her hair-dressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetics like body lotions and hair extensions, and will help Hanifah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Hanifah hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Ms Saleem is a married woman. She is 53 years old and has three children. She is running a shop of bangles with her husband since 12 years. Her husband assists her in buying the stocks of bangles from the market. They serve well in their community. Now, she requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 for buying a great variety of bangles in large quantity for the upcoming event of Eid (an Islamic festival). She has taken several loans from Kashf previously, which she has repaid on time. She is expecting a boost in her sales and wishes to spend the part of profits on the improvement of her house. Saleem shared her views that microfinance has changed her family’s life by supporting them through loans and enabled her to improve the standard of living of her family and she is able to send her children to school. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of bangles.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of four. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband.  Her husband has been successfully running a small dry cleaning shop in her community for the last eight years. Her husband counts a good client list by fulfilling the demands and standards of customers. Nasreen also assists her husband in pressing the dresses on time.  They are happily doing it together to run their household expenses. 

Nasreen is motivated to provide for her family and she wants to grow her husband’s business, so she requested for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy more packs of cleaning products and starch from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her first loan cycle. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more packs of cleaning products and starch from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Savoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Savoeurt, a young mother of one daughter, is 26 years old and a citizen of Sangke district of Cambodia. She makes a living through rice farming on three hectares of farmland and her husband works as a blacksmith.

For the four years that she has engaged in this business, she is able to earn about 43,000 KHR and save about 14,000 KHR per day after offsetting daily expenses. This is her first loan cycle and the second loan cycle for her fellow group member with Kiva partner, VisionFund; they are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Savoeurt is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to earn more profit from her current business and keep up good living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Las Juanas Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se unieron con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Estas mujeres desean dejar atrás todos los obstáculos que tienen.
Leoncia es miembro del grupo, y dice que se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo, cuenta que le va bien ya que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella, ya que sus productos siempre son frescos. Las frutas que siempre vende son de estación y por sobre todo muy frescas.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser sandias, melones, piñas, manzanas, naranjas y demás, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Caacupé formed a group with the intention to help their families through their work and effort. These women want to overcome all the hindrances they have encountered.

Leoncia is a member of this group, and she says that she sells all kinds of fruits. She says that she is doing well and that she has a fair amount of customers that prefer her products because they are always fresh. She sells always seasonal, but most of all, very fresh fruits.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seasonal fruits, like watermelons, melons, pineapples, apples and oranges, among other fruits, with the intention of being able to offer her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy fruits, such as watermelons, melons, pineapples, apples and oranges, among other.

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en:
Hasib is a Lebanese married man; he’s 47 years old. He’s married to Khadija, the mother of his three school-aged children.  Together, Hasib and his wife were capable of covering their heavy expenses to live a respectable life.

Hasib started his business at an early age, where he gained the needed experience to open his own garage. He’s a car black smith specialist (auto body repair), and has loyal customers who visit him from all over the neighboring areas.  

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy the needed tools for his business such as metal and many other items, so he can respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. 

He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract additional customers. In the future, he plans to open other branches and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy the needed tools for his business such as metal and many other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  She has no additional family member she looks after.

For 4 years, she has been selling fish in the market on a retail basis.  She works 6 days a week. The other source of income is through rearing pigs.

Kevin has applied for a loan of Shs. 300,000 to be able to buy fish for sale.  The challenges of her business are seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler of fish, and to buy land and build a home.  

She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because services are brought nearer to the members.  Kevin is renting the house she stays in; the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  The greatest monthly expenses for Kevin include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari, 26, is a single gentleman who sells fruits and vegetables door-to-door using his bicycle. He is a responsible man, friendly and fully committed to whatever he is doing. 

He has operated the business for two years and can rely on the loyal set of customers that he has gained in those years. He says that his hopes for the future are to grow his business and open a grocery store. 

He is applying for a Yehu loan that he will use to buy more fruits and vegetables that he will resell.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables that he will resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and lives in Bocator. Fe is married with 3 children. 

Fe has a shop that sells various type of products. Fe has had this business for five  years. 

Fe requested a loan to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and  dry goods. Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and  dry goods

loans.name: Fe Glenda

texts.en:
Fe Glenda is 37 years old and lives in P7, Polao Tangub City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Fe Glenda has a buy and sell, ready-to-wear business and earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase an appliance for her family. 

Fe Glenda has been a member of PMPC for 2 months.

loans.use: to purchase an appliance to use for her family.

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Josephine is married with three children. 
Josephine has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 20 years. Josephine requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 
Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Josephine hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with three children. She is 59 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban.
Evangeline is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years.
Evangeline has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial ones. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. 
In the future, Evangeline hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial ones

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is married with two children. Clarisa is 31 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela.
Clarisa is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Clarisa has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed. 
Clarisa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Clarisa hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en: Leab, 37 years old, is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for thirteen years. She is able to earn about 18,000KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000KHR each day after paying for daily expenses. A lack of working capital to support her business is the main challenge for her rice paddy business. Leab’s group consists of six members who live in the same village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia and she is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Leab and her group members are applying for a loan of 160,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine, including toilet bowls, tile drainage etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married with one child. She is 70 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosalia is a farmer raising and selling pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. 

Rosalia has been a member of PMPC for  11 years. In the future, Rosalia hopes to have  enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase  piglets to sell

loans.name: Juana Imelda

texts.es: Juana de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y  sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, todo el producido lo comercia en diferentes alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Juana es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo por un futuro mas próspero, sabe que solo con amor y constancia alcanzará el éxito que tanto desea. En la última temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol y herbicida. Juana tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and lives together with her life partner and children in her own house. She makes a living cultivating corn and beans. She has been working in agriculture for a number of years, which has given her valuable experience and allows her to grow the best crops. The land she cultivates is located in an area with a lot of agricultural activity and is close to where she lives. Everything she produces she sells in various parts of the community, and she already has a lot of clients who prefer her produce because of the quality, good prices and above all the excellent service.

Juana is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She works hard every day in hopes of a more prosperous future, and she knows that only with love and perseverance can she achieve the success she desires.

In the last planting season she suffered several losses that she wishes to recoup. For this reason she is asking Integral for a loan which will allow her to buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, herbicide, etc. Juana Enalda has good payment references and is very responsible. She is sure that she will be able to pay back her debt and at the same time trusts that the loan will give her and her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, beans, insecticide, and herbicide

loans.name: Lilian Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Lilian tiene 25 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Lilian hace 7 meses decidió establecer un negocio de venta de alimentos y productos de la canasta básica a través de una pulpería. Se vio motivada a establecer dicho negocio para contribuir con su hogar y lograr independencia económica.
Ella vende arroz, harina de maíz y de trigo, frijoles, azúcar, salsinas, productos de higiene personal y del hogar, medicamentos de uso común, refrescos y golosinas.
Lilian ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de  carnes, verduras, embutidos, lácteos, productos de aseo y refrescos para surtir mas su negocio.
Lilian manifiesta estar muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero brindado ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos lo que le permitirá crecer día a día en su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Lilian, 25, is married and has a son; she lives with her family in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  Seven months ago Lilian decided to start selling food and basic staples in a grocery store.  She was motivated to start said business in order to contribute towards her home and attain economic independence.  She sells rice, corn and wheat flour, beans, sugar, sauces, personal hygiene and household supplies, common-use medicines, soft-drinks and snacks.

Lilian has requested a 25,000 Lempira loan to use to buy meat, vegetables, canned goods, dairy products, cleaning supplies and soft-drinks to better stock her store.  Lilian mentions that she’s very grateful for the financial support provided because she will be able to improve her income this way and that will allow her to gradually grow in the business and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Nelson Filander

texts.es: Nelson de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de café, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores siembras, el terreno de cultivo tiene alto potencial para la cosecha y esta cercano a su vivienda, comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Nelson se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y humildad, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, dia a dia lucha y se esfuerza por un futuro mejor pues sabe que solo así logrará el éxito. En la última temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido al clima, y ahora quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de café, insecticida, herbicida, algunas herramientas, etc. Nelson tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancelará la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson, age 44, lives with his life partner and their children.  He grows coffee, and he has been working in agriculture for several years.  This has gifted him with valuable experience, which allows him to get the best crops.

The land that he cultivates has a great potential for the harvest, and it is close to his home.  He sells in the areas surrounding his place.  He has a lot of clientele who prefer him for the quality, good prices, and, above all, the excellent service.  Nelson is known for his great kindness and humility.  He is an enterprising man, devoted to his work, and he has a lot of goals he wishes to achieve.

He struggles and works hard day to day for a better future.  He knows that it is only by doing this that he will achieve success.  During the last planting season he had some losses due to the weather.  He now wants to recover and increase the production.

That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to buy coffee seeds, insecticide, herbicide, and some tools, etc.  Nelson has good payment references and a high moral character.  He affirms that he will repay the loan, and he is confident that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds, insecticide, herbicide, and some tools, etc.

loans.name: Almas

texts.en:
Ms. Almas is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been doing business in clothes sales for the last 30 years at her home. This is a family business of Almas. In this business, she buys clothes from the market and then sells all the stock to her neighbors as well as her relatives at a rational price. 

Almas’ husband is a laborer. Due to his low income, he is not able to support the family of ten members alone. So Almas is working to contribute to the family's income.

Almas has been in association with Kashf for three years. She contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer and hence she was able to access quality microfinance services, which played a vital role in her business growth. 

She needs a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy more packs of clothes by considering the choice and taste of her customers. With a lot of variety in it, her business will attract many customers, sales will improve and the profit margin will also increase.

loans.use: to buy more packs of clothes by considering the choice and taste of her customers.

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en:
Ranilo has been a rice farmer for two years now. He is 33 years old, married and has a five-year-old daughter. 

The previous harvest season has been good to him, and so he is looking forward to a better income this time around. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, healthy seedlings, and to pay for labor fees for his crops. 

He hopes to be able to continue improving his livelihood so he can better provide for his child. The additional income will go to his daughter's needs and his family’s daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and healthy seedlings, and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jocelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her family's future with all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, creams, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en: He is a Construction major at Hanoi University of Mining and Geology (http://www.humg.edu.vn/vi/). His course of study lasts 50 months and he will graduate in 2016. Truc’s family has five members. He is the second child in his family to have graduated high school and pursue a higher education. His father raises pigs and his mother sells pork in the market to earn a living. His family’s income is about 4,000,000 VND. His mother is Lan, who sits next to him in this picture, and she is also a member of SEDA’s credit program. Truc has a passion for his major. He wants to build towers to create a better standard of living for citizens. He wants to graduate and then he can do his dream and help his family as well as contribute to the country. He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for his education fees. Besides lacking money for his education, Truc has other difficulties, such as the cost of study tools, his living fees and transportation fees. Truc says that he appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program and that this type of program has done a lot to support the education of students in Vietnam.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
This is Luz, 62, a resident of Payatas in the Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a scavenger, and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Luz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luz dreams to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix, he previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that he used to buy additional stocks of salon supplies and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of salon supplies and products. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Felix hopes to grow his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of salon supplies and products needed in his business

loans.name: Jowelyn

texts.en:
This is Jowelyn. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and with her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profit from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jowelyn hopes to give her child a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan used to be Ruma’s business partner before he decided to become Ruma’s field officer when he got a text message from his field officer in Serang. The offer gave him an opportunity to join Ruma as a Field Officer. He has been working as a field officer for 1.5 years. He enjoys Ruma because of the kinship value in this social enterprise. Irfan is married with a 3-year-old child, who lives also with his wife in Serang. His wife is a housewife.

As a branch head in Bogor Barat, Irfan needs to live in another city that takes more than 3-4 hours by motorcycle. This motorcycle will not only help him improve the Bogor Barat branch but also control and monitor his staff, finding good prospective Ruma business partners that will help to have sustained business with Ruma.

Ruma’s network management manager recommended Irfan because the branch head needs to have the capacity to control both the office and their field officers, and also the field. And a motorcycle is the best tool for Irfan to manage all of his roles and responsibility.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as transportation for managing his branch office and its area

loans.name: Murodi

texts.en:
Originally, Murodi lived in Jakarta, but since he was chosen to be a Ruma branch head, he moved to Bogor Timur. He is single and his mother is only a housewife. Another interesting story about him is that he used to be Ruma’s business partner before he decided to become Ruma’s field officer in the Jakarta Branch. He has been working with Ruma for almost 1.5 years.

As a Ruma branch head, he feels that a motorcycle is needed to actually run the business, especially in controlling and monitoring the field. Previously as a Field Officer, the only thing he needed to take care of were his business partners. But now, with bigger power comes bigger responsibility. He needs to take care not only of Ruma’s business partners, but also of the Field Officers who work in his branch. And a motorcycle will definitely help him to move around.

Ruma’s Network Management Manager recommended him because Murodi needs a motorcycle to conquer the new area where Ruma’s branch is established. And of course it will help his business partners to generate more income too so they can have a better livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and use it for transportation while managing his branch and its area

loans.name: Bachtiar

texts.en:
Bachtiar has been working with Ruma for 20 months. He started with Ruma because he was interested to become Ruma’s business partner in Tangerang. When his Field Officer offered a job with Ruma, he accepted. That was his first time becoming Ruma’s employee. His parent works in also warung business. As a field officer he managed his Ruma business partner. But now, he is serving as a branch head in Ruma’s Bogor Utara branch. In his position, he needs to manage the office, control field officers and their profit. He is very proud to be in Ruma because he can contribute to the development of the social enterprise.

With this motorcycle loan, Bachtiar and Ruma’s network management manager believe that the motorcycle will help Bachtiar to expand and visit the field more.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and use it as transport while managing the branch and its area

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single business lady and owns a green grocery stall, which she has been operating for over seven years. In this business, Monica sells greens, fruits, vegetables, etc. Monica set up the business from the income she obtained from sale of eggs.

Monica learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is the high cost of purchasing stock.

Monica is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale and to pay school fees. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay for the price of buying land. Her plan is to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Edwin Saul

texts.es:
Edwin de 37 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive junto a tres hijos y su esposa. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado maíz, y espera poder incluirle frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar. 

Edwin solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, además de semillas de frijol para iniciar la siembra cuanto antes y no perder el poco invierno que aún queda en el país. Edwin ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Edwin, 37, is a kind, hardworking man living with his three children and his wife.  He works hard on his own land, which currently grows corn and he hopes to plant beans as well. They are very good quality products and his parcel is located in an easily accessed zone which is very good for him because it’s an advantage that his customers can reach him.

Edwin is asking Integral for a loan to invest in farming inputs such as insecticides and fertilizer, as well as seeds to start planting beans, in order to take advantage of the few remaining winter months in his country.  Edwin hopes to increase sales in order to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to invest in farming inputs such as insecticides and fertilizer, as well as seeds to start planting beans

loans.name: Adelino

texts.es:
El Señor Adelino tiene 39 años de edad, es  casado, tiene 6 hijos, reside en compañía de su esposa  e hijos en  el municipio de Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Don Adelino anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero y ayudante de albañil, en la actualidad se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de maíz.
Él aprendió a cultivar la tierra desde muy joven, ya que apoyaba a su padre en esta faena.
Actualmente Don Adelino ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para el manejo del cultivo.
Él piensa que el apoyo financiero recibido le ayudara a ampliar las parcelas de producción y así poder aumentar sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Adelino, 39, is married and has six children.  He lives in the company of his wife and children in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro Department.  Adelino used to work as a day laborer and as a bricklayer’s helper and currently works in agriculture, specifically growing corn.  He learned to till the soil when he was very young since he’d help his father with this task.

Currently, Adelino is requesting a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and to pay labor costs for crop maintenance.  He believes that the financial support received will help him expand his parcels in production to increase his crop yields.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs for soil preparation.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Benigno and is a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lorna operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low-selling prices and the many options Lorna offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorna hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is a single mother with three children.  All three children are in school.  She has no additional family member she cares for.  

Farida is a tailor and she sells clothes.  She sells her clothes in a shop on a retail basis. She works seven days a week.  She has been in this business for ten years.  Farida has no other source of income.  

She has applied for a loan of Shs. 200,000 to enable her to buy more rolls of clothing materials for sale.  

The challenge she has is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are to buy a piece of land and build rooms for renting.  She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because the services are rendered to low-income women.  Farida owns the house she stays in and they have access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian This is her second term loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to diversify her business into motorcycle transport. She will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle so that, besides selling fruits and vegetables, she can earn additional income from the transport business.

She hopes to educate her children without any difficulty in paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to diversify her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school.

Angela is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angela has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Maria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Dwi lives in Tangerang, but now he has been posted for more than 6 months to Jakarta Utara as a branch head. To travel from his hometown area, it takes about 2-2.5 hours by car to go back and forth. Before becoming a branch head, he worked in Ruma’s Tangerang branch; his first day was 1.5 years ago. Dwi is married and has one child. His wife is an employee.

As a field officer, he only worked to manage Ruma’s business partners. But as a branch head, it is not only Ruma’s business partners he needs to manage, but also the field officers in the branch and their partners. This means a lot to him, because the more titles you have, the greater your roles and responsibilities. 

Ruma’s managers recommend him because he has a good attitude and really needs to have a motorcycle loan to help Ruma reach its vision which is helping the poor. And the motorcycle will definitely do that.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and use it as transport while managing the Ruma branch and its area

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a 45-year-old man from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of  five school-aged children. Eugenio has been engaged in farming business for more than five years now. He grows rice and bananas on his farm. This is the only source of his income.

Eugenio is asking for additional capital for his business. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the plants and to pay for the rent and maintenance of the machinery and equipments used on the farm.

Eugenio dreams of expanding his farming venture in the future to generate more income necessary for the expenses of his family and schooling of his children.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and equipment costs

loans.name: Berton

texts.en:
Berton originally lived in Bogor, but has had to move to Tangerang to become a Ruma branch head there. He’s married and has one child; his family still lives in Bogor. Before becoming a branch head, Berton was Ruma’s field officer in Bogor. Prior to that, he was actually one of Ruma’s business partners selling pulsa.

His main job in working as an field officer was to find new people in the field who wanted to become Ruma business partners. Now as a branch head, he will be making sure his field officers do the right thing, and also managing complaints from the field, acting as the representative from Ruma’s office.

His parents work as farmers in the village, and now by becoming a branch manager he hopes that he will give a better life to the family. He hopes with this motorcycle loan, he will be able to work well and it will be easier to be in the field, especially since Tangerang is a big area here. Ruma’s network management manager believes that Berton needs a motorcycle to visit his branch’s Ruma business partners, and make sure they are satisfied with Ruma’s services.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and use it as transport while managing the Ruma branch and its area

loans.name: Simsahei Group

texts.en:
In 2009, a group of 5 Kuki tribal women from the Northeastern part of India, in the state of Manipur and village of Motbung, formed a collective group in order to work together on expanding their businesses.  

One member of this group is Pi Kholneikim, the one with her hand raised in the photo.  She is 30 years old and has one son and two daughters, who attend the village school.   The family's main source of income comes from Pi Kholneikim's sale of her livestock at the local market.  She has become very proficient at raising her farm animals, which are mostly pigs, chickens and ducks.  She also works in her homestead garden where she grows  cabbages, corn and potatoes to sell at the market.  Her harvest is able to provide food for her livestock and her whole family, as well.
 
Pi Kholneikim is requesting a loan of INR 10,000 in order to buy 4 more piglets, chickens and ducks to raise until full grown.  She dreams of expanding her business enough to raise piglets full-time and expand her piggery.  

The rest of the members of the group have learned from Pi Kholneikim's techniques and have started raising piglets themselves.  They also have businesses that support their families, weaving traditional garments, agriculture, and clothing sales. 

Simsahei Group requested a loan from WSDS which serves the women of very remote tribal areas  of Northeast India and provides business capital which they can't get elsewhere.

loans.use: to raise & feed animals (4 more piglets, chickens and ducks) for wholesale and expand her piggery.

loans.name: Sarah (B) Group

texts.en:
Pictured is a 14-member women's group called Sarah-B in the village of Makokching in the hills of Northeastern India (state of Manipur). The group members are quite jolly in supporting each other, as Christian neighbors and business owners.   

Pi Nengneihoi (with her right hand raised) is 28 years old and owns a small hand-built grocery & variety shop in her village (the shop seen in the background of the picture).   

She is a mother of one young daughter and is dedicated to making her shop a success so her daughter can get a good education.  

She has gained confidence in herself and her business sense.  She was able to open this shop due to the first loan she received from WSDS of Rs. 5,000 INR. 

Pi Nengneihoi plans to expand her business and start saving for her daughter’s education.  She is requesting a loan of Rs. 10000 INR to procure 1 bag of dal (Rs.3000), 1 bag of sugar (Rs. 2000), 1 bag of rice (Rs. 2300) and 3 bags of potatoes (Rs. 2400). 

The other group members are using a portion of their loans for their weaving business that keeps the tribal customs alive through traditional garments;  purchasing livestock such as pigs or poultry which is able to provide good earnings for their families and growing fruits and vegetables to sell at the markets.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sugar, rice, dhal (lentils), and more for her small grocery store servicing her village.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a 43-year-old married man and father of five school-aged children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. Julito has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the only source of his daily income.

Julito has hopes of improving his fishing venture but lacks the capital to do so. Because of that, he is asking for a loan worth 6000 PHP to buy a new engine for his fishing boat. Through this, Julito will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

Julito dreams for a better life together with his family.

loans.use: buy a new engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Domnem, the woman raising her hand in the picture, is 48 years old and belongs to a Kuki tribe of Manipur. Her husband died 10 years ago, leaving in her care two sons and a daughter. 

All these years she has been working very hard. She had to take any job that came along, many a time working as a daily wager (day laborer) to support her family. After the death of her husband, it was difficult for her alone to support her family and the children’s education. Her two elder sons had to drop out from school and the eldest son did carpentry work to earn some money for the family. But Domnem, despite all the difficulties, insists on supporting her youngest, a daughter, to continue her studies, and today her daughter is reading in class nine.

In 2009, one of Domnem's friends informed her that they were forming a group to access a loan from WSDS and she asked Domnem if she would like to join the group. She grasped the opportunity and became a member of Ruth Group. The same year, she received her first loan from WSDS of INR 5,000 and started selling meat at the local market. 

Early morning she would travel to Sekmai, which is about 15 kms, boarding the local bus, and purchase meat from the butchers. On return, she would smoke part of the meat over a fire and sell it in the local market. Dry meat (smoked meat) is a popular delicacy in the locality. 

Selling meat, she says, is very profitable and she wishes to carry on her business but in larger quantity. She now asks for another loan of INR 10,000 to increase her sales. With the profit she plans to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase meat from the butcher to smoke and resell.

loans.name: Anisa Indah Group

texts.en:
Sukati lives in the East of Jakarta. She is a tailor and she started her business in 1997. The location of her business in her home so she doesn't worry about the rent of her business. Her husband works in a garment factory but his salary is not enough to fulfill their needs. 

In addition, Sukati loves everything about fashion, so she uses her job as her hobby and her business. Her challenge in this business is that she needs to focus and cannot postpone delivering if she has already promised to finish the tailoring work.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons and weft for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna has applied for her fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business.  She plans to purchase beauty soaps, hair and beauty oil, nail polish, shampoos and hair creams. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to purchase a piece of land to construct rental houses.  She hopes to live in her own permanent residential house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps, hair and beauty oil, nail polish, shampoos and hair creams.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food making ingredients and furniture for resturant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old, married and blessed with four children, aged 22, 17, 18, and 13 years respectively, that she supports. She has been buying and selling cereals (grains and beans) for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to get additional stock of grains. The anticipated profits will pay school fees. Her future plan is to get business prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry maize and beans for sale at high profits.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a young, single man living in Kosovo with his entire family in one of the minority communities. For more than five years he has worked as an auto mechanic. Since he is very professional and a hard worker, Ivan has gained and retained many customers. Year after year his business continues to grow. 

Ivan serves all different people from the various communities of Kosovo. He is asking for a loan to purchase necessary tools for car repairs, such as an auto mechanic lift. This loan will help him to generate more income. Ivan hopes to save money for his future. His goal is to get married and have his own family. 

Ivan appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools for car repairs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina vive en  la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla  la agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, algodón, pallares, entre otros. Marcelina ha pasado por muchos momentos difíciles, sobre todo cuando debido a circunstancias de la vida quedo viuda y tuvo que luchar muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su hija, la cual ahora es mayor de edad y quien le ha dado una nieta maravillosa a la cual quiere muchísimo y a quien consiente mucho. Marcelina es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo tiene un espíritu alegre y luchador. Día a día Marcelina trabaja en una empresa de su ciudad en el área de lavandería, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, en casa también Marcelina ofrece sus servicios de lavandería a sus vecinos ya que es muy conocida y con ello tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bine en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Marcelina esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora y planchas nuevas para poder brindar su servicio de lavandería a otras empresas, con lo cual ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:”  Tener una cadena de lavanderías y apoyar a su hija y a su nieta”.
texts.en:
Marcelina lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for its very warm and welcoming atmosphere and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of prickly pear, cotton, butter beans, and other crops. Marcelina has been through many difficult times, especially when life circumstances left her a widow and she had to struggle very hard to provide for her daughter. Her daughter is now an adult and has given her a wonderful granddaughter whom Marcelina loves very much and spoils rotten. 

Marcelina is a very hardworking woman and, above all, a cheerful and determined spirit. Day after day, she works in the laundry department of a business in her city. She works about eight hours a day, and she also offers an in-home laundry service to her neighbors. She is very well-known and this service provides extra income for her household expenses. She believes that her business is going well because she is very responsible and especially because she has a strong desire to get ahead. 

Marcelina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a new washing machine and new irons so that she can offer her laundry service to other businesses. By doing that, she will be able to improve her income and continue struggling every day to be able to realize her greatest dream: to have a chain of laundromats and support her daughter and her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and irons.

loans.name: Pradeep

texts.en:
Pradeep is engaged in the activity of decorating and making tent houses for events like marriages and for other Hindu rituals. He has tents, a few musical instruments and speakers with him, which he installs wherever the events are performed. He has five years of experience in this activity.

Pradeep lives with his parents, elder brother and his younger sister. He is a 29-year-old differently-able person living in a small village in Odisha, India.

Pradeep has requested a loan of 40,000 Indian rupees to purchase new upgraded musical instruments, chairs and tables, and decorative items for his business. His dream is to see his sister get married into a good family and to save some money for his future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a new upgraded music system, chairs and tables, and decorative items for his event managing service.

loans.name: Elayna Arley

texts.es:
Elayna es una joven de 20 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros.
