Elayna es madre de un pequeño de 1 añito de edad, al que quiere muchísimo y por el cual trabaja muy duro y sobre todo le brinda mucho amor y cariño porque es lo más importante que tiene en la vida. Día a día Elayna traba muy duro como obrera en un fundo de su distrito, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Elayna agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena, entre otros, ya que podrá realizar el arreglo de paredes de su vivienda y poder tarrajearlas, de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda y la calidad de vida de su hijo, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Poder darle una buena educación a su hijo, una buena calidad de vida y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Elayna, 20, is a young woman living in Santiago District in Ica, Peru.  Santiago district is noted for agriculture especially cotton, grapes and asparagus growing among others.  Elayna is the mother of a little one-year-old boy who she loves very much and for whom she works very hard above all giving him all the love and affection because he’s the most important thing in her life.  Day to day, Elayna works hard as a day laborer in a large agricultural estate in her district; she works about 9 hours daily and believes she does well in her work because she’s very responsible and above all because she very much wants to get ahead.

Elayna is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy supplies like cement and sand, among others to repair the walls in her house and be able to plaster them.  In this way, she will be able to improve her house and her son’s quality of life and continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to be able to provide her son with a good education, a good quality of life and to study a university career.

loans.use: to plaster a room.

loans.name: Narendra

texts.en:
Narendra runs a vegetable cum grocery shop in a small village, Balipatna, of Odisha, India. He sells potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and other green vegetables,  and grocery items like rice, wheat, lentils, spices, edible oil, etc. He has 5 years of experience in this activity and earns 2,500 INR per month from his business.

Narendra is a 30-year-old 'differently able' person, living with his parents and his elder brother. He has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR for making a showcase in his shop so that he can properly display the stock in his shop and for purchasing more stock of the grocery items that he sells.

He wants to support his father and brother financially and save some money for a secure future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing  rice, wheat, lentils, spices, edible oil, etc. and for making a showcase for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Jariatu.  She is married and has three children aged 5, 8, and 10 years. All are school-going children. 

In 1992, Jariatu established her Frozen Fish and Chicken business. She began her business because she was in Primary school when she lost her father and her mother got ill. Her aunt decided to take care of her, but after several months, her mother's sickness became so severe that her aunt thought it wise that she should stay and help her mother since she is the eldest child. Jariatu started petty trading with the money her aunt gave her to support the home and her sick mother.  

She carried huge responsibilities at an early age and doing business has helped her a lot. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 968,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Jariatu requires a loan in order to purchase frozen fish - 10 cartons @ Le 220,000 and chicken - 10 cartons @ Le 80,000. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to build a house, open another outlet, and open a cold-room for wholesale of frozen fish/chicken. Competition is her major problem. She is hardworking and honest. This is her first time in accessing a loan in this credit service, and she is looking forward to paying and accessing subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase frozen fish - 10 cartons @ Le 220,000, and chicken - 10 cartons @ Le 80,000.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 28-year-old unmarried lady. She has been doing a business of decorations with her mother for many years. She offers hand-made decorations to her customers. She is popular in providing beautiful decorations.  

Her family consists of eight members. She wishes to send her siblings to school. Her father’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of the family members alone. 

In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy sheets of silver and gold and also stocks of paints in various colors. 

She expects to get an increase in her net income and desires to spend on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets of silver and gold and stocks of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo, tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanas actualmente. El con el crédito tiene pensado comprar los insumos como abonos, y herbicidas para aplicarle a la siembra de caña y pagar la mano de obra de los trabajadores que le ayudaron con los trabajos del cañal. El quiere asistir su caña de azúcar, pues actualmente se encuentra en un estado regular para la explotación. El tienen pensado mejorar el estado de producción y obtener de esta mas cosecha que el año anterior, generando así más ingresos para su bienestar y el de su familia que es la principal idea de sus trabajos dentro del la siembra caña. El quiere obtener de su cañal los ingresos para ayudar a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar  y hacerle un poco más fácil la economía de su familia, además a su vez ir generando una estabilidad económica para su futuro desde ahora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jairo is 22 years old, is single and lives with his parents and sisters, now. With the loan, he plans to buy supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides for the planting of cane and to pay his workers who helped him with the work in the cane field. He wants to attend his sugar cane, because currently it's in a so-so working state.

He plans to improve the production state and therefore obtain more crops than last year, thus generating more revenue for his welfare and that of his family. That is the main idea of his work in planting cane. From his cane field, he wants to obtain income to help his parents with the responsibilities of the household and to make a little easier the economy of his family. At the same time, from now on, he wants to achieve economic stability for his future.

This is the first loan received from FUDECOSUR. He haven't had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR granted the loan with better facilities and an interest rate much lower.

loans.use: to attend the cane sowing and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Bintu. She is married and has four children, age 16, 13, 10 and 7, all schooling. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling.  

In 2001, Bintu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough funds to support her children's educations and that is her major source of income. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 650,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Bintu requires a loan in order to buy ladies body, wax cotton and dry cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 320,000. 

In the future, Bintu plans to buy more stock for her business to educate her children and to start traveling to Dubai. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abdul. He is married and has two children aged two and five years. He has one additional dependent living with him who provides sales assistance. 

In 2011, Abdul established his telephone credit card business along with selling of mobile phones accessories and American movies on CD plates. He began his business because he wants to take care of his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

Abdul would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. He requires the loan in order to increase his stock level. It will enable him to buy more credit cards in a large quantity. In the future, Abdul plans to open another shop to be managed by his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more credit cards,movies and to open another outlet

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mariatu. She is married, and has one child, age 5. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling.  

In 2005, Mariatu established her pan dish, rubber dish and peak milk business. She began her business because she wants to be self-empowered and that is her major source of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 520,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy pan dish, rubber dish and pad. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Mariatu plans to own a shop, to educate her child and to seek more financial assistance from A.R.D.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Pan dishes, rubber dish and peak milk.

loans.name: Tunda

texts.en:
Tunda is a 35-yr-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of four and thirteen. All of them go to school.

Tunda runs a general store and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,500 SDG to purchase fish, onions, and many other goods to sell. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Tunda would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Tunda says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store including fish and onions

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 56 años, es madre de 5 hijos en las edades de 20 a 35 años. Ella en condición de viuda, ha logrado generar ingresos para sostener su hogar mediante su negocio, en el que comercializa mercancía variada a través de guías especializadas o catálogos; negocio que inició hace 20 años con la ayuda de una amiga, quien la impulsó entregándole mercancía,  para que las vendiera y ganara dinero, Poco apoco fue construyendo su propio capital y viajó a la ciudad de Medellín, lugar donde producen uno de los mejores artículos de cuero y confecciones en el país y donde compró justamente esta mercancía con las que abrió su mercado y hasta la presente ha logrado posición en en un segmento de clientes a quienes les gusta las carteras, bosos, calzado y articulos elaborados en cuero de primera clase. Con su negocio genera ingresos y ha logrado educar a sus hijos. Su meta es continuar ampliandolo, hasta que todos sus hijos tengan su propia casa, pues es uno de los sueños que la impulsan. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara ropa interior y exterior, calzado, productos de belleza y de aseo personal, para venderlo entre su clientela, pues son estos artículos que mas rotan entre su clientela y muchos de ellos han sido encargados en su preventa. Atendiendo que el segundo semestre del año, en una de las épocas de mayor movimiento comercial,  va a aprovechar esta coyuntura, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Miriam, 56, is the mother of five children aged between 20 and 35.  She’s a widow and has succeeded in generating income to support her home by means of her business.  She sells varied merchandise via specialized catalogues, a business she started 20 years ago with help from a girlfriend who started her off by giving her merchandise to sell and earn money.  She gradually amassed capital of her own and traveled to the city of Medellín where some of the country’s best leather items and clothing are manufactured.  She purchased there precisely the merchandise she used to start her business and to date has secured a market share with customers who like the wallets, purses, footwear and other articles made from first-class leather.

She generates income with her business and has been able to educate her children.  Her goal is to continue expanding it until all her children have their own houses because that’s one of the dreams that impels her.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy underwear and outerwear, footwear, beauty and personal hygiene products to sell among her clientele because these are the items that rotate best among her customers and many of them have already placed preorders.   Because the second semester of the year is a season of increased sales, she’s going to take advantage of this juncture to make her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes, underwear, footwear, beauty products and personal use items.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es: Pedro tiene 28 años de edad estado civil soltero. El nos cuenta que tan solo comenzó  armando por partes 2 computadoras y después armadas las vendio y vio que le resulto bueno .El seguía comprando piezas de una computadora las armaba y las vende .Pues ese ahora es su negocio de ventas de computadoras. Su sueño es abrir locales en Quevedo y venderlas a otras ciudades. Con el préstamo comprara los discos duros, monitores, teclados, etc
texts.en:
Pedro, 28, is single and says he began by just putting together two computers, which he later sold for a good profit.  He continued buying computer parts to build computers to sell, so now that is the business he is in.  He dream is to open shops in Quevedo and sell his products in other cities.

He will use the loan to buy hard drives, monitors, keyboards, etc.

loans.use: To buy hard drives, monitors, keyboards, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 32-year-old farmer in Litein County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children who are all in school. She has been in farming for eight years and produces tea and milk, which she sells to the local market in the area.

She is requesting a loan of 65000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for expanding her dairy unit. This will help in her milk production, which will increase her income and better her standard of living. She will be able to pay her children's school fees more easily. 

She believes she will increase the number of her dairy cows in three years. Diseases are her major challenge in farming.

Caroline thanks Juhudi Kilimo for lending her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials for expanding her dairy unit.

loans.name: Lodu

texts.en: Lodu is a 30-yr-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of them go to school. Lodu runs a general store and has been in business for six years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,500 SDG to purchase sugar, soap, onion, and many other items. Lodu has no other source of income. In 5 years Lodu would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Lodu says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, sugar, onion, etc.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo de 28 años vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde tiene un cafe internet y ofrece el servicio de comunicaciones  a celulares, juegos por internet y transcripciones. Su negocio lo inició una vez terminó sus  estudios técnicos, pues no encontró oportunidades de emplearse en empresas y con el apoyo de su novia inició vendiendo minutos, haciendo transcripciones y alquilando juegos virtuales. Rodrigo atiende su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Él ha aplicado a un previo crédito con la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo y hoy esta solicitando un credikiva, con el cual comprara un computador y los últimos juegos , para que en las siguientes vacaciones educativas, niños y jóvenes disfruten de momentos lúdicos y sanos en su negocio y continúen siendo sus mejores clientes, mientras él cumple su sueño de prosperidad y empleabilidad..
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 28, lives in the municipality of Malambo where he has an Internet café; he also provides mobile phone services, games via Internet and transcriptions.  He started his business once he completed his technical studies and was unable to secure employment in any firm.  With help from his girlfriend he started selling airtime, doing transcriptions and renting virtual games.

Rodrigo works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night.  He applied for a previous Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan and is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy a computer and the latest games so that during the next school vacation period children and youngsters will enjoy healthy leisure time in his business and continue being his best customers while he reaches his dream of employability and prosperity.

loans.use: to buy a computer and the latest games.

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Groupe 3

texts.fr: APEC AL OUMA GROUPE 3 est un  groupe mixte  de 9 personnes   qui habitent  le meme village dans une des localités sénégalaises et adhèrent aussi dans la meme association (APEC AL OUMA). ILS exercent des activités séparées et diversifiées de commerce. ILS n’ont  jamais contracté de crédit au sein de l’institution de L'UIMCEC  ou ils sont membres. Ils sont représentées par madame Sokhna (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo).  Elle s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de légumes, de produits locaux (arachide). Son activité lui génère des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Elle commence chaque jour ses activités  a 8 heures du matin pour rentrer chez elle a 16 heures  dans l’après midi. Elle sollicite un crédit destiné a augmenter son fond de roulement afin de se procurer des poissons fumés  a revendre. Son objectif est de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise et e de développer davantage son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The "Apec Al Ouma Groupe 3" is a mixed group consisting of nine people who live in the same town in an area of Senegal and also belong to the same association (Apec Al Ouma). They run separate and diverse businesses. They have not taken out any previous loans from UIMCEC, where they are members. They are represented by Ms. Sokhna (whose hand is raised in the photo). She has been active in the commercial sector for more than 30 years and sells vegetables and local products (peanuts). Her business provides her with an income that allows her to take care of her family's daily expenses. She begins her work every day at 8 in the morning and returns home at 4 in the afternoon. She is seeking a loan destined to increase her working capital in order to procure smoked fish for resale. Her goal is to diversify the products she sells and to further develop her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras se formó con la unión de 16 señoras, vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas ellas decidieron darse la oportunidad y trabajar juntas para poder salir adelante por medio del esfuerzo de todas ellas.
La Sra. Ana es la presidenta y miembro del grupo, ella vende prendas de todas clases, como ser camisa, pantalones, short, remeras y demás tipos de prendas. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace pedidos, y que gracias a esto se está haciendo muy conocido y así tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita este préstamo para surtirse con más tipos de prendas, ya que se acerca el verano y quiere poder surtirse con ese tipo de prendas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank was formed by 16 women, neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They decided to take advantage of the opportunity of working together to be able to get ahead through the efforts of all of them.

Ana's the president and a member of the group.  She sells all types of clothing, including shirts, pants, shorts, t-shirts, and other garments.  She says she has very good customers who always order from her.  Thanks to this she's becoming very well known, so she has the income to be able to help her family.

She's requesting this loan to stock up on more types of clothing because summer's coming and she wants to be able to have summer clothes.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She is very talented and excels in making envelopes. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them at the local market. Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet the family expenditures alone so her income helps in providing for the household activities. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Naseem is requesting a loan of 15, 000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. She intends to use the profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of paper to increase her sales.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Kapan town with his wife and 7-year-old daughter. Armen works at the local Water Resources Management Agency. In addition, he runs a farm where he raises cows.

In order to increase income from cattle breeding, Armen plans to purchase more cattle. He has applied for this loan to buy 3 heifers and grass to feed the cattle. Armen expects to receive more milk and earn additional income from sales.

loans.use: to pay for heifers and grass to feed the cattle

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha, age 23, is a single lady who lives in a rental house in the coastal region of Kenya. She works very hard in order to give support to her parents. 

Biasha sells new and used clothing in a small store. Biasha is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can have the necessary capital to invest. She will buy more formal, casual and informal clothing for different people. Her main priorities are to increase her sales and improve her earnings so that she can have a peaceful and happy life.

loans.use: to buy more formal, casual and informal clothing for different people

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La Sra. Elida tiene 44 años, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú,  es viuda desde hace 3 años, el matrimonio tiene 4 hijos quienes siempre están con ella y la ayudan.
La señora Elida se dedica a la confección desde hace 1 año, sus hijos le compraron tres maquinas industriales que utiliza para confeccionar ropas en general, también recibe ayuda de sus hijos que trabajan para llevar adelante los gastos familiares y estudio de su hijo y su nieto.
Solicita este préstamos para la  compra de telas, cierre, hilos   para confeccionar artículos varios y poder comercializar en la esta temporada de primavera y verano que llega.
texts.en: Elida, 44, is from the city of Caaguazú.  She’s been a widow for three years.  She has four children who are always with her and who help her.  Elida has been working as a dressmaker for a year.  Her children bought her three industrial sewing machines that she uses to make clothes in general.  She also gets help from her children who work in order to cover family expenses and schooling costs for her son and grandson.  She’s requesting this loan to buy fabric, zippers and thread to make various items to sell this spring and in the approaching summer.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ronald Percy

texts.es:
Percy es u  joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, algodón, esparrago, entre otros. Percy es un joven muy trabajador, y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica, gracias a ello tiene su pequeño negocio de soldadura,  pero también le gusta mucho la agricultura y por ello tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado maíz, él trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que le va bien porque le gusta mucho lo que hace y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Percy esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina de soldar de mayor tamaño, lo que le permitirá poder realizar mejor su trabajo de soldadura y le permitirá tener mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hace realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Percy is a 25-year-old young man. He lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm and welcoming atmosphere and especially its agriculture, including the cultivation of grapes, cotton, asparagus, and other crops.

Percy is a very hardworking young man, and above all, he has a strong desire to get ahead. With great effort, he managed to earn a technical degree in mechanics. Thanks to that education, he has a small welding business, but he also really likes agriculture; he has a small parcel on which he has planted corn. He works about nine hours a day and he feels that it is going well because he really likes what he does and above all, because of his desire to succeed.

Percy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy a bigger welding machine. This will allow him to be able to do his welding work better and to have a better income so that he can continue struggling toward making his greatest dream a reality: to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase welding equipment.

loans.name: Erineriko

texts.en:
Erineriko is a thirty-two-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for seven years. Like most teachers, he is challenged by low salary pay, a high pupil-to-teacher ratio and a poor working environment.

In order to supplement his salary, he bought land and now practices agriculture. He is determined to change his future and that of his family through education. Erineriko is requesting money to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha tiene 46 años,casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia vende la chicha en su casa desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender chicha.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz para preparar chicha.

La socia esta contenta con el credito anterior y se compromete a cumplr con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Martha, 46, is married and has two children. She works selling chicha, a beverage made from corn.  She sells chicha at home from 8am until 6pm.  She’s been in business ten years and does very well.  Her dream is to be able to have a locale to sell the chicha in.  She requests the loan to buy corn to make chicha.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy corn to make chicha.

loans.name: Ercida

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 67,275 pesos Ercida ha podido comprar tela, zippers, hilo, adornos y otros materiales para su taller de confección de colchas, cortinas y tapicería ligera. 
A Ercida toda su vida le ha gustado mucho la decoración de interiores, siempre sus amigas le buscaban para que le asesorara sobre qué colores usar o cual era el mejor material para unas cortinas. Su esposo, al ver su talento le sugirió que hiciera un curso de confección de artículos de decoración. Tiene ya 11 años que abrió su taller, y con el tiempo ha desarrollado una cartera fija de clientes que siempre requieren sus servicios, además de los que les llegan referidos por alguien satisfecho con el trabajo y servicio que ella les ha dado.

Ercida es casada, su esposo trabaja en una oficina de abogados. Juntos tienen cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad, el mayor tiene 25 y la menor 19. Los tres mayores trabajan y la menor está terminando la secuendaria.

Gracias a su taller, Ercida puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y juntos pudieron apoyar a sus hijos para que terminaran la secundaria. El deseo de Ercida es que se mantengan llegando clientes para terminar de construír su casa y tener un lugar más cómodo donde vivir
texts.en:
With a 67, 275 Peso loan, Ercida has been able to buy fabric, zippers, thread, decorations and other supplies for her workshop where she makes bedspreads, curtains and does light upholstery.  Ercida has enjoyed interior decoration her entire life and her girlfriends would always seek her out for advice on what colors to use or what material to get for their curtains.  Noting her talent, her husband suggested she take a course in decorations making.  It’s now been 11 years since she opened her workshop and in time she’s acquired a regular clientele who always require her services in addition to those who come referred by someone who is satisfied with the work and service she’s given them.  

Ercida is married and her husband works in a law office.  They have four adult children, the oldest is 25 and the youngest is 19. The three oldest work and the youngest is finishing secondary school.  Thanks to her workshop, Ercida is able to help her husband with household expenses and together they were able to support their children so that they could complete secondary school.  Ercida’s wish is that customers will continue coming so that she can finish building her house and have a more comfortable place to live in.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is a 30-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has three children ages 2, 7 and 10. Elida is engaged in selling home cooked food like snacks in her community. She sells rice cakes, camote cue (deep fried sweet potato in caramelized sugar) and banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar).

She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, cooking oil and brown sugar. The loan will help a lot so she can improve her business and produce more for a better profit. Her income will keep her children in school. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, cooking oil and brown sugar

loans.name: Leydi Yosselyn Reyna

texts.es:
Leydi es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, entre otros. Leydi es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por ello se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo, ella labora en una empresa como vendedora, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y por las noches estudia la carrera de administración, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios y apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.

Leydi esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar su ciclo de estudios con lo cual podrá seguir estudiando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Leydi is a 19-year-old young woman. She lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having a very warm and welcoming atmosphere. Ica is also known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton and grapes, among other crops.

Leydi is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead, so she puts a great deal of effort into her work. She works about eight hours a day as a saleswoman in a business. At night, she goes to college to earn a degree in administration. With her hard-earned money, she is able to pay for her education costs and help her parents with household expenses.

Leydi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to pay for her next semester of college. She will be able to continue studying and struggling to make her greatest dream a reality: to finish her degree and make her parents proud.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester of college.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce is a fifty-year-old widow with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her hardships are customers not paying on time and high taxes. Her personal goal is educating her children, and her business goals are expanding her business into new markets and moving the business to a more permanent location.

Peluce is requesting the loan facility to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia tiene 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 1 hijo. La señora se dedica en la venta de artículos de primera necesidad como frazadas, cubiertos, etc. hace 7 años.
La Sra. Virginia tiene la aspiración de ir creciendo día a día en su negocio con la ayuda de su pareja ya que es el sustento de la familia y gracias a eso les puede brindar una vida digna a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos, como ser frazadas, cubiertos y otros materiales ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 40 years old and has a companion and 1 son. She has been selling articles of primary necessity, including blankets, covers, etc., for 7 years now.

She aspires to continue growing her business day to day, with the help of her life partner, since her sales provide sustenance for her family. Thanks to that, they are able to offer a dignified life for the family.

Virginia is requesting a loan to purchase products, such as blankets, covers, and other materiales, because she can count on a very good demand for sales of these products.

loans.use: to buy blankets, covers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 22-year-old Lebanese man.  He is single, and lives with his family, which is composed of his parents and one sibling.  His father works to satisfy the family's needs and respond to their demands.  Ammar also works, hoping to take some responsibilities off of his father.  

Ammar started his business in 2009.  He owns a tile and ceramic shop, and has a fair number of clients asking for his services.  Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to repair his shop’s ceiling and purchase additional tile and ceramic, especially the new collection. 

Ammar is pretty sure that in a short period of time he will be able to enlarge his shop and deliver his products outside the country to gain higher earnings.

loans.use: repair his shop’s ceiling and purchase more tile and ceramic to sell.

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, se encuentra realizando más cultivo de maíz y de frijol, por ello está nuevamente solicitándo un préstamo que le ayudara para la compra de abono y herbicidas para su cultivo, así brindarle lo necesario para fortalecimiento y mejorar la produccion, de esta manera podra distribuir a sus clientes un mejor grano.

El gracias al préstamo anterior pudo comprar diferentes insumos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz y del frijol, el sigue con su cultivo y mejorando en las ganancias para ir sustentando la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Florentin continues to cultivate corn and beans, and for this purpose he is once again requesting a loan to help purchase manure and herbicides for his crops. This will provide what he needs to improve and fortify production. And in this way, he will be able to offer his customers a better grain.

Thanks to his previous loan, Florentin was able to buy different agricultural inputs for sowing corn and beans. He continues to cultivate his crops and improve his earnings so that he can sustain and feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and herbicides for his corn and bean crops.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde abunda la leche y cuajada que producen sus habitantes.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras como es el caso de Zoila Esperanza, una señora de 42 años, casada, madre de 2 hijos; todos estudiando, se dedica a laborar como Inspectora de enfermedades tiene 23 años de desempeñar este oficio, el que le ha permitido mejorar su casita poco a poco.

Gracias a su profesión hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de créditos y la que quiere ir ampliando para brindarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para la compra de hierro, cemento, ladrillos, zinc y perlines aprovechando la ventaja que su esposo es albañil para la construcción de un cuarto.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y espera que en futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town in the west surrounded by flower-covered mountains in winter.  Milk and milk curd produced by its residents is abundant.  Many people there are noted for being very hardworking.  Such is the case of Zoila Esperanza, a 42-year-old, married, mother of two children who are all attending school.  She works as a health inspector and has been in this occupation for 23 years; it has allowed her to gradually improve her house.

Thanks to her profession, she owns her house and she’s been improving it thanks to help from loans.  She wants to continue enlarging it to provide a good asset for her children and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy rebar, cement, bricks, metal sheeting and purlines taking advantage of the fact that her husband works in construction to build a room.  

She thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support provided by means of these loans that have helped her improve her family’s living conditions; she hopes they will continue to help her in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarion de 44 años de edad casado hace 7 años con la señora Adriana ambos con una instrucciones de nivel primario, tienen 3 hijos dependientes que estudian, la familia vive en una comunidad rural 2do Aguirre hacia el sud de Colomi. Don Hilarión y su esposa son personas muy trabajadores de carácter humilde, tienen ingresos económicos dentro del año de la venta de papa y haba siembran una parte en terreno propio lo demás en terreno de herencia de sus padres, ellos necesitan un credito porque les falto dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) más productos agroquímicos, porque este último tuvieron escases de recursos en mantener a su hijos en el colegio, además nos dicen también que en otras entidades financieras se les hizo muy difícil les pidieron muchos requisitos para sacar un crédito.Por último el señor Hilarión y la esposa se sintieron muy felices al haber conseguido lo que más estaban necesitando ahora sembraran en más superficies así para tener mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
Hilarión, 44, has been married to Adriana for 7 years.  Both attended elementary school.  They have three dependent children who attend school.  The family lives in the rural, 2ndo Aguirre, community in south Colomi.  Hilarión and his wife are very hardworking, humble people.  

They earn income by means of potatoes and lima bean sales.  They grow part of them on their own land and part on land inherited from their parents.  They requested a loan because they were short on money to buy farm supplies like fowl, guano and other agrochemical supplies because they had reduced resources to keep their children in school and they also state that other financial institutions made it very difficult for them to get a loan because they had many requirements.  

Hilarión and his wife felt very happy for having gotten what they most needed and now will be able to plant on larger acreage to earn better future income.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
FRANCISCO JOSE tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

FRANCISCO JOSE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar.

Las compras lo hara en ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son son las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es poder comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y jugar el boly.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose is 25 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the "Los Últimos Seran Los Primeros" [The Last Will Be First] communal bank, which is located in the San Gabriel precinct, in Ventanas Canton. The members work in farming and livestock. 

Francisco Jose works in farming, growing corn. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, urea, and herbicide. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to be able to plant. He will make his purchases in Ventanas. 

The challenges that Francisco Jose faces are crop infestations. His dream is to be able to buy land. In his free time, he likes to do sports and play volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and urea

loans.name: Nolberto Domitilo

texts.es:
El señor Nolberto Domitilo tiene 39 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar en el oeste de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera;Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
Desde hace dos años le fue diagnosticado con una enfermedad; él trabajó desde  su niñez en corte de caña de azúcar; tiene 2 hijos que aun estudian la primaria y su esposa quien la apoya en su pequeño negocio de subsistencia.
El se levanta a las 3 de la mañana todos los días a realizar sus labores de campo que realiza en la finca familiar donde cultivan para cubrir su alimentación, además el mata cerdos una vez por semana para obtener ingresos en la comercialización de la carne, piel y los derivados del cerdo.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de cerditos para engorde.
El señor Nolberto Domitilo agradece a CEPRODEL y Kiva, por que de esta forma mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia, con oportunidad de optar a otros ingresos que no afecte su salud.
texts.en:
Nolberto Domitilo, 39, lives in the town of Chichigalpa, a place in west Nicaragua, known for sugarcane production and a distillery.  It’s one of Nicaragua’s hottest places.  

He was diagnosed with renal insufficiency two years ago. He worked since childhood cutting sugarcane.  He has two children still in elementary school and his wife helps him with his small subsistence business.

He rises daily at 3 in the morning to do his work in the fields; they have a family farm where he grows for their own subsistence.  He also butchers pigs once a week to earn extra income selling the pork, skin and other derivatives from the pigs.  

The loan will be used to buy piglets to fatten up.  Nolberto Domitilo thanks Ceprodel and Kiva because his and his family’s quality of life will improve this way because he’ll have the option of earning income without affecting his health.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Senaida

texts.es:
Latacunga es la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador. En los últimos años Latacunga se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. En esta ciudad muchas de las fiestas conservan un profundo arraigo y pureza muy cercanos a los orígenes históricos o de la tradición ancestral. En esta interesante ciudad reside María una mujer de 23 años que es soltera y tiene un hijo Edison que tiene 1 año de edad, vive con sus padres y ha terminado la escuela primaria, pero espera algún día continuar sus estudios. 
María se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización desde hace 3 años, actividad que aprendió de su madre y en la cual invierte 8 horas al día. María necesita incrementar sus ingresos por lo que solicitó un crédito con el cual pueda comprar más cerdos y además insumos para agrandar los criaderos y que los cerdos tengan mayor espacio. Fundación Alternativa otorgó este crédito ya que su visión es acabar con las pobrezas del Ecuador, por lo que su apoyo al sector rural es primordial y además del dinero le ofrecen asesoría para que saque adelante su negocio. El sueño de María es retomar sus estudios y un día poder aplicar sus conocimientos en el negocio que ha llevado a cabo por este tiempo.
texts.en:
Latacunga is the capital of the province of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces in the highland region of Ecuador.  Recently Latacunga has developed notably in such a way that it's considered one of the most important cities in the region, thanks to the flower, mining, metallurgy, agribusiness, agriculture, and livestock industries.  In addition, there are businesses that generate additional income, which turns it into a commercial city with a variety of opportunities to get ahead.  In this city there are many celebrations that conserve a deep rooting in and purity of historical origins or ancestral tradition.

María, 23, lives in this interesting city.  She's single and has a son, Edison, 1.  She lives with her parents and finished elementary school, but she hopes to continue her studies one day.  María has made a living for three years raising pigs for sale, a job she learned from her mother and on which she spends eight hours a day.

María needs to increase her income so she requested a loan to buy more pigs and supplies to expand the pens so the pigs have more space.

Fundación Alternativa granted this loan because its goal is to end poverty in Ecuador, so its help in the rural sector is fundamental.  They also offer consulting so the business can get ahead.

María's dream is to return to her studies and one day be able to apply her knowledge in the business she has carried out during this time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and equipment for the pens

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos varones que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de su hermana donde cuenta con un ambiente donde se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta- calamarca, donde se encuentran las fabricas de ladrillos en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja elaborando ladrillos en una fabrica que le pertenece a su padre; esta fabrica se encuentra mas adentro de Llojeta siendo el lugar lleno de tierra y polvo, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana. El esposo es maestro contratista de albañilería trabajando actualmente en el sector sur de la ciudad de La Paz y ambos colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de madera y el pago del gas que utiliza para el horno donde queman los ladrillos, ya que desea elaborar más cantidad de ladrillos y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Juana es poder comprar su propia fabrica de ladrillos y así tener mejor ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana is married and has two sons who are of school age. She live in a house with her sister where they have a household made up of a bedroom and a kitchen. The house is made of adobe and it has a dirt floor. The house is located in the Llojeta-Calamarca area where the brick-making factories of La Paz are located. 

She currently works making bricks in a factory that belongs to her father. The factors is located deeper in Llojeta since it is a place that is full of dirt and dust. She works every day of the week. Her husband is a master building contractor and currently works in the southern region of the city of La Paz. They work together to pay for utilities, food, and clothing. 

She needs this loan to purchase wood and pay for the gas she uses for the kiln where they fire the bricks as she wants to make a larger amount of bricks and increase her income. 

Juana's dream is to be able to buy her own brick factory and that way have a better income and a better quality of life. This is the first time she has requested a loan from both IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood and gas for the kiln where she makes bricks.

loans.name: Cenit

texts.es:
Cenit, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus 02 hijos mayores, asimismo ayuda en la crianza de un nieto. Su casa es propia, la cual logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Cenit es una bodega, que está implementada en un espacio muy bien acondicionado en su propia casa, y tiene más de 03 años de funcionamiento. En dicho negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su hija Betsy, quien ofrece la mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Considera rentable a su negocio por la constante demanda que tiene y eso le da basntante ventaja para costear los gastos de su casa, así como también tiene tiempo para apoyar a sus hijos. Comenta además que tiene muchas ganas de ampliar su negocio y variar mas los productos que para así poder tener más ingresos. Este es  el préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, y espera poder comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos, entre otros para abastecer su negocio, pues considera que a mayor variedad de productos tendrá mas ventas.
texts.en:
Cenit, 51, is a cheerful, dynamic, enterprising woman.  She lives with her spouse and two adult children; she also helps to care for a grandson.  She lives in her own house that she and her spouse built.  Cenit’s work is a grocery store that’s set up in a very well-setup space at home; it’s been in operation more than three years.  Her daughter, Betsy, helps her in the store providing the very best customer service.

She considers her business to be profitable because it’s in constant demand and this is a great advantage for her to cover household expenses as well as to have time to support her children.  She comments that in addition she very much wants to enlarge the business and vary the products to earn more income.  

This is her 8th MFP loan and she hopes to be able to buy rice, sugar, oil and noodles, among others to stock the store because she believes that the more products she has the more sales she’ll make.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con su pareja y vive con sus 04 hijos, su pareja vive en el terreno de su propiedad que tienen en un caserío a la rivera del río, del cual regresa cada 15 días. La actividad que realiza Flor es la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno para lo cual tiene  un terreno extenso en un caserío a la rivera del río. En éste terreno se queda su conviviente por espacios de 15 días cuidando al ganado, ella en la ciudad  se encarga de la venta del ganado y envío de alimentos hacia el caserío, lleva en ésta actividad alrededor de 10 años. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico para  solventar los gastos de la casa y  brindar una educación adecuada a sus hijos.  
Se siente realizada teniendo un negocio del cual está orgullosa, comenta asimismo que las ganancias de esta actividad son buenas por que compra el animal en edad menor y luego los engorda y así poder venderlo luego a un mayor precio cuando están mas grandes. Este es el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un préstamo que podrá invertir en su negocio, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y así poder seguir teniendo mas prestamos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará alambres para el cerco de su terreno, pues su cerco se encuentra en mal estado pudiendo provocar la perdida de alguna vaca.
texts.en:
Flor, 43, is a cheerful woman who very much wants to make progress.  She lives with her spouse and four children.  Her spouse lives on a piece of land he owns where there is a settlement on the riverbank and he returns from there every two weeks.  

Flor’s activity is raising and selling cattle.  To do so, she has a large piece of land on a settlement on the river bank.  Her spouse stays there for two-week spans caring for the cattle and she sells the cattle in the city and sends food to the settlement.  She’s been in this activity for about 10 years.  She considers it profitable because of the good profits it yields.  She likes her activity because it produces income to cover household expenses and provide a good education for her children.

She feels fulfilled having a business she’s proud of.  She also comments that profits from this activity are good because she buys young animals to fatten up and then sell at a higher price when they are bigger.  

This is her third MFP loan and she feels very grateful for the opportunity to be able to count on a loan to invest in her business.  She commits to being punctual with her payments so that she can continue being able to have more loans.

She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy wire mesh to fence her property because she comments that the current fence is in poor condition and this could lead to the loss of cattle.

loans.use: to buy metal mesh to enclose her stables.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 42,000 pesos, Alejandra ha podido comprar ropa, zapatos y accesorios para aumentar el inventario de su tienda y además cumplir con el pedido de mercancía que le hicieron algunos clientes. 
Alejandra es madre soltera, aun vive con sus padres. Usa los ingresos de su tienda para apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y enviar a su hijo a la escuela.
Ella desea que las ventas del negocio aumenten pues quiere buscar una casa donde vivir sola con su hijo y en lo posible seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en: With a 42,000 Peso loan, Alejandra was able to buy clothes, shoes and accessories to increase her store’s stock inventory and fill pending customer orders.  Alejandra’s a single mother still living with her parents.  She uses income from her store to help her parents with household expenses and to send her son to school.  She hopes her sales will increase because she wants to look for a house she and her son can live in by themselves and to continue helping her parents economically as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is from Kapan, in the Syunik region of Armenia. He lives with his wife and son. Armen is the only breadwinner in the family. He trades with fruits and vegetables at 3 booths in different parts of town. Armen needs some investment to increase the variety of fruits and vegetables in his booths. He hopes to increase sales and earn more income, which will help him to expand his business further and open more booths in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Carolina Margoth

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven de 19 años, hace poco terminó la secundaria y es soltera, vive con su padre Carlos en el pueblo de Pedro Vicente Maldonado de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Ecuador. En este cantón se puede encontrar varios lugares para visitar como ríos y bosques que son visitados por varios turistas, quienes al coincidir en las fiestas del cantón pueden experimentar las exposiciones de artesanías y las ferias donde se exponen productos agrícolas y también ganado que son animales que conforman la riqueza de muchos habitantes. Estas actividades combinadas con el comercio han dado la oportunidad a la empresa privada para construir hoteles, hosterías y varias ofertas de servicios para turistas. Sin embargo la principal actividad de este pueblo es la agricultura y ganadería que cada año permiten que el índice de rendimiento económico suba cada año a pesar de la poca transferencia de tecnología al lugar. 
Carolina terminó y sus estudios secundarios y por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo continuar con los universitarios por lo que hace un año, apenas saliendo del colegio, decidió autogestionarse sus recursos con la crianza de cerdos para su posterior venta. Invierte 9 horas cada día a esta actividad ha aprendido empíricamente y le ha ido bastante bien. Ahora Carolina quiere comprar más cerdos y así poder extender su negocio hacia otros lugares aledaños para obtener mayores ingresos. Es por esto que acudió a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar un crédito que le ayude a realizar esta gestión de compra y fue motivada por el asesor de crédito ya que le ayudó en muchos temas que aplicará en su negocio. Esta joven espera un día llegar a tener su casa propia para vivir con su padre y talvez su futura familia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a young woman of 19. She finished high school a short time ago, and is single. She lives with her father Carlos in the village of Pedro Vicente Maldonado, in Pichincha province in Ecuador. 

Several places can be found to visit in this canton, such as rivers and forests. These are visited by numerous tourists who by attending the canton's fiestas can share in experiencing handicraft exhibits and markets where agricultural products are displayed, as well as livestock; animals which comprise the wealth of many inhabitants. These activities, along with commerce, have provided private enterprise with the opportunity to build hotels, inns, and various tourist services. 

However, the main activity of this village is farming and livestock-raising which each year allows the the economic performance index to rise, despite the lack of technology transfer to the area.  

Carolina finished her high school studies, and because of a lack of financial resources was not able to go on to university. Therefore, a year ago, having scarcely left school, she decided to be self-sustaining through the raising of pigs for subsequent sale. 

She invests spends nine hours each day in this work. She has learned by doing, and it has gone quite well. Now Carolina wants to buy more pigs so that she can expand her business to other neighboring areas, in order to earn greater income. 

This is why she approached Fundación Alternativa to apply for a loan that will help her undertake this purchase. She was encouraged by the credit advisor who helped her in many areas of learning that she will apply in her business. 

This young woman hopes one day to manage to have her own home, so that she can live with her father and perhaps her future family.

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo has been farming rice for 30 years now. He is 51 years old from the community of Trinidad, Bohol.  Ricardo has four children--the eldest is 25 and the youngest is 16. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm so he can be more productive in his harvest when it comes. He aims to increase the profitability of his business so he can afford a healthy diet for his family and send his youngest child to school. Any additional income will be for savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and she works six days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy passion fruit, water melon, green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit, water melon, green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 66-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown children from Catagbacan Norte, Loon ,Bohol. She has been engaged in the  dressmaking business for more than forty years now. She is also in the hog raising business.

Marcelina is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread, needles. She is also planning to buy feed for the pigs that she is raising.

In the future, Marcelina wants to improve her ventures and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as cloth, thread, needles

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para surtir su negocio de ropa para la temporada que se acerca, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de ropa como blusas, shorts, pantalones, vestidos, licras, ropa interior tanto para mujer como para hombre, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y su clientela.
Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior logro cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en su negocio y le ayudo a mejorar su estabilidad económica, María sigue con su venta para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria needs financing to supply her clothing sales business for the upcoming season.  For this reason she is requesting a new loan to be able to buy clothing such as blouses, shorts, pants, dresses, athletic clothes, underwear, for men and women.  This will help her improve her income and her customers.
She comments that with the previous loan she was able to cover her customers' demand which helped to improve her financial stability.  Maria continues with her sales to be able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as blouses, shorts, pants, dresses.

loans.name: Gilma Cristelia

texts.es:
Gilma, necesita más capital, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para media manzana de frijol que tiene sembrada, comprandose abono y herbicidas, ademas comprara dos cerdos para el destazo y la comida para engorde como lo es el concentrado, esto le ayudara a mantenerse estable en sus actividades diarias.
Ella comenta que con el préstamo anterior obtuvo más ganancias y un negocio más rentable para poder salir con los gastos del hogar y su familia ha gozado de mejor alimentacion.
texts.en:
Gilma needs more working capital, and this is why she is applying for a new loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies for the half manzana (about 1.4 acres) of beans that she has planted. She will do this by buying fertilizer and herbicides, and will also buy two pigs for slaughter, as well as the feed concentrate for fattening them. 

This will help her to maintain a stable livelihood. She says that with the previous loan she obtained more earnings, and has a more profitable business so that she can meet her household expenses. In addition, her family has enjoyed a better diet.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides, as well as two pigs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 43-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children, who are 2 and 18.  She has been working hard, together with her husband, as a farmer growing rice for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor. The loan will help a lot in the improvement of her business. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business that will allow her to earn a bigger profit so she can continue in providing her children with education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 33-year-old young man.  He is married and the father of one daughter who is seven years old.

For more than seven years, Elias has had a barber shop, which has been profitable and the only source of income for him.  It is located in a high traffic area and has many loyal customers because of Elias' good reputation.  In spite of this, his shop needs support from time to time to cover costs.

Elias wants to improve the shop's condition by painting, installing new mirrors and chairs and buying some furniture for the reception area.  For this purpose, Elias is requesting a USD loan from Faten to help cover all the costs.

This loan will help renew the appearance of the shop and buy new furniture.  This will attract more customers and increase demand, which will improve Elias' income and enable him to provide better living conditions to his family.

Elias is photographed in his barber shop.

loans.use: To improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo, un bogotano de 25 años,  se gradúo del Politécnico Grancolombiano  en dirección y producción de cine gracias la financiación otorgada por el gobierno debido a su excelencia académica durante el bachillerato, ya que su familia no podía sostener los gastos de su carrera. 

Camilo desea ampliar sus horizontes y conocimientos mediante un master en estudios cinematográficos, para ello requiere el apoyo de KIVA y así cumplir con todos los requisitos necesarios y poder acceder así al crédito beca de la fundación Colfuturo. 

Una vez terminados sus estudios, Camilo pretende volver a su país y empezar la realización de sus propios largometrajes.

Aquí está su historia:

El cine ha sido una de las mayores influencias en el desarrollo de mi vida. Desde pequeño me sentía atraído por las películas de terror que mis padres me prohibían ver y que aun así veía Esa pasión se empezó a convertir en un anhelo de no solo ser un fanático sino también un realizador de este tipo de piezas artísticas. Fue así como decidí convertirme en un realizador audiovisual. A pesar de que mi familia no poseía el apoyo económico necesario para poder lograrlo, me esforcé buscando convocatorias y becas que me ayudaran a lograr mi sueño. 

El siguiente paso fue convertirme en uno de los semilleros de talentos de Colfuturo, quienes en convenio con Proimagenes me han otorgado la oportunidad de acceder a varios beneficios para obtener el crédito beca que necesito para continuar mis estudios. Es en este momento decisivo de mi vida en que el apoyo de la fundación KIVA seria totalmente fundamental para poder lograr mi sueño. 

El desarrollo de la creatividad y la implementación de nuevas herramientas para forjar productos audiovisuales de calidad es algo que va evolucionando cada vez más rápido y una carrera profesional ya no es suficiente para mantenerse a la altura de realizadores audiovisuales de talla mundial. Es por eso que mi mayor deseo en este momento es poder realizar un programa de master en dirección cinematográfica en una de las mejores academias del gremio en el mundo. Esta oportunidad ampliaría mis horizontes como director y me permitirá darle un punto de vista mas amplio a las producciones nacionales y porque no, ayudar en el proceso educativo de la nueva generación de realizadores colombianos.
texts.en:
Camilo, from Bogotá, is 25 years old and graduated from Politécnico Grancolombiano in film direction and production through financing provided by the government because of his academic excellence in high school and because his family couldn't afford the costs of his career. 

Camilo wants to expand his horizons and knowledge through a master's degree in film studies, but he requires the support of KIVA so he will comply with all the requirements to access to his scholarship-credit of Colfuturo Foundation. After finishing his studies, Camilo wants to return home and begin conducting his own films.

Here is his story: Movies have been one of the major influences in my life. Since childhood, I was attracted to horror films that my parents forbade me to see, but which I still saw. This passion began to turn into a desire not only to be a fan but also a producer of this type of artistic pieces. That is how I decided to become an audiovisual producer. Although my family didn't have the financial support needed to achieve it, I strived to search official announcements and scholarships to help me to achieve my dream.

The creativity development and implementation of new tools to build quality audiovisual products is something that is evolving faster and faster and a professional career is not enough to keep up with world-class filmmakers. That's why my biggest wish right now is to pursue a master's program in film directing in one of the best schools of the industry in the world. This opportunity would expand my horizons as a director and would allow me to have a broader perspective to national productions and why not, also to help in the educational process of the new generation of Colombian filmmakers.

loans.use: to pay for his application for a master in film production and direction.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es: El Sr. Agapito  tiene 57 años, se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Agapito va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Agapito va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su familia, el Sr. Agapito es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Agapito is 57 years old.  He works in construction and remodeling residences.  He is a masonry contractor.  He lives in the town of El Torno.  

This loan is his first one with the institution.  Agapito is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle because it will allow him to perform his job in an efficient manner.  He has contracts to complete and it will allow him to move quickly to his jobs because he has long distances to travel.  His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his work.  Agapito is going to use the benefits to buy household appliances for his family.  

Agapito is a hard worker and he feels happy for the opportunity afforded by the granting of the loan because this is his only activity which allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Africano

texts.en: Africano is a 53-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a canteen business for seven years. His main customers are from a church congregation and the nearby schools. He also works at the church as an adminstrator. With his income, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business to new areas, despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Africano is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, salt, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de William su esposo. Producto de su amor nació sus hijos: Amir y Johan, a los que cuida en su casa propia. Estudió la carrera de trabajo social en una universidad reconocida, desea poder sacar su título para poder ejercer su carrera, pero como es una mujer con mucha iniciativa comenzó a incursionar en los trabajos eventuales para el estado, con documentación en diversos proyectos sociales. Más su principal ingreso económico se sustenta en la crianza de animales, como cerdos, cuyes y ovejas, a los que cría y alimenta para después venderlos a un mayor precio. Ya la conocen y tiene clientes fijos, de los cuales obtiene ganancias estables. Asimismo, por las tardes comenzó a vender comida a 4 personas, quienes la pagan por la alimentación completa del día. Obtiene buenas ganancias, pues utiliza la carne de sus mismos animales. Es el crédito número 23 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación “señor de reley”, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas.
Angélica invertirá el dinero en la compra de un cerdo y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en: Angelica, 38 years old, is a very hard working woman.  She lives with her husband William.  As a result of their love, they have two children, Amir and Johan, who she takes care of in her own home.  She studied social work at a known university and wants to get certified so that she can practice in her field.  Since she is a woman with a lot of initiative, she started to perform temporary work for the state in various social projects.  Also, the main activity that support her is the raising of animals, such as pigs, guinea pigs and sheep, which she raises and feeds to later sell at a higher price.  She is well known and has regular customers from whom she gets a stable income.  Additionally, in the afternoons she has started to sell meals to 4 persons, who pay her for the whole day's food.  She makes good money because she uses the meat from her own animals.  This is her 23rd loan with MFP, and has a good knowledge of group credit even though in many instances there have been difficulties that have strengthened her confidence in the "Señor de reley" group.  She is now renewing her agreement to continue to pay her installments on time.  Angelica will use the loan to purchase a pig and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy a pig and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives in Kapan town with her husband and two children. She works as an accountant at the village hall of neighbouring Norashen village. In addition, she helps her husband with beekeeping. 

Currently they keep 15 colonies of bees. Lilit would like to purchase 18 more colonies of bees. This will allow her to gather more honey and earn additional income from its sales. 

The loans will help Lilit also buy special medicine for beehives which will help her to prevent them from getting diseases.

loans.use: to pay for 18 colonies of bees and medicine for the beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase breads, meat, potatoes, cheese, oil, and sausages.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a bar from a shop that she rents on a retail basis. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer, soda and other soft drinks. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business to a fully stocked pub in the future. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer, and soda and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Joiakim

texts.en:
Joiakim is 27 years old and from the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with a 2-year-old son. 

He is a farmer who grows rice and is also engaged in a transportation business with his tricycle. This has been his source of income for two years now. He wanted to give his child a better future; that's why he works hard on his businesses. 

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tires, fertilizer, and pay for labor. Farming success is attributed to the use of fertilizer for a better yield on crops. 

His profit will then be use to finance his child’s schooling and future savings.

loans.use: to buy tires, fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 60 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Juan con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos Juan Luis, al que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 35 años. Desde hace 23 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales menores como cuyes, cerdos, pollos; esto le permitió capitalizar y comprar ganado vacuno las que producen la leche que diariamente vende a las distintas ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños a su localidad y también los fines de semana en las ferias ganaderas,  se abastece de animales de una granja a la que acude con frecuencia y también  toma de sus propios animales. En algunas ocasiones su hijo le apoya en este negocio en sus tiempos libres, esta actividad le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y sostener los gastos que se requiere en su hogar, a pesar de las dificultades cuando las ventas son bajas. Su  capacidad para las ventas le ha ayudado bastante para convencer a sus clientes concretar sus ventas, ahora quiere para el futuro  aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es el crédito número 15 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación “señor de reley”, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas.
María, invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla de alfalfa y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
