María is 60 years old and a fighter. She lives with her husband Juan with whom she has seven children. Only one of them, Juan Luis, lives with them. She takes care of him in the house she inherited from her parents 35 years ago. 

She has been engaged in agricultural work and sales of minor species such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens for 23 years. This helped her to capitalize and to buy cattle that produce milk, that she sells daily in various trade fairs in the surrounding villages to her town. Also, on weekends in the livestock fairs, she gets supplied with animals from a farm where she goes often, and she also takes some of her own animals.   

Sometimes, her son helps her in the business in his spare time. This activity has allowed her to educate her children and to support the costs required for her household despite difficulties when sales are low. Her ability to sales helped to convince her clients to realize their sales. For the future, she now wants to increase her working capital. 

This is her credit number 15 with MFP. She has a good understanding of group lending even though many times she encountered difficulties. That helped to strengthen confidence with her association "señor de reley". Today she renews her commitment to continue being punctual in her installments. 

María will invest the money in buying alfalfa seeds and balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seed and balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab, age 36, is married and has three children. She lives in a village in the Kwale County, in the coastal region of Kenya. 

Two years ago, Zainab decided to have her own source of income in order to contribute to the household expenses. She sells fish to her neighborhood, which has provided her with good results. The loan she is requesting is for 30,000 KES. She will use it to stock her business with more fish, firewood and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy fish, firewood and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She is a tailor at the market and sells her products on a wholesale and retail basis. Peninah has been in business for the past eight years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Peninah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of cloth to make clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspiration is to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clotjhing materials

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en: Eduard lives in Griboyedov village, Armavir region, with his wife and two sons. The only source of income for the family is farming. Eduard keeps greenhouses, where he grows different types of vegetables. He sells the harvest in local markets. Eduard has applied for this loan to purchase tomato, cucumber and pepper seeds. He will also purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouses. This will allow Eduard to continue growing vegetables during winter and have enough means to invest in farming next year.

loans.use: to buy tomato, cucumber and pepper seeds and polyethylene cover for his greenhouses

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is from San Miguel, Bohol. He is 28 years old, married and has a three-year-old child. Jason is engaged in buying and selling crops like sweet potato, banana, dried fish and vegetables. He has been in this business for five years, earning 2000 PHP a month. He is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of dried fish, banana, sweet potato, taro and other vegetables. He works hard to support his family's needs. He hopes to lift his family's living conditions and save for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of dried fish, banana, sweet potato, taro and other vegetables

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es: Leocadia, de 62 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Félix con quien tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con una de ellas: Yesenia a quién cuidan en la casa que compró hace 35 años. Todos los días trabajan sin descanso para el progreso de su familia, pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura y el trabajo de albañil de su esposo, de donde obtiene el dinero para solventar los gastos y ambiciones del hogar. Los principales sembríos constan de maíz, alfalfa, papa y habas, los cuales cuidan y fertilizan de manera constante. Asimismo crían animales como cuyes, ovejas, conejos y gallinas, los cuales comercializan en cualquier eventualidad. Ahora desean trabajar con mucho esmero pues se encuentran ahorrando para realizar mejoras a su casa y así brindarles un mejor hogar y calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas. Leocadia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su baño y si el dinero le alcanza podrá cambiar su piso de tierra a cemento.
texts.en:
Leocadia is 62 years old, and hard working woman. She lives with her husband Felix and they have five children, of whom only one lives with them: Yesenia, whom they look after in the home they bought 35 years ago.

They worked tirelessly every day for the progress of their family, as they wish to offer them a better quality of life. Their work centers on farming and her husband's construction work, from which they earn the money to meet the expenses and aspirations of their household.

The main crops are corn, alfalfa, potatoes and lima beans, which they look after and fertilize constantly. As well, they raise animals such as guinea pigs, sheep, rabbits and chickens, which they sell whenever they need to.

Now they wish to work their very best, as they are saving to do improvements to their home, and this way offer a better home and quality of life to their children.

This is her second loan with MFP, she thinks highly of group credit, although on many occasions there have been difficulties that have strengthened her confidence in her association. Now she is renewing her commitment to continue making her payments on time.

Leocadia will use the money to buy materials for building her bathroom, and if there is enough money, to change her floor from earth to cement.

loans.use: To buy materials for building her bathroom and installing a cement floor.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pedro y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres desde hace 20 años. Tiene una amplia experiencia de 23 años en las ventas, en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y ha implementado un  pequeño restaurante en el mismo local de sus ventas y recibe la ayuda de su esposo y 2 de sus hijos, en su tienda tiene todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad desde golosinas y abarrotes, en sus inicios  vendía en una caseta ahora   vende  en su casa que le permite mayor comodidad en el desarrollo de su negocio, su esposo y sus hijos  también  aportan significativamente en la atención de este negocio ya que es familiar y una gran oportunidad  en sus ventas es que, esta ubicada en el paradero  de una línea de transportes cuyos chóferes son sus potenciales clientes, también vende carne en su misma tienda y donde en cada oportunidad aprovecha aquellos productos que le son mas rentables. Desea vender  más y ampliar la mercadería de su tienda. Es el crédito número 22 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación “señor de reley”, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas. 
Celia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Celia, who is 48, is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband, Pedro, and their three dependant children in a house she inherited from her parents twenty years ago.  She has 23 years of experience in sales.  Celia now provides the main source of income.  She has installed a small restaurant on the premises of her store where she receives help from her husband and two of her children.  She has all the staples in her store, from candy to groceries.  She used to sell from a stall and now operates out of her home, which is more convenient for developing her business.  Her husband and children also contribute significantly in running the business, which is familiar to them and a great opportunity.  The business is located in the vicinity of a transport line whose drivers are all potential clients.  She also sells meat in her store and products that are likely to be most profitable.  She would like to sell more and expand her store's offerings.  

This is Celia's 22nd loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prismas.  She has a good understanding of group credit.  Although there have been many difficulties along the way, these difficulties have fortified her confidence in her member association "Señor de Reley."  The members have renewed their commitment to continue paying their dues on time.

Celia will invest the money in the purchase of sacks of rice and sugar for her grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, 35, is married and has four children. She lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya. Three years ago, Mwanalima decided to sell dumplings door to door. She mostly does this during the morning hours and then returns to her home to continue with her home activities. People enjoy buying from her because of the delicious products she sells.

Mwanalima is requesting a loan of 25,000 KES to buy wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and food flavors. Her goal is to always have the resources for the daily support of her family so that they can have good opportunities.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil and food flavors.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del barrio San Juan de la ciudad de Encarnación,  surgió por contacto de una de ellas con la Fundación,  trabajan con la fundación desde este año,  se encuentran  en el 2do ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Fabia, ella tiene su despensa en su casa, y cuenta que de a poco y con mucho sacrificio fue creciendo y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de yerba, fideos, arroz, leche, panificados y demás para poder surtir su negocio. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group from the San Juan neighborhood of Encarnación came about through contact between one of the members and the foundation.  They have worked this year with the foundation and are in their second loan cycle.

Fabia is one of the members.  She has a pantry in her house.  She says that little by little and with great sacrifice the business grew and now she has very good customers.

She's requesting the loan to buy yerba mate, pasta, rice, milk, baked goods, and other items to supply her store.

They are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy yerba mate, pasta, rice, milk, baked goods, and other things

loans.name: Asia

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 pesos Asia ha podido resurtir el inventario de su negocio, en el cual vende ropa, accesorios y embutidos. Los embutidos son un nuevo componente en la tienda de Asia. Ha decidido probar por esa vía, pues los embutidos son productos de alta demanda consumidos en la cena en los hogares en República Dominicana. Esto así por que dos de sus tres hijos (23, 20 y 17) han decidido que quieren ir a la universidad, y ella quiere ayudarles. Aunque el menor aun no termina la secundaria, piensa ir apoyando al que tiene 20 años confiando que sus ventas aumentarán para poder cubrir sus gastos.
Asia es casada, su esposo es mensajero en un banco y tienen el propósito futuro de construir su casa en un solar que comparon hace unos años
texts.en:
With a loan of 21,000 pesos [DOP] Asia has been able to restock her inventory in her business, where she sells clothing, accessories, and cold cuts.  The meat is a new component in Asia's store.  She decided to try this because cold cuts are a high-demand product eaten for dinner in households in the Dominican Republic.

She's doing this because two of her three children (ages 23, 20, and 17) have decided that they want to attend the university, and she wants to help them.  Even though the youngest one hasn't finished secondary school, she plans to help the 20-year-old, trusting that her sales will increase to be able to cover her expenses.

Asia is married.  Her husband is a messenger in a bank.  Their goal for the future is to build their house on a plot of land they bought a few years ago.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, underwear, and cold cuts

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua, se caracteriza por tener personas humildes, emprendedoras como es el caso de don Pedro Antonio, un señor de 50 años que ha dedicado la mitad de su vida a laborar para el Ministerio de Salud, tiene gran experiencia en el ramo y gracias a esta labor le ha llevado el pan de cada día a su familia, está luchando para que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales cosa que no pudo lograr él por sus bajos recursos y por ser originario de una comarca alejada del municipio.
Por eso lucha día a día para ser mejor en su trabajo que le permita cumplir sus sueños de ver a sus hijos preparados profesionalmente y que sean lo que él no pudo llegar a ser.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina y pago de consultas médicas, ya que últimamente se ha sentido mal de salud y quiere mejorar por el bien de él y toda su familia.

 espera le otorguen  este crédito y poder realizar estos gastos medicos ya que sin este apoyo no se realizaran muchos sueños y metas.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town located in the western part of Nicaragua known for it modest and enterprising people, such as Pedro Antonio.  He's a 50-year-old man who has dedicated half of his life to working for the Ministry of Health.  He has a lot of experience in the area and thanks to this job he has supported his family every day.  He's striving for his children to be professionals, something he wasn't able to do himself because of his scarce resources and for being from an area far from the city.

This is why he strives every day to be better in his job, which will allow him to achieve his dream of seeing his children become professionals, something he wasn't able to become.

He's requesting a loan to buy medicine and pay for medical consultations because lately he has been feeling ill and he wants to improve himself and his whole family.

He hopes to be granted this loan and be able to pay for the medical expenses because without this support he won't be able to achieve many dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for medical consultations

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: Margarito, tiene 37 años de edad,  vive en una aldea del municipio de Atima, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Don Margarito siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café, ya tiene 7 años realizando sus propias fincas. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El ha solicitado un segundo préstamo con el actual que es por 25,000 lempiras y también lo va invertir en el mantenimiento y siembra de café. Comprara fertilizantes y pago de siembra y limpieza de la finca, para sacar siempre buenas cosechas e incrementar los ingresos. Su meta es cultivar más área de terreno para incrementar la producción y poder apoyar a sus hijos con la educación para que sean profesionales y dedicados al trabajo. Esta agradecido por la oportunidad financiera brindada.
texts.en:
Margarito is 37 years old. He lives in a village in Atima municipality, Santa Barbara, with his wife and their three children. Margarito has always worked in farming; specifically, growing coffee. He has been working on his own plantation for seven years now. 

He sells this production in the local market. He has applied for a second loan, this one for 25,000 lempiras, and is going to use it also to plant and maintain coffee, in order to always obtain good harvests and increase his income. 

His goal is to cultivate a greater area of land, so that he can increase production and be able to help his children with their education. This is so that they can be professionals and have a livelihood. He is grateful for the financial opportunity offered him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, and pay for planting and clearing on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ronaflor

texts.en:
Ronaflor is thirty-six years old and a married woman. She operates a Sari-sari store business in her town for an income.  This business has been in operation for 11 years now.  She sells basic household needs such as soft drinks, snacks, rice, toiletries and seasoning. She is asking for a loan to buy more items for her customers to choose from, like cooking oil, shampoo, sugar, chips, detergent, noodles and eggs. 

Her income will then provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to make a bigger store someday.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, shampoo, sugar, chips, detergent, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Fifty-six year-old Lilia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. While she sells dried fish for an income, her husband also catches crabs for a profit. This has been a good source of income for both of them. For Lilia, she would like to expand her business and earn more income for their needs. She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more fish and crab traps.  She hopes that this loan will help improve their business and help to earn a better income to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and fishing supplies, like crab traps

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 31,500 pesos Rafaela ha podido comprar tela, colcha espuma, zippers, hilos y otros accesorios para su taller de tapicería. Además comprará un mueble y un cochón usado, los cuales reparará y venderá. Rafaela inició su taller hace dos años, buscando un medio de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, pues ya tenía un tiempo desempleada y no lograba obtener un empleo. El es mensajero en una tienda de venta artículos de arte. Juntos tienen 3 hijos de 19, 18 y 14 años.
El deseo de Rafaela es tener un mayor ingreso para tener un taller mejor equipado y poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad.
texts.en:
With a loan of 31,500 pesos [DOP] Rafael has been able to buy fabric, cushions, foam, zippers, thread, and other accessories for her upholstery workshop.  In addition, she's going to buy a piece of furniture and a used mattress, which she'll repair and sell.

Rafaela opened her shop two years ago, looking for a way to help her husband with the household expenses because she had been unemployed for a while and hadn't managed to find another job.  He's a messenger in an art supply store.  Together they have three children, ages 19, 18, and 14.

Rafaela wants to have more income to better equip her workshop and to be able to send her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy materials for her upholstery workshop

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 44-year-old woman.  She is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters.  Her husband and her two sons are workers and earn low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs.
Somaya completed construction of her house and now she wants to completely finish it, so she is requesting a USD loan from Faten to cover the cost of painting her house and installing tiles and windows.

This loan will provide Somaya and her family suitable home conditions.  They will move into their new house soon, before the winter season comes.

loans.use: To finish painting and installing tiles and windows in the house

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine lives in Vosketas village, Aragatsotn region, with her family: husband, parents-in-law, son and 2 daughters. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They raise cows and cultivate wheat and barley. Because of unfavorable weather conditions this year, Narine was not able to gather enough wheat and barley to use as forage for the cattle. Thus, Narine has applied for this loan to purchase wheat, barley and alfalfa to feed the cattle during winter. With the loan's help Narine will also purchase 2 calves. This will permit her to receive more milk and gather additional, income from its sales. Development of cattle breeding is vital for Narine to ensure economical stability and better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, wheat, barley and alfalfa to feed the cattle

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a forty-two year old married man.  He has five children and lives in Kasese,Uganda.
He has been a food vender for twenty years and, with the income earned, he has been able to buy land.  Just like most responsible fathers, he has dreams of educating his children to attain degrees, as a minimum qualification.  He has the challenges of customers not paying on time and high competition. However, his business dream is to own a wholesale shop.  Ernest is requesting the money to buy sugar, soap, water, cooking oil and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, water, rice, cooking oil and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janati  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with five children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a retail shop at the market. She sells her products at retail.  She has been in this business for the past two years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested for a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, bags of sugar, and crates of soda and other soft drinks. She generates additional income through working as a social worker. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations is to expand her business into a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, rice, bags of sugar, and cartons of soda and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en: Sabrine is a 30-year-old married woman, and is a mother for three kids. Her husband owns a fruits and vegetables store. Sabrine started a small business at home selling decoration plants three years ago, and she hoped that by now she would have a separate greenhouse but because of a lack of funding, she couldn't. She decided to take small steps to achieve her goals and applied for this youth loan in order to buy more plants that would increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more plants.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Eleonor is engaged in farming rice in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 9 to 15. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so she can have a bountiful harvest. She knows that the hard work will eventually pay off. The income will be used to buy her children a nutritious diet and pay for school fees so they can continue to go to school. She hopes to be a successful parent by sending them to school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and has been engaged in a piggery business for 10 years now. She is married and supports her 11 year old daughter's needs through this business. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements for her hogs. She works hard for her family to earn a living. Anita dreams of having a good and comfortable life. Her profits will be used for the family's daily living expenses, like food and school fees. 
In the future, she would like to expand her business and add more hogs in her barn for a better income. She is from San Miguel, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, ages 14 to 22. She is currently engaged in a sari-sari store (corner store) business which she has run for 30 years now.

Violeta works hard in order to give support to her husband in meeting their financial needs. However, she lacks the funds or the capital to be used for the improvement of her business. At this time, Violeta is asking for a loan worth 6000 PHP which she will use to buy additional stock or merchandise for her store such as rice, assorted dry goods and groceries.

Violeta believes that if she could be provided with financial support through a loan, she can finally be able to purchase the necessary stock for her business.

In the future, Violeta hopes that she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income for her family's use and for her children's education. She and her family live in Bien Unido, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy rice, assorted dry goods and groceries.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells sweet potatoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cassava and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla lives in Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single mother of one. 

She owns a mobile money transfer shop and has seen a great progress from the initial loan she received. She now plans to tap into the other forms of income-generating activities. She is applying for a loan of KES 62,650 to purchase a laptop, printer, and phone accessories.

loans.use: To purchase a printer, laptop, and phone accesories.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia tiene 50 años de edad,casada y tiene 5 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de tamales,biscochuelos y maicillos que son como pasteles hechos a base de maiz,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en una plaza desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 30 años y le gusta preparar muchos postres,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los tamales,biscochuelos y maicillos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,azucar,manteca y huevos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Julia is 50 years old, is married and has five children. The member is in the business of selling tamales, sponge cakes, and sorghum, which are like cakes made from corn. The member sells as a street vendor in a square from 8:00am to 5:00pm. The member has been in this business for 30 years and she likes to make many desserts. 

The member's dream is to have a place where she can sell tamales, sponge cakes and sorghum. The member is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter, and eggs in bulk. The member is happy for the loan and promises to meet her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet lives in Urut village, Lori region, with his wife and school-age son and daughter. Hamlet is the only breadwinner in the family. He works at a local military unit, as well as running a farm where he raises cows and pigs. Hamlet wants to purchase grass as forage for the cattle, for which he needs sufficient means. This loan will help him to purchase grass, which is important for him to keep gathering stable income from the sales of milk and to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase grass to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Al-Rdha Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rdha, which consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB.

Fairoz lives in a minority community in Taiz, Yemen. She is 23 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She has a small house. She requires a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

This loan will help her to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Melpha

texts.en: Melpha is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, ages 2-12. She and her family live in Bien Unido, Bohol. She is currently engaged in  a sari-sari store (general store) business, which she has run for 12 years now. She also sells clothing for additional income. Melpha dreams of renovating her house. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, nails, hard wood, bamboo matting and clothing to resell. Melpha works hard in order give her children what they need. In the future, she hopes to earn more so she can do better for her family's life, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, hard wood and bamboo matting and clothing.

loans.name: Elba Concepcion

texts.es:
Elva, necesita invertir en su negocio, por eso está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo que le ayudara en la compra de papas, cebolla, tomates, chiles, güisquiles, manzanas, guineos y granos básicos, con esto podrá surtir su negocio para una mejor atención a sus clientes, este credito permitira tener frutos frescos y de calidad.
Ella expresa que gracias al crédito anterior aumento su inventario de venta y logro así la fidelidad de sus clientes y sus ganancias económicas, ella sigue con su negocio para poder sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Elva needs to invest in her business, that's why she is requesting again a loan that will help her to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chili peppers, chayotes, apples, bananas, and basic grains. With this, she will stock her business to better serve her customers.

This loan will allow her to have fresh and quality fruits. She expressed that thanks to the previous loan she increased her inventory and thereby she achieved customer loyalty and financial returns. She continues with her business to get her home ahead.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chili peppers, chayotes, apples, and bananas.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a 40 year old woman who is a mother of five. She lives in Msambweni with her life companion and earns a living through the sale of fish in one of the busy markets. Bahati has good number of regular customers. She sells many types of fish to offer a variety to her customers. She is asking for a loan in order to fulfill the increased demands of her customers. She intends to buy a stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de 39 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de Bertha, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuida en la casa que heredò de sus padres hace 20 años. Desde niño aprendió a sembrar y criar animales. De ahí decidió estudiar agropecuaria en una reconocida universidad. Sus estudios lo pago gracias a su trabajo, pues desde que tenía 16 años comenzó a sembrar toda variedad de hortalizas de raíz, como veterana, zanahoria y de flor, como coliflor, alcachofa y brócoli, es especialista en ello. Sus cosechas los comercializan en el mercado de la ciudad. Pero la actividad que más le gusta es la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 500 ejemplares, su secreto es el manejo de posas, las que separa de acuerdo a la edad y parentesco, cuenta que cada 3 meses aumenta el número de animales. La alimentación de sus cuyes se basa en alfalfa que el mismo siembra, por ello tienen un alto valor nutritivo. Ya lo conocen y constantemente sus clientes le solicitan para vender o comer. Su plan a corto plazo es comprar un cuy de raza macho con 10 hembras para comenzar a criar animales de mayor calidad. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas. Jesús; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de Abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos, ya que comiensa la temporada de siembra.
texts.en: Jesús, 39 years old, is a hard-working man. He lives in the company of Bertha, his wife of 20 years. Together they have 3 small children whom they care for in the house they inherited from their parents 20 years ago. From a young age he learned to farm and raise animals. From there he decided to study agriculture in a renowned university. His studies paid off, as  by the time he was 16 he started planting all varieties of root vegetables like a veteran, such as carrot and for flowering plants cauliflower, artichoke and broccoli which he specializes in. He sells his produce in the city market, but the activity that he likes most is the raising of guinea pigs, of which he has 500. His secret is the management of the females, which he separates according to age and relation. He says that every 3 months he increases the number of animals. The food for the guinea pigs is based on the same planting alfalfa, as it has a high nutritious value. His customers already know him and request him for trade or eating. His short term plan is to buy a male breeding guinea pig and 10 females to start to raise animals of a higher quality. This is his 18th loan with MFP. He has a good concept of the group loan, although on many occasions there have been difficulties that have strengthened the confidence in his association, such that today he renews his promise to continue being punctual with his payments. Jesús will invest the requested funds in the purchase of organic fertilizer to distribute among his crops. The planting season has already begun.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor, vive como un sus dos hermanos mayores de edad, su esposa y su hijo de siete años, sólo su esposa y su hijo dependen de él, Victor realiza el negocio de publicidad estacionario y movil, lo trabaja con un amigo en ocasiones tienen solicitudes de cumpleaños y también de fiestas.

Él solicita un préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento a la consola mantenimiento a todo el equipo publicitario, ya que como se realiza la publicidad móvil, este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar su equipo y a tener más capacidad en el sonido.

Su Sueño es poder crecer económicamente con su negocio, adelantar los estudios de su hijo y ofrecerles todo lo necesario en el hogar.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with two adult siblings, his wife, and their seven-year-old son. He only supports his wife and child. Víctor works in the stationary and mobile advertising business. He works with a friend. Sometimes they get requests for birthday parties and other celebrations.

He is requesting a loan so that he can maintain his console and the rest of his advertising equipment. Since he works in mobile advertising, this loan will help him upgrade his equipment and have better sound capability. 

His dream is to be able to expand his business financially, invest in his son's education, and provide for his household.

loans.use: to maintain his advertising sound equipment.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is 29 years old and lives together with her life partner Athman, and her two children. 

She works selling vegetables and fruits. She has been working in this field for three years, and this has granted her lots of experience in sales, which permits her to obtain better income. She sells in the market of her town in her stall.  She has lots of regular customers who prefer her because everything she sells is of high quality at accessible prices, but above all they prefer her for her excellent service. 

Mwatime is an entrepreneurial woman, with a great desire to get ahead. She is always looking for new opportunities that will permit her to achieve the success that she so greatly desires. Like all good business people, she wants to grow her business and to make a new investment, but in order to do that she needs capital which will support her. 

For this reason she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Yehu, which will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, kale, and cabbages. 

Mwatime has good credit references and is very responsible. She assures us that she will pay back the debt, and at the same time she is confident that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, kale, and cabbages.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is still managing his business. Thanks to his business, he is able to support his family. With his previous Kiva loan, Arman bought a new multifunctional tool for his brick activity.

Now he is asking for a 150.000 AMD to buy angle grinding machines and a drill with mixer for his business.

loans.use: to buy angle grinding machines and a drill with mixer for his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 34-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 3, 8 and 11. She supports their needs by operating a Sari-sari store (small convenience store). This business has been in existence for seven years now. Maria is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, and snack food. She hopes that someday, she can send all her children to school. Her profit will be used for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, and snack food.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 68 años vive en la compañía de su esposa Guillermina, con quien tiene 4 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 40 años. Hace mas de 23 años se dedica a realizar bellos bordados típicos de los pueblos aledaños a su zona, trabaja generalmente en las noches en su casa ya que en el día cuida de sus animales, de esta manera ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos a lo largo de sus años, trabaja junto a su esposa y comparte esta labor que los une hasta ahora, los trabajos que realiza son mediante encargo de sus clientes que solicitan de sus trabajos cada semana y después de un mes de trabajo viaja a repartir  las faltas bordadas  a sus clientes que retribuyen económicamente y compensa lo invertido. Reconoce que por el paso de los años ya no tiene esa misma fortaleza física y por eso demora un poco más en producir sus bordados, sin embargo ha perfeccionado  en la calidad y los acabados de los mismos y eso mantiene la fidelidad de sus clientes en seguir solicitando de su producción. Es el crédito número 11 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación “señor de reley”, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas. Juan, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos por cantidad para el bordado de sus faldas.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 68, lives with his wife Guillermina. Together they have four children, and he takes care of them at the home he bought forty years ago. For over 23 years, he has worked making beautiful traditional embroidery from the surrounding villages in his area. He generaly works at night at home, because during the day he tends to his animals. This has allowed him to improve his income over the years. He works along with his wife and their work is a bond they share to this day. He receives orders from customers every week and after a month of labor he travels and delivers the embroidered skirts to his customers who then compensate him financially and he obtains a return on his investment.  

He admits that his physical strength is no longer what it used to be, which is why it is taking him a bit longer to sew his embroidery. However, he has perfected its quality and finish and that keeps his customers coming back and ordering his products. 

This is his 11th loan with MFP. He understands group loans well and his trust in his communal bank "Señor de Reley" has become stronger through much adversity. Today he renews his promise to continue making his payments on time. Juan will invest the money in purchasing supplies in bulk for embroidering his skirts.

loans.use: to purchase thread and yarn for embroidery.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! La Sra. Norma es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Quiere al Niño”, un grupo conformado por 9 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Norma se dedica a la venta de plásticos al por mayor desde hace 11 años, esta mercadería está destinada para provincia, es decir vende plásticos a diferentes departamentos del Perú.

Norma ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar plásticos, por que hoy en día tiene clientes del interior del país que le solicitan este producto. Su sueño es un día tener un puesto propio, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Norma es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Norma ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos van a la escuela , ha construido su casa , se ha comparado un terreno. Norma está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  

Norma is a member of the “Quiere al Niño” (Love the Child) communal bank, a nine-member group in a variety of commercial activities.  Norma has been selling plastics at wholesale for the last 11 years.  Her merchandise is destined for the provinces, that is, she sells it in various departments in Peru.  

Norma has requested the loan to buy plastics because at present she has customers in the interior of the country who request this product.  Her dream is to have a stand of her own someday to better tend to her customers.

Norma has a spouse and six children.  Thanks to her effort and dedication Norma has earned increased income and her children attend school; she’s built her house and bought a piece of land.  Norma is very happy with this loan and is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plastics.

loans.name: Raida

texts.es:
Raida, de 49 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañìa de Màximo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Jose Luis y Crsitian a quienes cuida en la casa que compraròn desde hace 20 años. Sus dìas se centran en el trabajo continuo, su principal actividad econòmica se centra en la ganadería, posee 9 vacas de las cuales extrae un promedio de 40 litros de leche diarios. Los cuales vende a un lechero reconocido, por lo que diariamente obtiene un considerable monto econòmico que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Su secreto es el apoyo constante que recibe de su esposo, quien siempre la apoya, “juntos decidimos sembrar avena y alfalfa para alimentar a nuestros animales, de esa manera ahorramos en alimentaciòn y podemos brindarle lo mejor”, comenta. Pero como es una mujer de campo también se dedica  a la agricultura sembrando olluco, papa y demás tubérculos, los cuales vende en ocaciones y lo utilisa para consumo. Es el crédito número 9 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas.
Raida, invertirà el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico por cantidad, un promedio de 400 sacos para la siembra de avena, rey gras y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Raida, 49, is an unassuming woman living with Máximo, her husband.  They have seven children but only two of them still live with her: José Luis and Cristian who she cares for in the house she bought twenty years ago.

Her days are centered on continuous work.  Her main economic activity is centered on animal husbandry.  She owns nine cows she gets an average of 40 liters of milk daily from that she sells to a well-known dairyman.  She earns considerable daily income thereby that helps her cover household expenses.  Her secret is the constant support she gets from her husband who always supports her.  “We decided together to plant oats and alfalfa to feed our animals to save on feed costs and provide the best for them,” she comments.  

However, since she’s a woman of the land, she also works in agriculture growing olluco [an Andean tuber], potatoes and other tubers that she sells sometimes and also uses for home consumption.

This is MFP loan #9.  She has a good impression of group loans even though there have been occasional difficulties that have served to strengthen her trust in her association.  Today, she renews her pledge to continue being punctual with her installment payments.

Raida will use the requested money to buy organic manure in quantity, an average of 400 sacks, for the oats, ryegrass and alfalfa crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure in quantity.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 57 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo León con quien tiene 6 hijos, todos ellos independientes. Ahora vive con una de sus hijas, su esposo y su nieto en la casa que heredaron hace 20 años. Su día se centra en diversas actividades, a una hora de caminata quedan sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra quinua, alverja, habas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Las cuales cuida con la ayuda de su esposo quien le enseñó todo lo que sabe de la agricultura. Cuando cosecha las verduras, los vende a la capital del país Lima, pero las demás cosechas en conjunto con los granos verdes que compra los vende al mercado de la ciudad de Jauja, donde comercializa 2 veces por semana, siendo este su principal actividad económica y donde obtiene mayores ingresos. Los demás días de la semana los dedica a cuidar sus animales pues posee vacas, cuyes, cerdos y burros. De las vacas obtiene la leche que comercializa todos los días. Es el crédito número 10 con MFP, tiene un buen concepto del crédito grupal aunque en muchas ocasiones hayan existido  dificultades que han fortalecido la confianza  en su asociación, que hoy renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas.
Victoria, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de granos verdes para la venta, además de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos y comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Victoria, 57, is a cheerful woman.  She lives in the company of her husband, León, with whom she has six children, all independent now.  One of her daughters, her husband and grandson live with her in the house she inherited 20 years ago.  

Her day centers on various activities.  Her fields are a one-hour walk away.  She grows quinoa, peas, lima beans, corn and other vegetables there.  She cares for them with help from her husband who taught her everything he knows about agriculture.  When she harvests vegetables she sells them in Lima, the nation’s capital, but she sells the other crops added to green grains she buys in the marked in Jauja twice a week.  This is her main economic activity and where she earns the most income.

The rest of the days of the week she spends caring for her animals because she owns cows, guinea pigs, pigs and donkeys.  She gets milk from the cows that she sells every day.

This is her tenth MFP loan.  She has a good impression of group loans even though there have been occasional difficulties that have strengthened her confidence in her association.  Today, she renews her commitment to continue being punctual with her installment payments.

She will use the money to buy sacks of green grains to sell as well as natural fertilizer for her crops and feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy sacks of green grains to sell as well as natural fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Sunde

texts.en:
Sunde is 20 years old. She is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 2. She is engaged in raising hogs, while her husband usually leaves home to work as a carpenter.

Sunde works hard on her business so that she can provide for her family. She dreams of having a good and comfortable life for her family. She is now requesting a loan to buy feed and piglets so that she can improve her business. Her profits will be used for the family's daily living expenses.
In the future, she would like to expand her business and make her barn bigger.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is from Karahunj village, Syunik region. Armida lives with her husband and two sons. The family is involved in agriculture: they raise cows and cultivate potato and beans. Armida would like to start growing garlic, for which she needs sufficient means. With the help of this loan, she will purchase garlic seeds. Armida also wants to purchase a cow, as well as grass to feed the cattle.

Development of agriculture will allow Armida to earn more income and to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, garlic seeds and grass for the cattle.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, de 30 años es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá a la que cuida en la casa de ella desde que nació. Todas las mañanas se levante muy temprano, pues tiene que trabajar con su auto trasportando a la gente a diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a él es tener su propio trabajo, velando por su progreso y desarrollo. Además ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar, pues aunque sea soltero, ayuda a sus padres y hermanos. Por esa razón trabaja sin descanso, incluso durante toda la noche, en especial los fines de semana, donde tiene mayores ganancias. Ahora el desea mejorar la calidad de su auto, pues ello le ayudará a no gastar en repuestos y demás problemas que aquejan al funcionamiento de su carro. Por otro lado agradece el apoyo de su asociación pues gracias a ello ahora tiene un nuevo auto a gas, cuidando el medio ambiente y ahorrando en su economía, pues cuenta menos que el petróleo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta contento, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, pues se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación.
Alexander; invertirá el dinero en pagar los trámites de su licencia de conducir, que tendrá un nivel mayor para el trasporte.
texts.en:
Alexander, 30, is a single, hardworking man.  He lives with his mother who he cares for in the house he’s lived in since he was born.  Every morning he rises very early because he has to work with his car providing transportation for people in various parts of the city.  What he likes best is having his own job and watching over his progress and development.  He also helps to cover household expenses.  Despite being single, he helps his parents and siblings.  Because of this, he works tirelessly, even all night, especially on weekends when profits are best.

He wants to improve his car’s quality now because he’d save on repair costs and other problems that arise with his car’s functioning.  On the other hand, he is grateful for the support from his association because thanks to it he now has a new gas powered car which protects the environment and saves him money because it’s less expensive than gasoline.

He belongs to the “Rompiendo Fronteras” (Breaking down Borders) and this is his fourth MFP loan.  He’s happy because he’ll have financial support and will feel more confident about making progress at work.  He promises to make his installment payments.  Besides, he enjoys being a member of his association.

Alexander will use the money to pay driver’s license fees which will lead to a higher level of transport.

loans.use: to get his driver's license.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
Frank, de 20 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito del tambo; en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que quiere mucho. A base de esfuerzo y entusiasmo este ejemplar joven, comenzó a estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad del estado. Sus días se centran en diferentes actividades, una de ellas es el trabajo como “taxista”, con un auto que adquirió gracias a su trabajo. Cuenta que se siente algo cansado, púes tiene que compartir su tiempo con sus estudios,  tareas de la universidad y su trabajo. Pero ese esfuerzo es recompensado, pues será dentro de algunos años todo un ingeniero, “que se formó solo”, como él orgulloso comenta. Ahora desea reparar por completo su auto y así trabajar sin preocupación.  Él pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta contento, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, pues se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación.
Frank, invertirá el dinero solicitado en el mantenimiento su auto para poder trabajar sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Frank, 20, is a young worker.  He lives in his own house located in El Tambo district with his parents and siblings who he loves very much.  Based on his effort and enthusiasm, this exemplary young man started to study a professional career at the state university.  His days are centered on various activities.  One of them is working as a taxi driver with a car he acquired thanks to his work.  He relates that he feels somewhat tired because he has to share his time with his studies, his university homework and his work.  But the effort has its reward because in a few years he’ll be a self-made engineer like he proudly says.

He’d like to completely repair his car to work worry-free.  He belongs to the “Rompiendo Fronteras” (Breaking down Borders) communal bank and this is his third MFP loan.  He’s happy because he’ll have financial support because he’ll feel more confident about advancing in his work that way.   He promises to make his installment payments.  Besides, he enjoys being part of his association.

Frank will use the requested money to service his car in order to work worry-free.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Titogbe Group

texts.fr: TITOGBE est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Bernadette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvestre. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix années que Bernadette mène comme activité la vente des légumes de façon ambulante afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage. Bernadette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Bernadette sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe TITOGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Titogbe is a 5-person group, whose members reside in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Bernadette, is raising her hand in the picture. She is 36 years old and married to Sylvestre. The couple has three dependent children, who all go to school. Bernadette lives together with her husband and her children.

Bernadette has been a street vendor of vegetables for ten years in order to contribute to the household's expenses. Bernadette is passionate about her business, which allows her to provide for herself and her children. She procures her vegetables from a market in Benin. Looking to satisfy her clients, Bernadette is requesting a fourth joint loan with the other members of group Titogbe. This loan will allow them to better meet consumer demand and to increase their profit. Previous loans have been repaid without issues.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en: Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and four go to school. She has two additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a jerycan of cooking oil, green bananas, flour, sugar and serving utensils. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge so that she can start selling soft drinks. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, flour, sugar and serving utensils.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga, de 59 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Felipe, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Janet y Ruth, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la crianza de vacas, posee un total de 15 ejemplares, además de ovejas de buena calidad. Gracias a la producción de leche que obtiene, puede elaborar queso en cantidad, por lo que comenzó a dedicarse al negocio venta de queso y carne a la capital del país, donde viaja una vez por semana, pues tiene muchos clientes y la demanda incrementa constantemente. “Me va muy bien en mi trabajo, pues existen días en las que no me abastezco con mi propia producción y tengo que comprar a otros ganaderos”, afirma. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “virgen de Fátima”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Dominga, invertirá el dinero en la compra de queso y carne por cantidad; para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Dominga, 59, is a cheerful woman. She lives in company of her husband, Felipe, with whom she has five children but only two of them still live with them: Janet and Ruth who she cares for in a house she’s rented for two years.

Her economic activity is raising cows.  She owns 15 plus some good quality sheep.  Thanks to the milk production she gets she can make cheese in quantity so she started to work in the business of selling cheese and meat in the nation’s capital where she travels to once a week because she has many customers and demand is constantly on the rise.  “I do very well in my work because there are days when my own production is insufficient and I have to buy from other cattlemen,” she affirms.

This is her fourth MFP loan.  She’s been punctual and responsible all this time and she enjoys being a member of the “Virgen de Fátima” communal bank composed of supportive people with enterprising spirits.  Dominga will use the loan to buy cheese and meat in quantity to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and meat.

loans.name: Rosemonde's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Rosemonde la responsable est âgée de 30ans. Mariée et mère de 03enfants scolarisés dans une école de la place. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 14ans et 10ans. Elle commercialise des pagnes et de divers depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'élargir son commerce et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Rosemonde a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Rosemonde se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who are taking a solidarity loan together, offering mutual guarantee to each other.

The representative of the group, Rosemonde, is 30 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children who attend a local school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 14 and 10 years old respectively.  

Rosemonde has been selling "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and various other goods for a few years, stocking up at a market in Benin.

Eager to expand her business, and to be able to meet her customers' demand, Rosemonde has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

Rosemonde is the woman featured on the left-hand side in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ten "pagnes", five boxes of sardines and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita, de 55 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Marcial, con quien tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos: Marco y Michel, a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió de una empresa hace 20 años. En ese tiempo, pertenecio entonces a un proyecto ganadero, por lo que capto todo el conocimiento para obtener una buena crianza de animales. Es por esa razón que en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de vacas, posee 15 ejemplares, las cuales cuida con mucho esmero, además de ovejas de calidad. Su principal trabajo se centra en alimentarlas para que brinden una buena leche, pues gracias a ella elabora queso que vende a buen precio en su mismo pueblo, que es reconocido por la buena calidad de productos lácteos que poseen. Ahora desea seguir mejorando la calidad de sus animales, para obtener una mejor ganancia. Este es el crédito número 16 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “virgen de Fátima”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Edita, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Edita, 55, is an unassuming woman living in the company of her husband, Marcial, with whom she has six children only two of which still live with them: Marco and Michel who she cares for in the house she bought from a firm 20 years ago.  

At that time, she was part of a great livestock project where she learned all the knowledge necessary to raise animals well.  Because of that, she currently raises cows with much dedication; she currently has 15 of them.  She also owns quality sheep.  Her main activity centers on feeding them so that they will produce good milk because thanks to it she makes cheese that she sells at a good price in her town which is well-known for the good quality of dairy products it has.  Now, she wants to continue improving the quality of her animals in order to earn higher profits.

This is her 16th MFP loan.  In all this time she’s been responsible and punctual and she enjoys belonging to the “Virgen de Fátima” communal bank composed of mutually supportive people with an enterprising spirit.  Edita will use the money to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, de 48 años, es madre soltera. Cuida de su hijo Jeanpier en casa de sus padres, donde vive desde hace 20 años. Su principal característica es su vitalidad y ganas por salir adelante. Los años no pasan en ella, pues necesita tener todas las fuerzas para sacar adelante a su hijo, que es un niño con muchas habilidades. Por ello desea brindarle una buena educación; su principal actividad económica es la venta de ropa al por mayor y menor. “Antes tenía una tienda de comestibles pero no tenía mucha ganancias, por eso decidí cerrar”, comenta. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en la venta ropa y asimismo productos de belleza. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir clientes fijos quienes realizan los pedidos que Adela trae de la ciudad de Tacna donde compra las prendas de vestir a mitad de precio, por lo que este negocio le trae muchas ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Adela; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de casacas de cuero de toda variedad, precio y color para continuar con su venta.
texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old and a single mother. She takes care of her son Jeanpier in her parents' house, where she lives for 20 years. Her main feature is her vitality and the desire to get ahead. She hasn't aged a bit, because she needs all the strength to get her son ahead, who is a child with many skills. For this reason, she wants to give him good education. 

Her main economic activity is the sale of clothing wholesale and retail. "I used to have a grocery store but I didn't have much income, that's why I decided to close", she says. She already has five years of experience selling clothes and also beauty products. During this time, she managed to get regular customers who place orders that Adela brings to the city of Tacna where she buys the clothing at half price, so this business has a lot of profits. 

She belongs to the solidarity group "rompiendo fronteras" [breaking frontiers] and this is her loan number eight with MFP. She hopes to get its collaboration to continue with her goals. On the other had, she promises to meet installment payments. Also, she likes to be part of an association because all its members are responsible and supportive people. 

Adela will invest the money requested in buying leather jackets of all variety, price and color to continue selling them.

loans.use: to buy leather jackets of all variety, price and color.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que necesita capital para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas, como lo son quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, aceite, cebolla, repollo, salsas, chocolate y mas, así poder mantenerse con su negocio.
Ella consideta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio negocio, en la compra de materiales para hacer las pupusas, Cecilia sigue con su negocio para poder salir adelante en su hogar económicamente, brindandole lo necesario.
texts.en:
Cecilia’s asking for a new loan because she needs capital to buy raw materials like string cheese, pork, corn, oil, onions, cabbage, sauces, chocolate, etc. to make pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and stay in business.

She feels that her previous loan helped her strengthen the business through the purchase of ingredients to make pupusas.  Cecilia continues with her business in order to get ahead at home economically providing what’s needed for it.

loans.use: to buy string cheese, pork, corn, oil, onions and cabbage.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Adelaida, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de golosinas en su carreta ambulante ubicada en la puerta de una de las universidades de la ciudad, Adelaida en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como Dulces, galletas, chocolates goma de mascar y bebidas gaseosas para capitalizar su actividad.
Adelaida trabaja mucho y se sacrifica para pagarle los estudios superiores a la menor de sus hijas, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y  una mejor educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is a very hardworking woman who is continuing with her business selling snacks from a cart in a location that is at the entrance of one of the city's universities.  

At this time, Adelaida is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by purchasing merchandise such as sweets, cookies, chocolates, chewing gum, and soft drinks.  

Adelaida works hard and sacrifices herself to pay for the college expenses of her youngest daughter.  She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life, and her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cookies, chocolates, chewing gum and soft drinks

loans.name: Carlos Nelson

texts.es:
Carlos, necesita mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder reparar su vehículo para poder continuar prestando un buen servicio de taxi y poder sostener a su familia económicamente.
El  comenta que gracias al crédito anterior mejoro la calidad de atención a sus clientes y en su familia tiene una mayor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos needs to improve the condition of his vehicle, so he is requesting a new loan to finance repairs to his vehicle.  This way, he can continue to provide good taxi services and support his family financially.

He comments that thanks to the previous loan, he improved the quality of service he provides to his customers and his family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of six who runs a green grocery stall, which has been operating for the last four years. He sells vegetables and cereals. 
Said started the business with his salary. He joined Milango to access credit for further business expansion and is applying for a loan of 36,700 Kenya shillings to purchase additional food to sell, such as tomatoes and potatoes.
Said’s future ambition is to own other shops. The challenges he needs to overcome are the high cost of transportation and the low seasons. The extra income from the loan will help him pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional food such as tomatoes and potatoes for his food stall.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en:
Jana is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and runs a green grocery stall that has been operating for the last four years. He sells vegetables and cereals. He began the business with the savings from his employment. He intends to diversify into the transport business, which has proved quite lucrative. Jana joined Milango to access credit for further business expansion, and he is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle. He believes that the income from the current business and from the future/intended business can repay the loan.

Jana’s future ambition is to open other shops. He needs to overcome the challenges of high cost of transportation and the low seasons. The extra income from the loan will also help him pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and start a transport business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a father of three school-going children. He owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business he has been operating for twelve years. Besides this, Fred owns a motorcycle and is active in the transport industry. He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is inflation. Fred is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenyan shillings to expand his business by buying some more clothes to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. His plan for the future is to sell in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy some more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: Con su previo credikiva, Diana incrementó sus ventas y mejoró sus ingresos, porque compró todo lo que su clientela le había solicitado, como utensilios en plásticos para el hogar, que son los principales productos de su oferta. En la actualidad esta muy entusiasmada y aplica a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual adecuara su carretilla y comprará otros articluos plásticos, para que su hermano trabaje también y genere sus propios ingresos; inversión que será exitosa, porque esta ajustada allá necesidad de un mercado al cual no ha llegado con productos buenos y muy económicos. Su mensaje a sus financiadoress de Kiva " estoy muy agradecida, he aprendido a manejar un crédito y mi negocio, espero me apoyen nuevamente."
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Diana increased her sales and improved her earnings because she purchased everything her customers requested, such as plastic household utensils, which are the main products she offers. At the moment, she is very excited about applying for a new Kiva loan. She plans to acquire a cart and purchase additional plastic goods. Her brother also works and generates his own income.

This investment will be successful because there is a need in the marketplace for good products that are affordable. Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: “I am extremely grateful for having learned how to manage a loan and my business. I hope you will support me once again.”

loans.use: to acquire a vending cart and to purchase additional plastic goods.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 37 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Magno, con quien tuvo 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Eli, a la que cuidan en la casa que compró hace 15 años. Durante las mañanas se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño puesto que acondicionó al frente de su casa. Le va muy bien en su negocio pues también aprovecha vender el queso que elabora gracias a la leche que produce sus vacas. Pues la principal actividad económica de Eva, es la crianza de vacas y ovejas en cantidad, esto lo desarrolla gracias a la ayuda de su esposo, quien los alimenta y pasta en las alturas diariamente. Ahora desea seguir con el mejoramiento de sus animales, para obtener buenos resultados. Este es el crédito número 15 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “virgen de Fátima”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Eva, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eva, age 37, is a modest woman. She lives in the company of her husband Magno, with whom she had three children. Of their children only one, Eli, lives with them, and they look after him in the house that she bought 15 years ago. 

In the mornings she sells basic goods in a small shop that she set up in the front of her house. Her business is going very well for her, so she takes advantage to sell the cheese she makes, thanks to the milk produced by her cows. Actually Eva's primary economic activity is raising a lot of cows and sheep. She's developed this activity with the help of her husband, who feeds them and takes them to graze in the heights daily. 

Now she wants to continue improving her animals in order to get better results. This is loan number 15 with MFP; in all this time she's shown herself to be punctual and responsible. Above all she likes belonging to her group "Virgen de Fátima" [Our Lady of Fátima], which is made up of supportive people with entrepreneurial spirits. 

Eva will invest the money in the purchase of feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Bum-Ayush

texts.en:
Mrs. Bum-Ayush is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in her old house, which has thin wooden walls, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She works as a vendor in the largest informal market in the city, usually selling sports boots. She has been renting a counter there for three years. Before entering this business, she was a seamstress. 
Her husband is a taxi driver, and his working days begin at six o’clock in the morning, when he takes his wife and children to their schools and the market. Bum-Ayush told us that standing at the counter is hard work for a woman, especially in the winter, but it is more profitable than her previous job. Every month she needs to go to the closest border with China, about two days away by train, to buy goods. Her old house is in incredibly bad condition. Every winter, she must burn 10 tons of coal to stay warm, while other families use only 2-4 tons. Burning more coal burning releases more harmful gas and dust into the atmosphere. Bum-Ayush, like every mother, loves her children, so she is planning to thicken her house walls, using materials such as cement, bricks, and glass-wool insulation, in order to stop the heat loss through the walls. So, Bum-Ayush is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to thicken her house walls.

loans.use: to thicken the walls of her house, using materials such as cement, brick, and glass-wool insulation, in order to lower the family's consumption of coal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water cans, basins, sets of dinning plates, cups and cooking items.

loans.name: Lodi

texts.en:
Lodi is a 33-year-old father of two young children, 3 and 1 years old, who lives with his family in the very rural north of Albania. He is the only financial provider for the family and the caretaker for his elderly parents. He is busy every day, all day long, and this lifestyle keeps him content, he explained.
Lodi has a livestock business, including animals like cows, goats and sheep, and he has a large clientele throughout his region and central Albania. He sells milk to dairy farms and also baby animals to the local market. 
The loan of 300,000 Albanian Lek that Lodi is requesting from VFA is to build a stable for his goats.  He has separated the animals and already build separate stables for the cows and sheep, and now he wants to do the same for the goats.
His goal is to employ others as he expands his business, and this will happen soon, Lodi says.

loans.use: to build a goat stable.

loans.name: Tinga

texts.en: Tinga is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He runs a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables, and is also employed as a mechanic. Tinga was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. His main challenge is recovering the debts accrued by some customers who receive his goods on credit. His difficulties notwithstanding, Tinga looks forward to opening other branches of his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
